story:
La Historia

Isham Arte Consciente nace con el propósito de generar un despertar de consciencia a través del arte en conjunto. Ningún elemento en la Naturaleza trabaja solo, todo es en conjunto; del mismo modo, el movimiento Isham invita a involucrarse a las diferentes corrientes artísticas de manera consciente con esta expresión multidisciplinaria, para llevar un mensaje de paz y unidad, al poner nuestros talentos de manera conjunta al servicio de los demás; de ese modo se recrea la expansión, la abundancia y la belleza.

El Propósito

Esta campaña tiene como propósito recaudar los fondos necesarios para continuar haciendo posible este sueño que ya ha sido realidad en la ciudad de Morelia, Michoacán México. Nuestra intención es compartir esta bella experiencia, mostrándola a todo el mundo. Las esculturas llegan en blanco a cada país y son pintadas por artistas de cada región, así la obra es nueva y fresca, pero en sincronicidad de intenciones y con el toque artístico singular de cada quien.

El Impacto

Con estas exposiciones por todo el mundo, el movimiento Isham Arte Consciente, logra inspirar a todo aquél que entra en contacto con las obras de arte, dejando una semilla de consciencia en su corazón, sobre todo en los niños; mediante el ejemplo de poner los talentos al servicio de los demás. Logrando un verdadero cambio social.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Para realizar este sueño Se necesitan $20,000.00 dólares norteamericanos.

¿En qué se invertirá todo este dinero?

Incluye:

  • Costo de fabricación de 30 esculturas y sus bases de madera.
  • Transportación terrestre desde Guadalajara, Jalisco México hasta el Puerto de Veracruz.
  • Transportación marítima desde Veracruz Puerto a La Habana y finalmente a Santiago de Cuba.
  • Elementos audiovisuales al momento del evento, mamparas, lonas, textos informativos, cédulas de las obras, catálogo de la exposición (libro).
  • Elaboración de al menos un video documental.
  • Insumos para que los pintores realicen la obra.
  • Viáticos para el equipo Isham desde México a Santiago de Cuba.
  • Las recompensas como agradecimiento a tu colaboración.

Tenemos varios niveles de recompensas para los donantes que van desde $10.00 dólares norteamericanos hasta $500.00 dólares.

La recompensa de $250.00 dólares es una escultura original de la obra “Con el corazón Abierto” en tamaño mediano de 70 cm de alto en blanco. Se envía mediante paquetería a tu casa añadiendo el gasto de envío a todo el mundo; así tú y tu familia en conjunto pueden pintarla y sincronizar sus talentos, plasmándolos en el corazón de la familia, la cual es sin duda, una gran experiencia para chicos y grandes. El nombre del patrocinador o patrocinadores, será o serán grabados en la cédula de una de las piezas exhibidas; del mismo modo, el nombre del colaborador o colaboradores serán plasmados en el libro de la exposición.

 

Tú puedes pintar el corazón junto con todos los miembros de tu familia o equipo de trabajo y así tener contigo un ISHAM arte consciente vibrando y abriendo el corazón  de todo aquel que lo contemple.

La recompensa de $550.00 dólares es una escultura de tamaño original en blanco, 1.60 m. de alto incluyendo la base, como la que es usada en los eventos de Isham, más gastos de envío. Se recibe en el domicilio que el patrocinador indique, junto con el certificado de autenticidad y la poesía precisamente escrita para esta obra. Es también, sin lugar a dudas, toda una experiencia familiar o de equipo, ya que dejará plasmada la intención de armonizar a todos los que se involucren a pintarla. Además, el nombre del patrocinador irá en las cédulas de las piezas pintadas por los artistas cubanos, así como en el libro de la exposición.

SE REQUIERE TU COLABORACIÓN PARA HACERLO POSIBLE

Tú haces la diferencia en el despertar de la humanidad.

 

Escala y tamaños de las esculturas a enviar como recompensa.

 

Las piezas para el evento en Cuba ya están hechas, si no se logra la meta con el dinero suficiente para ayudar a costear lo antes descrito, lo que falte trataría de conseguirlo mediante préstamos familiares y de amigos, o en última instancia, me vería en la necesidad de vender mi auto.

El impacto

Las personas que entran en contacto con las obras del movimiento Isham, son impactadas por la vibración que éstas emanan. En física cuántica está demostrado que la consciencia influye en la materia y le impregna información, es por eso que el reunir talentos distintos, con estilos y técnicas diferentes; pero sincronizados en un mismo propósito, las esculturas quedan potencializadas e irradian dicha intención más allá del tiempo y espacio. El impacto de movimiento Isham Arte Consciente da como resultado la trasformación interna de los individuos; de este modo, este movimiento, influye de manera decisiva en las personas para mejorar su sociedad. El impacto emocional en ellas es evidente y contundente.

En Morelia, Michoacán México. Se llevó a cabo una prueba piloto de Isham y el resultado palpable fue asombroso. Puedes ver este documental aquí. Isham-Morelia.

Las personas salían realmente inspiradas y tocadas en su interior; los niños descubrían que es posible vivir poniendo sus talentos al servicio de los demás y, sobre todo,  que en Isham creemos firmemente en la idea de que dando, es como uno recibe en abundancia, por la simple razón de que en Isham tenemos la certeza de que todos somos UNO, y así, el impacto de nuestras acciones en conjunto resuenan en una mayor consciencia colectiva de armonía, de agradecimiento, de amor, de entendimiento con el TODO y por lo tanto de paz. 

 Estas son las 4 esculturas que serán pintadas en Santiago de Cuba, se llevarán 6 de cada una.

 

 

El Desafío 

El desafío al cual nos enfrentamos es la brevedad tiempo y la escasez de los recursos. Desde sus inicios, Isham nació desafiando estos dos aspectos. El evento de Morelia se realizó en sólo un mes. Poco a poco y de manera paulatina, fueron apareciendo los recursos y, al tiempo, se iba multiplicando porque muchas personas con el Corazón abierto se fueron sumando para apoyar este movimiento de arte consciente que trasforma corazones.

 

Es por eso que, cuando viene un pensamiento de: ¿Y si no lo logramos? sólo lo dejamos pasar y decimos: ¿Y cómo sí?, ¿Cómo sí le podemos hacer para que se logre? Así las ideas empiezan a llegar. Yo diría que es como magia, pero así es.

 

Tú puedes apoyar este movimiento de muchas formas:

  • Colaborando con recursos.
  • Compartiendo en tus redes la liga de esta campaña. 
  •  Tiene muchas herramientas para que lo hagas de forma fácil.
  • Escribiéndonos para aportarnos tus ideas que lleven a Isham al siguiente nivel.
  • Y sobre todo agradeciendo, porque ya de por sí, es un evento que te toca por dentro y brota natural el deseo de involucrarte y apoyar.

Contáctanos:

isham.arte.u@gmail.com

WhatsApp: +52 1 33 37494314

Facebook: Isham Arte Consciente

 

Gracias por abrir tu corazón

story:
NOTE: Unlike many artist residency campaigns, this isn't me attending an artist residency; this is the purchase of a multi-building property for an free artist residency bequeathed to a cultural activist group to use in perpetuity.

My name is Jean Smith

I'm a longtime cultural activist and organizer who knows that daily life is not always conducive to completing important work that could potentially change the world!

I intend to purchase and run an existing property (an inn, large house or guesthouse) where artists (including musicians, writers and filmmakers) will reside while working on projects that intend to create progressive social change.

Accommodation for between 5 - 7 guest residents
Art studios
Rehearsal space
Writer's cabin
Presentation area for workshops and collaboration

What I need

Seeking: $20,000 towards purchasing property on an island off western Canada with suitable structures for an artist residency program. The funding goal reflects the value of the $100 USD paintings in stock.

Financing: I want to buy the property outright as opposed to carrying a large mortgage. If, at the end of this campaign, there isn't enough to proceed, all money raised will go into a savings account while fundraising continues.

Business Plan: To ensure that artists stay for free, part of the facility may periodically be used for fee-based accomodation to cover operating expenses. For instance, an ethical for-profit  organization needing a location for a small group would be asked to pay a fee.

I  have an excellent credit rating. I've never been in debt. I pay my bills on time -- including the credit card I've had since 1979. I've already saved a significant amount for the project. I could, at this point, purchase a small fixer-upper, but I'm looking at property around $500,000 USD.

Perks:

  • Your choice from 200+ 11 x 14" original Jean Smith paintings that I sell for $100 USD
  • Shipping: $15 USD to USA and Canada
  • 500 similar paintings SOLD since early 2016

My Background

I’m the singer in the well-respected guitar and voice duo Mecca Normal (13 albums on Matador, Kill Rock Stars, K Records). In 2016, I began selling $100 USD paintings from my FaceBook page. I’m a tenacious, hard-working and focused organizer who follows through on my projects. I consider purchasing property in this way to be a political act. I am known in independent music and beyond as a person of integrity. I want to use that status for the greater good.

As the singer in the rock duo Mecca Normal, I’ve been writing lyrics about social justice issues since 1984. One of our most well-known songs, "I Walk Alone" (1984) is frequently referred to as an anthem. My work is recognized as both visionary and inspirational.

I'm a two-time Canada Council for the Arts award winning as a writer of creative fiction represented by the Carolyn Swayze Literary Agency.

Reality Sandwich interview, early 2018
“Mecca Normal has inspired a large movement of feminists in their teens and early 20s who call themselves Riot Grrrls,” wrote The New York Times. “Female punk rock fans become united by the feminist messages shouted by bands such as Mecca Normal,” added USA Today.

Art Review: The Jealous Curator
Collection of interviews

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page with your friends! Help spread the word about an artist residency program devoted to progressive social change!

story:
The J. Scott Theater

The J. Scott theater is a historic building in the heart of Atlanta, Georgia.  Our plan is to design a new space to be a replica of an historic building. This project is designed to reignite the excitement of the various Art forms while bringing art to the public and the public to art. Picture it: a member based Arts Community with Theater in an Intimate Boutique Hotel setting. The goal of this hotel will be to help starving artists gain a platform in which to display their amazing creations. The building restoration, a 3-story, Theater, art themed boutique hotel, will showcase artwork from local artists as well as provide a family friendly atmosphere where travelers with children can rest, learn, explore and fall in love with the world of artistic creation.

The Goal

This project will be a membership based platform. Members will pay a fee of $152.21 to join. These members will be our artists. They will be able to display their artwork as well as a plaque with their name in front of their artwork. As long as the artist is a member and the artwork is child-friendly, and will have a display for up to a year. The artist will even have the opportunity to place their work on consignment, such that visitors may purchase the amazing artistic creations. In addition, a portion of any money made will be dipped back into the community and shared with local non-profit organizations.

The HC will also offer performances, meeting spaces, and access to artists grants. We will have some of the benefits of a five-star hotel, but the price will be affordable and the artists will gain experience for their CV's.

The Task

We mentioned everything needs restoring. There is the Theater Space, common areas including rooms at the J. Scott. Interior and exterior renovations are expected to cost an average of $4,807 per space. Therefore, we have started this campaign to help us make this dream a reality and begin the project.

We are asking for your help.  Please donate if you can. However, more importantly, please share our campaign with your circle of influence. The more people aware of our efforts, the closer we will be to reaching our goal.

story:
"Airfield for walking in the clouds" is a model of a fantasy airfield measuring 72x 40 ft. with ten dream-liners "Armchairs for walking in the clouds" created by Weld Queen for Burning Man.

"Airfield for walking in the clouds" is a large interactive installation people will be sitting and swinging in the "Armchair for walking in the clouds" will be able to "break away" from the ground and be closer to their dreams.

It's a place where people can to go on their own journey into the depths of their inner space.

 

ABOUT THE AUTOR OF THE PROJECT:

Weld Queen is a modern artist, sculptor and performer. She creates interactive sculptures and public art from metal. Her performances are based on the idea of internal freedom and human strength through the images of her own welding and artistic mythology. 

She is the most awesome Queen in the entire welding universe who wears brutally elegant "Royal Welding Dresses" are made of fireproof tarpaulin, lives and works in a real industrial castle of the Soviet period.


Weld Queen believes that through the game, through walking in the clouds a person can break away from his/her life's hardships, and when he/she returns to earth, he/she can look at them with a smile.
A dream is what makes our life bright and colorful.

How do I select a perk that interests me on this page?

Learn more about Weld Queen here:
www.weldqueen.com 


HOW WE DO IT:

"Airfield for walking in the clouds" is created by Weld Queen and a team of dreamers in Moscow. All parts of the installation will be created in Russia and sent to Playa in a disassembled form by a sea container. The team of Airfield's creators together with Weld Queen will assemble the installation for the beginning of Burning Man 2019.


Participate in crowdfunding and join the walk in the clouds on Playa!

OUR BUDGET:
The entire budget for this project is $47,600 and is divided into two phases.

STAGE 1 – DONE - 2018:
Preparation of the project and production of 10 "Armchairs for walking in the clouds " - $17,600. We have already completed this stage.

STAGE 2 – IN PROGRESS NOW - 2019 - $30,000 :

Main construction – THIS CROWDFUNDING - from March 2019 till June 16, 2019 – $15 000

Transportation and tools – NEXT CROWDFUNDING - from June 17, 2019 till August 2019 - $15,000

The budget consists of:


THE PATH WE HAVE TO TAKE TO WALK IN THE:

We all love this project and do our best to give thousands of closest people another opportunity to fly.

Let the HOME be the new Airfield.

With love, your Weld Queen, the Guardsmen and Maidens of the kingdom.

                                                                      (♡‿♡)

The team of Airfield's creators together with Weld Queen will assemble the installation for the beginning of Burning Man 2019.Participate in crowdfunding and join the walk in the clouds on Playa!OUR BUDGET:The entire budget for this project is $47,600 and is divided into two phases.STAGE 1 – DONE - 2018:Preparation of the project and production of 10 "Armchairs for walking in the clouds " - $17,600. We have already completed this stage.STAGE 2 – IN PROGRESS NOW - 2019 - $30,000 :Main construction – THIS CROWDFUNDING - from March 2019 till June 16, 2019 – $15 000Transportation and tools – NEXT CROWDFUNDING - from June 17, 2019 till August 2019 - $15,000The budget consists of:THE PATH WE HAVE TO TAKE TO WALK IN THE:We all love this project and do our best to give thousands of closest people another opportunity to fly.Let the HOME be the new Airfield.With love, your Weld Queen, the Guardsmen and Maidens of the kingdom.                                                                      (♡‿♡)

story:
(FYI - you can add extra posters or sets of greeting cards to your order after you select a perk!)

Though we can't dance together right now...

...we can still share the love and connection of the old-time dance community through a beautiful piece of artwork!

I'm Paul Silveria, I play banjo and call square dances. Early this year I released a  guide to square dancing and dance calling. Now I'm making a beautiful letterpress poster featuring my original illustrations from the book!

 

Square Dancing is important. So are handmade things.

I've always thought that old-time square dancing is magical - Live music, dancing with strangers, a caller picking up the vibe of the room and leading everyone through a comfortable challenge... Square dancing is community connection at it's finest, and we need that more than ever right now. Since we can't dance as a community, we can at least have something beautiful to remind us of what we are struggling for while we stay apart. We are working for a world where we can come back stronger and more connected. Where we can share food, help our friends and neighbours, and, of course, dance together!

I've known multiple letterpress artists who are also old-time musicians. (Stumptown Printers in Portland, and Clawhammer Press in Fernie BC both come to mind!) One key to this connection is the idea that old artforms are worth remembering, re-imaginging, and keeping alive. Just as we feel a difference when we hear music played live, we feel a difference when we see and touch a poster that's been carefully crafted and pressed by hand. That connection to the past, and to each other, is worth supporting!

This campaign is simple - Just pre-order your poster!

My goal covers the cost of designing and printing posters. Everything above the goal will be much-needed income in these gig-less times.

For the poster, I'll be working with the same designer (Linda Parke of Raven Book Design) and print shop (Porchlight Press) that made the cover for my guide to square dancing, so I already know how amazing it will look. I'll also be making greeting cards, and offering other perks as well.

This campaign is all-or-nothing. With no music income, I can't cover any funding shortfalls - so if it doesn't get fully funded here, it won't happen. Your help now will make it possible!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute to this campaign, please consider sharing to your community! I know there are old-time music groups all over North America. You can help by posting to Facebook groups, or sharing this campaign with your friends via e-mail.

If you're a real keener, please visit my Bandcamp or Patreon page for more ways to show your support!

story:
Venø Gård KUNST is a two day International Performance Art Festival on the island Venøy in Selje, Sogn og Fjordane on the 11th and 12th of July 2015. This is the first time the festival will take place. We have invited nine artists from various countries to produce new work for the festival.

Nigel Rolfe (IR), Kurt Johannessen (NO), Abraham Brody (USA/UK), Karianne Stensland (NO), John Court (UK/FI), Katri Kainulainen & Maximilian Latva (FI), Vincent Campos (FR) and István Kovács (HU)  

The funds from this campaign go to the artists travel, food and material costs, including a artist fee.

Due to the rigorous cuts in arts it is more important than ever  to create an artistic platform to explore new ways of communication and interaction with one another away from mainstream culture; trying to democratize and decentralize art. Not excluding but including the rural districts, sharing and experiencing art and nature together. 

We hope to Kindle, Unite, Nurture and Stimulate Thought through KUNST, which means art in Norwegian.

Norwegian Organisation Number: 9114911273 


The Perks

Nature lover / Nature lover Extreme

Souvenir / Art poster lover / Art print lover 

Wearable Support

Ebook of Festival / Festival Art Book

Webcam Art Performance / Personal Performance (New Work!)


We need your help

We contribute the location and our time, but believe that artists should be paid for the work they do. With your financial help we will be able to pay a minimum of 25% of their fee, in addition covering travel costs, materials and food. In return we will reward you with our gratitude and perks that truly are embeded with sweat, tears, passion and soul.


How the money will be distributed:




27% of our budget is the bare minimum to make this project happen, that is why this campaign is "fixed funding", meaning if we don't meet our minimum goal, the project will not happen and all contributions will be refunded. 

We hope to raise the remaining 63% funding for the festival from local businesses and applications to the Norwegian Arts Council, Sogn Og Fjordane Fylkes Komune, KORO, Selje Komune and Norske Billedkunstnere Project Support. We are always on the look out for relevant funding bodies to write to, so do let us know if we have missed any? 

As of 1st of January 2015  we have yet to receive a positive reply to our funding applications, but we are still writing new applications.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Listed below are items we need for the Festival. We would very much appreciate it if you are able to donate or lend us item(s) for the duration of the Festival.


And of course helping spreading the word would be absolutely fantastic. A good way is to use the INDIEGOGO share tool:

  • Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update
  • Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks
  • Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 


The Artists

Abraham Brody (England / USA) a performer who breaks the boundaries between classical, folk, and contemporary music. He brings the violin into the genre of performance art as a means to deepen contact between performer and public.

István Kovács (Hungary) installations and performances have radiated an almost religious devotion to Nature. This often gives the immediate impression that each of his creations is a kind of prayer rooted in humility and awe. A truly inspired spirituality shines through his work. 

John Court (Finland / England) output includes performance, sculpture and Video, but he considers all his work to be fundamentally concerned with drawing, in that drawing connects the elements of line, movement, space and time.

Karianne Stensland (Norway) works with investigation and reformulation of gender, power and rank. Her work comprise elements of mixed media, often presented through performance, video or installations.

Katri Kainulainen & Maximilian Latva (Finland) are two artists who have recently started performing together, this is what Katri says about it "In performance I am myself. Through performance one can process a part of you, a part that needs to be communicated with. So joint performances are an interesting way of being with someone you are close with… " 

Kurt Johannessen (Norway) to be present in the situation is fundamental for his work. He tries to keep whatever else as open as possible so as not to precondition the possibilities. This is the starting point. At the same time, however, he is concerned with finding situations that can generate qualities that he has not experienced before.

Nigel Rolfe (Ireland) the central contention of his practice is that art making is a live and vital engagement. He studied sculpture and in the 1970’s used the term “Sculptures In Motion” to describe his work using materials across time—long before the term performance was put forward as any descriptor.

Vincent Campos (France) is interested in peoples interaction with his installations and performances. He tries to focus on the relationship between the two and what the audience will experience.


The Location

Olav Venø is the owner of the beautiful island where the festival will take place. The 400 acres of farm has been in the Venø family for more than 400 years. The next generation are working towards ways to share this sublime spot of nature in order to built bridges to culture and the community.


Why Performance art?

Performance art is a form of art that gives the audience a direct connection with the artwork, because the artist and artwork is one. Performance art is a form of expression that is created in the here and now, leading to a intensity in the meeting between the artwork and viewer, which is different from what is created in static art or art that is experienced via a screen. The fact that the viewer becomes part of the creation process of the artwork and in some cases the artwork itself gives a unique attachment to the work. We believe that performance art, when it is experienced, can contribute to an understanding of how art is created. This may be because performance art gives an insight in to the artist’s energy and mind.


Why in Nature?

The nature in Norway is unique and beautiful, but for some of us who live between the hills and mountains, it has become mundane. A performance artist can either help us experience nature anew or intensify the moment. He or she can create a moment that perceptually lasts longer. Our attention has been focused, just like when we look at a beautiful sunset or a unique play of light. It causes us to linger a little longer at a spot seen many times before. Because a human has created the moment, it might help us to think about the interaction between man and nature. We believe these qualities of performance art can help create a better understanding of contemporary art as a hole.


The Staff

Erik Friis Reitan (Norway) will lead the two panel discussions. He is a visual artist working with photography and installation.

Photographic Documentation the 27% does not cover funding for this.

Video Documentation the 27% does not cover funding for this.


The Organisers

Bjørn Venø is an artist who works with photography, performance and video.

Julia Kröner works in fashion with a strong belief in the importance of Art.

Anita Eide is an artist who has chosen to live on Venøy.

Jessica Venø is the youngest member of our team, specialising in creating events. 

Olav and Elaine Venø are supplying practical support to the festival, such as the the location, housing and making food.




Big Thank YOU!

Warm wishes The VGK Team

story:
Short Summery 

  • Hey my brothers and sisters. Love power and freedom is the key to success. I'm Christos and I live in London.

  • I need your wonderful help because I can't do it alone to get a flight to LA.
  • It will give me the opportunity to go and see what LA is all about

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need  to book my ticket for LA for two weeks, for food, travel in LA, other expenses, accommodation and other things in regards to my acting.
  • If you help contribute to my trip I will send you all my love, wisdom and Joy in a small video. And on top of that I will be videoing a small short of my journey in LA in the two weeks which I would love to share with you all after the trip.
Risks & Challenges
  • The risks I've already taken to become a full time actor is crazy. I quite my retail job because that was burning me. I would wake up miserable going in to the stockroom of hell. But seriously I was not being myself and I knew that I had so much I wanted to do for my career and for the world and I couldn't do it whilst being down there in that stockroom. Now I am following my dream. I have an artistic family now working on our first production company and slowly but surly I have helped people around me believe that they too can follow their dreams.
  • It's been a challenge since then financially but I have been more happy and have been progressing massively.
  • But of course for this and for life I need the money which is why in a short space of time I need your help to provide for this wonderful opportunity and you will all be a part of that because no matter what I will always send out my love and work to you all. My career is only working because of you guys and I love you.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • There is, of course -
  • If you cannot contribute by giving money it's fine but please do spread the word to your friends and family.
  • Thank you all and god bless to each and everyone of you.

story:
Short Summary

Welcome to my campaign! I'm Kayla, a college freshman at University of California, Irvine. Right now, I'm a biological sciences major with an intended minor in digital arts. This campaign is for an enamel pin I'm attempting to produce. In order to be able to make my pins, I need 100 buyers at $5 a piece. Seeing my art come to life is something I've dreamt of for awhile, so I hope you guys can help me make it can happen! For every $5 you pledge, you receive a pin. If you want to pledge more than $5 without receiving multiple pins, shoot me an email and I'll make a special perk just for you.

What We Need, What You Get, & Risks

All of the money funded will go towards the production of my enamel pins. If the goal is reached, I will be able to send in my order with the company I'm working with. Once I get more images of prototypes and such, I'll be able to share them with you guys. As soon as I get the pins, I'll be able to deliver them to you! If I don't reach my goal, all the money will go back to my backers, no risk :)

story:
Short Summary

I am a human being that chooses to live a life of symbiotic relationship with nature as much as possible. I am passionate about healthy living. It began with small choices and became a lifestyle. One of my majors in college was Environmental Horticulture. I am living my dreams and inspiring others to do the same. I intend to empower communities with sustainable living & this fundraiser will help me achieve my goals of bringing more access to products that support freedom rather than slave-labor.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • To get started, I need the funds to potentially copyright or trademark the original content I use so it is protected
  • The funds will also provide me the chance to put in an order with a variety of my art, phrases, and puns in different sizes for all people to enjoy the diversity that fits them
  • The perks include contributing to charity that feeds people in need and ends slave-labor, bringing more freedom and fair-wages to all people
  • Anyone that donates $60 gets a Free Shirt of their choosing and size a.s.a.p.
  • Regardless of if I reach the goal, I am determined and I am pursuing this journey; I have the will; I have the passion; I have the support from the Universe because it is the right thing to do and I love it; the Law of Attraction delivers abundance always; I have faith and trust

The Impact

 

  • The clothes will preserve your health because they are non-toxic
  • They are comfortable and spread good, positive, fun energy
  • The shirts are of a high-frequency vibration and help us raise our energy up
  • I am already a business owner and Licensed Massage Practitioner as well as Reiki Master and accomplished two college degrees
  • I have been eating Vegan and mostly Organic for around 3 years and have switched as much of my clothing as possible over to Fair-Trade and sustainable options
  • This is more than just a decision, it is a way of life; it is more than just a business, it is a revolution - the ascension of united human consciousness

Risks & Challenges

  • I persevere regardless of conditions and I am dedicated to manifest my dreams into reality because I strive to live a life worth living and to leave behind a legacy of social and environmental justice
  • Regardless of what challenges may exist, I utilize resources efficiently, know when to ask for help, apply knowledge as power to deliberately find answers
  • I am solution-oriented, so I constantly am focused on how to bring the results necessary with where I am in the present and how I can change the future for the better using the power of now through the awareness of breath

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE this on Social Media

Start investing anything you can in Fair-Trade Food, Clothes, and make sure to find out where any products you buy come from as well as the impact they may be having on the environment

Educate Yourself and Spread The Word ~ Viva la Revolución!

story:
Introduction

Hello. My name is Artem Karsakov, I am an artist, and planning to create a full-length cartoon. For clarity, I recommend to watch the trailer and two animatics.

 

The animatic is a rough version of the planned material to give a hint what result should be. The cartoon itself, of course, will have a detailed drawing of backgrounds and animations, and have professional voice acting.

 
 

The quality is not perfect, we still have a lot to learn, but these materials give some idea about the atmosphere of the cartoon. So general information:

Problem

I like animation. But sometimes I want to watch something directed not only at mass, where all the originality will not be cut in favor of restrictive ratings, target groups, where everything will not be blurred to get the greatest reach of auditory. Also, I want cartoon to be not only entertaining but mental food. So the problem is defined, let’s solve it.

Idea

To be short the main line of cartoon is:

Young man get a job as a courier under the supernatural creature. Profitable deal turns into a deadly trap, which forces the hero to challenge to the powerful master.

The sense of the “Courier” story can be divided into two layers. 

  1. Becoming of a man. At the beginning of the story the hero is lazy, arrogant and irresponsible, but at the end he is not afraid of work, he is friendly with simple workers, he thinks, makes a decisions and is ready to risk own life, if necessary.
  2. There is an allegorical description of situation of our society in the second layer. Recently past –man is a friend, comrade and brother to a man. The current present – man is a wolf to man. And searching of future, justice.

For the atmosphere I plan some synthesis of “Deadman” by Jarmusch and fairy tails by Miyazaki, for example “Princess Mononoke”, and dilute it by surrealism and humor like in an old Soviet cartoons “Wow, Speaking Fish”, “Snow of Last Year Was Falling”, ”Laughter and Sorrow Near the White Sea”.

There are two reasons for black and white gamma. Firstly, it gives noir atmosphere.  Secondly, it is easy for me to work in, so the project will go faster and takes less money.

Progress

First episode contains about 250 scenes. Duration is about 20 minutes. What has already been done:

Backgrounds: 189 of 250
Animation: 8 of 250
Music: 4 of ?
Noise Design: 0 of 250
Voice Acting: 0 of 140

Approximately once a month I publish video reports with demonstration of some materials in our channel. With this reports you can estimate the pace of work. Do not forget to switch on the English subtitles.

 
 

 

Financial Target

It should be full-time working day to create the cartoon in good quality. To finish it faster I need a team.

Several months ago not big budget was collected that allow to create a part of work and gather small team – three artists and music composer. Nevertheless, there is not enough resources to complete episode, the reason is lack of money.

To complete the remaining part it's needed:

$9000 – Survival Mode

There are still some stocks, so with this amount the episode will be finished. However, it will be very difficult. Perhaps there will be a need to earn extra money on third-party projects.

12 000 $ - Comfortable Work

This sum allows us to work quicker and gives time for experiments and better detailing. All of these will improve the overall quality.

18 000 $ - Speed Up Process

The range from the previous to this amount will allow expand the team, and you will see the result sooner.

Also

In total, there were planned five episodes. Approximately 15-20 minutes each. If the campaign will be successful, then I switch it to InDemand mode and add more stretch goals. The voice acting will be in Russian with subtitles for other languages. If there will be enough interest to the project, I try to organize English sound.

Previous works

"Black Earth" is my first animation experience. It is a music video for our group “Reminor”. The project took two years, because I had to work on it in free time and weekends. It means that I have the endurance to bring large projects to the end.

 

You can find my previous pictures here: http://timbayo.deviantart.com/gallery/

Other Ways You Can Help

Here are the links where we publish our music and news about “Courier”. Help to share this information. The more the audience, the more opportunities.

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/reminorband

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/acousticcore

Twitter: https://twitter.com/ReminorMusic

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/reminormusic/

VKontakte: https://vk.com/acousticcore

In Conclusion

There are many difficulties ahead and a lot of interesting work. The project needs not only our skills, time and energy, but also your support.

story:
THE MACHINE

 

EXPERIENCE
the Machine

A beastly crossover, the Machine expresses its sporty, tactical and monstrous style from the outset. The fusion of a sports car body and a dumpster-bin cabin in a mechanical freak-show design, it reveals exceptional performance and world-shattering qualities. There is an original beastly air about both the exterior and the interior, both of which boast practical design and unique materials.

FEEL
Its interior

Marrying strength and mass, solid steel is used throughout. The driver's seat is as comfortable as the other side of a pillow that's been out in the elements for more than three decades. The back seat has been completely removed to allow a more roomy cabin space, and place for your gear, ammo, fuel or freaky friends.

WATCH
The performance

The Machine delivers a driving experience akin to piloting a tank that turns on a dime and accelerates like a rocket. Performance, responsiveness and raw power combine for unparalleled ecstasy behind the wheel. The Machine approach is nothing short of inspiring.

EXTEND
The Machine experience

The Machine houses a 5.7L Super-Charged 455HP engine developed by the Build Team. Coupled with some transmission the team scrounged up, rebuilt and bolted to the engine. The Machine has one driving mode: Beast, which harnesses the power of the engine into a focused fury of combustion and exhaust.

THE BUILD TEAM

The Build Team has designed the Machine to be a post-apocalyptic sport car capable of out running, out lasting and out performing anything on the road when the nuclear holocaust breaks out, sans an actual direct hit by a nuclear war-head. 

The Build Team has already acquired a 1985 Camaro to use as the base vehicle. We seek the world's help to bring the Machine to life by funding the bits and pieces necessary to get the Machine road worthy! Additional funds will go towards enhancements and other must haves (such as brakes, etc.), but the remainder will be financed and acquired by the Build Team exclusively. The more funds we get the bigger and more beastly we can make the Machine!

The Build Team is projecting a 30 day build time from the end of the Campaign, with delivery by Halloween - 2017. Concessions are built in to the plan - see Risks/Challenges - but the entire project start to finish will take under three months from the end of the campaign.

MEET THE BUILD TEAM

MJ- Gifted with many talents but master of few, MJ uses his ability to see things for what they could as a source of inspiration. He will conduct most of the significant work of the project himself, with help from the other Team members and special guests. His major contributions will be motivation, time and vision.

Morgan - Prone to drama, flightiness and a short attention span Morgan usually falls out within the first 30 minutes of work. Further attempts to engage her or get her to help usually end up in more time spent on such efforts than the effort it would take to complete the task ones self. Her major contributions are capturing the project on film and commenting on what would make anything 'pretty'.

Kaidyn - Hard working and inquisitive, Kaidyn makes the best use of his time by helping move things, providing logistical support and figuring out the best way to utilize the creeper for surfing.

Laura - Being married to MJ for over a decade has taught Laura that at any point she can expect some crazy idea to crop up with regularity - the Machine being no exception. Her main focus will be to keep the team sane, well nourished and believe it or not she is adept in wrenching!

Jaicee-Rayne - Being the youngest member of the team, her primary function will be to do whatever she wants to do while providing endless amounts of cuteness wherever she goes.

Cody - Part of the brain trust behind the idea of the Machine, Cody has contributed his considerable creativity to fleshing out the minute details of the project. Taking awesome ideas and making them better. Cody 's mad genius will be invaluable - plus, he is also knows his way around cars.

You - As a backer for the Machine, you are the most valuable member of the Build Team! Your contributions make this project possible. Our thanks goes out to you, and we look forward to many more successful projects in the future!

OWN IT YOURSELF!

Here's the deal...if the campaign total reaches $15,000 something magical will happen! The Build Team will build a second Machine and give one of them (title and all!) to the single highest contributor* to the campaign.

That's right! Once the campaign reaches $15,000 then a second car will be built and one of them given to the individual who made the highest combined contribution to the campaign.

*Fine Print: There is none! When the campaign reaches $15,000 a second car will be built.Whomever has contributed the highest total amount (minimum of $50) to the campaign will be given one of the two Machines! Pick-up/delivery will be worked out, and the new owner is responsible for all title, licenses and fee's associated with taking possession of the car. In the event that the winner does not want the car, it will be auctioned off with proceeds going to a charity of the Build Teams choosing.

Risks and challenges

First, we have a pretty aggressive build time-line, just 30 days, so time will be at a premium. Things that will be out of our control will be things such a weather, sickness or unforeseen circumstances that push the time-line past those 30 days. This is a foreseen issue however. The 30-day build time is an internal deadline to move the project along at a decent pace, however the actual delivery time is more like 60-80 days. This means that we've committed to a two month build time, we are internally shooting for a 30 day build.

Second, while the car has already been purchased, inspected and gone through there will be most likely be issues the we encounter with the build that will need to be addressed: replacement of fuel-lines due to internal rust, brakes, safety precautions, etc. While we have a pretty good inventory of these known issues, we cannot predict everything with a build like this. We have planned for them however, and once identified will address - the net result is at worst a push of the project dead-line.

Lastly, the Build Team is limited to a handful of people. While schedules are taken into account for our timeline(s), there is the potential that life events happen to a Build Team member that limits their exposure to the project. We do not have a reserve build team, but we do have access to professionals that can be tapped to help out - at an additional expense. Thus, as our goal states, we are looking to keep the overall costs low and still produce a quality project - especially when accounting for things of this nature.

story:
"Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life" Pablo Picasso

Today, when everything is in, cool, trendy, branded, black or white and where everything is controlled by the latest technology and robots, there is still a place for something “live” with the added value of manual work.

 

Our company offers high quality men’s shirts and women’s blouses with your monogram or logo of your company created in a unique way – hand painted by artist.

The clothing with your hand painted monogram or logo of your company may be a little detail for someone, however, it offers you a great feeling and the courage to be yourself and to feel extraordinary.

 

A little but significant painting proves the fact that we are people who can admire, love and support not only creation and art but that we have an effort to inject a piece of extraordinary feature and creativity into everyday “predictable” world.

We use paints and brushes of the highest quality on the market.

Inspired by our favourite painter Gustav Klimt, who used the real gold for his paintings, we also use real 24 carat gold for painting of our monograms. Real gold is mixed with golden colour in 1:1 rate. Then the gold becomes a part of a colour and will stay at your shirt or blouse permanently.

Our campaign serves for a start-up of our business – we need some place/studio for all our stuff (shirts, colours, boxes...) The funds will be also used for creation of another special collection using precious materials for painting.  The resources will be used for presentation our company in mass media as well . 

How can you support us?

Contribution of your choice - THANK YOU for your support! Everything counts!

"BLACK" PERK for $130 – you get a white shirt with your hand painted monogram in black colour on the cuff and placket. Be sure to provide us your e-mail address so that we can contact you for your shirt size.

"GOLDEN" PERK for $160 – you get a white or black shirt with your hand painted monogram painted with real 24 carat gold on the cuff and placket. Be sure to provide us your e-mail address so that we can contact you for your shirt size. 

"BLACK GIFT CARD" PERK for $130 - you get our luxury wooden Gift Card. You can give this card to a person of your choice as a Christmas/Anniversary gift. The card allows the recipient to choose the size of the shirt, colour (except 24 carat gold) and position of the monogram according to his/her own request.

"GOLDEN GIFT CARD" PERK for $160 - you get our luxury wooden Gift Card. You can give this card to a person of your choice as a Christmas/Anniversary gift. The card allows the recipient to choose the size of the shirt  and position of the monogram according to his/her own request. Monogram will be painted with 24 carat gold.

Each contribution over $500 will be published on our website as the official sponsor of our company.

It is very important for us to get your feedback and help at our start. We will appreciate any of your observations, experience and opinions on our products. Let us know what you like, what you don’t and provide us with suggestions for improvements.

Our brand helps to build your business.

***************THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!***************

                                                  Mirka & Petra

                                                        m5 art

story:
We’re a team of 3 people, who has learned the art of bodypainting over the last few years. In our team, we are specialized, been creative designer and painter, photographer, and post producer, making a complete group to achieve an excellent work.  We believe that the human body is the ultimate expression of perfection, and then, we have recognized the power of the bodypainting as a way to teach history, art, culture, religion and representative stories of each society.


 © Cristian J. Mejía 2016.

Our goal is to represent the culture of some places in the world to show that we're all the same race. Regardless the gender, the traditions, culture or religion, we want to gather people, paint their skin and take incomparable and unique photos in emblematic places around the world.

We have painted people in Colombia, with amazing results, and now, we want to do it directly in other places of the world. For this project we have chosen seven countries: China, India, Egypt, Grece, Italy, Norway and Mexico, which have been transcendental in the development of our society through their culture, life and history. We have done a few examples of this photos with some women which show a bit of our work, wich you can see in the  following link:

https://www.facebook.com/AvenidaVII/

Now we want to make it with a worldwide impact, for this reason, we need your help.

© Cristian J. Mejía 2016.

By means of the bodyapainting and a great photography work, we can teach people the amazing spots we have in this planet, and painted people will expose their roots and intangible heritage. We think that in every single place, everyone has inside the history of their community, and we want to capture it in photography, thought creative art painted on the skin.

© Cristian J. Mejía 2016.


No matter how hard it will be, the problems, the troubles finding people for the photographs, the difficulties and dangerous moments, we want to do it, because we love what we do and we know we can do it with your support.Please share on your social media to get the word out and make some noise about our project.

The photos will be artistic, aiming to show the beauty of the person photographed and of the places. Some of them will be individual and some will try to gather as many people as possible. We've chosen seven destinations, as a representative symbol of our multicultural world. In every country we are going to contact people, and we'll capture in a couple of photos thought a beautiful and inspiriting bodyart, a moment which tell stories, narrate lives and explain people ancestral traditions of a place.

© Cristian J. Mejía 2016.

If you love art, photography and believe in the powerful of visual storytelling this is a project you must follow and support to make this cultural and artistic project real.

There is another option to help us and support this project: share this idea with your friends, family, and anyone which could be interested. Also if you are in any of our destinations, be part of the projects and paint your skin with us. 

© Cristian J. Mejía 2016.

We'll do a book where we'll gather the photos. We plan a full color divided by the different countries and will have a great combination of history, art, traditions of this country and the photos which will represent them. Each photo will be accompanied by a description indicating where it was taken and the persons in the photo. Also, our project includes doing a calendar, post-cards and exclusive posters with our art. And finally, of course we’ll do a CD with all this with digital compilation and the edited inspirational, unique and creative film.


© Cristian J. Mejía 2016.

We'll do this journey as cheap as possible, eating and sleeping bad if necessary. We´ll finance ourselves in the current photographic equipment, and part of some improvements, some paint materials, airbrush and compressor and extra expenses related to the trip and not directly to the project. Here is a chart in which we show the percent of each relevant aspect that will make possible our project. Our expenses are related to plane tickets(most of them for long distances), food and lodging for the three of us, land transportation, insurance, little improvements to the photography and video equipment, the makeup painting which we'll need to get and transport everywhere  and last but not least, the rewards to all the people that will help us reach our goal.



This is just the beginning of a greater project, together we'll go to more places, we'll photograph more people. If we overcome our goal , we'll go to more places, going to the countries not considered in this first project. There are a lot more places which deserve to tell their story to the world. We hope to do it a lot bigger and to have a worldwide reach. We'll do it with your help. We can make it real with you.

We’re a team of 3 people, who has learned the art of bodypainting over the last few years. In our team, we are specialized, been creative designer and painter, photographer, and post producer, making a complete group to achieve an excellent work.  We believe that the human body is the ultimate expression of perfection, and then, we have recognized the power of the bodypainting as a way to teach history, art, culture, religion and representative stories of each society.

 © Cristian J. Mejía 2016.
Our goal is to represent the
culture of some places in the world to show that we're all the same race. Regardless the gender, the traditions, culture or religion, we want to gather people, paint their skin and take incomparable and unique photos in emblematic places around the world.
We have painted people in
Colombia, with amazing results, and now, we want to do it directly in other
places of the world. For this project we have chosen seven countries: China,
India, Egypt, Grece, Italy, Norway and Mexico, which have been transcendental
in the development of our society through their culture, life and history. We
have done a few examples of this photos with some women which show a bit of our
work, wich you can see in the  following link:https://www.facebook.com/AvenidaVII/Now we want to make it with a worldwide impact, for this reason, we need
your help.


© Cristian J. Mejía 2016.
By means of the bodyapainting
and a great photography work, we can teach people the amazing spots we have in
this planet, and painted people will expose their roots and intangible heritage.
We think that in every single place, everyone has inside the history of their
community, and we want to capture it in photography, thought creative art
painted on the skin.


© Cristian J. Mejía 2016.

No matter how hard
it will be, the problems, the troubles finding people for the photographs, the difficulties
and dangerous moments, we want to do it, because we love what we do and we know
we can do it with your support.Please share on your social media to get the word out
and make some noise about our project.
The photos will be artistic,
aiming to show the beauty of the person photographed and of the places. Some of
them will be individual and some will try to gather as many people as possible.
We've chosen seven destinations, as a representative symbol of our
multicultural world. In every country we are going to contact people, and we'll
capture in a couple of photos thought a beautiful and inspiriting bodyart, a
moment which tell stories, narrate lives and explain people ancestral
traditions of a place.


© Cristian J. Mejía 2016.
If you love art, photography
and believe in the powerful of visual storytelling this is a project you must
follow and support to make this cultural and artistic project real.There is another option to help us and support this project: share this idea with your friends, family, and anyone which could be interested. Also if you are in any of our destinations, be part of the projects and paint your skin with us. 


© Cristian J. Mejía 2016.
We'll do a book where we'll
gather the photos. We plan a full color divided by the different countries and will have a
great combination of history, art, traditions of this country and the photos
which will represent them. Each photo will be accompanied by a description
indicating where it was taken and the persons in the photo. Also, our project
includes doing a calendar, post-cards and exclusive posters with our art. And finally,
of course we’ll do a CD with all this with digital compilation and the edited inspirational,
unique and creative film.

© Cristian J. Mejía 2016.We'll do this journey
as cheap as possible, eating and sleeping bad if necessary. We´ll finance ourselves in the current
photographic equipment, and part of some improvements, some paint materials, airbrush and compressor and extra expenses
related to the trip and not directly to the project. Here is a chart in which
we show the percent of each relevant aspect that will make possible our project.
Our
expenses are related to plane tickets(most of them for long distances), food and lodging for the three of us, land transportation,
insurance, little improvements to
the photography and video equipment, the makeup painting which we'll need to get and transport everywhere  and last but
not least, the rewards to all the people that will help us reach our goal.
This is just the beginning of a greater project, together we'll go to more places, we'll photograph more people. If we overcome our goal , we'll go to more places, going to the countries not considered in this first project. There are a lot more places which deserve to tell their story to the world. We hope to do it a lot bigger and to have a worldwide reach. We'll do it with your help. We can make it real with you.

story:
Why Are We Asking & What Do You Get?

Great question!

By contributing to this campaign, you play a key part in seeing independent media thrive. ROUGE Detroit is a start-up relying on our supporters, not advertisers.

And we don't want you to leave this page empty handed! So by contributing $20 to the campaign you will receive 1 full print copy of our Spring 2019 Issue. Yes, a PRINTED copy delivered to your address, not a online download.

Your $20 contribution also gives you the option of a 2019 subscription discount. If you sign up for the remaining Summer and Fall 2019 issues you will receive both issues for $15, a savings of $2.50 per copy.

story:
Everybody loves Star Wars, the only people that don't, are either lying or haven't seen it yet.

I want to raise money so that I can put my badges into production, I already have the designs confirmed with the manufacturer and they are ready to go, however I don't have the capital myself to whack it down all at once. Which is why I turned to you guys, I found out in a previous project that if you offer something unique for a good price, people will notice it!
The badges will be 20mm gold-plated with a clutch backing, featuring a soft enamel coating where the colours are. 
To start with I have 2 designs, one  of Admiral Ackbar, and the other of Jabba the hut.

story:
The theme of Midburn 2017 is "Lucid Dream", a phenomenon which occurs while consciously recognizing that we are dreaming while sleeping. At that point or in that place, between reality and dream, we can feel free.

"Man and Eve" statue captures the journey of two beings, spreading their wings and lifting-off to enter that exact moment. 

They want to set their minds free.

The statue will rise to a colossal 45 feet (14 meters) high and will have a wingspan of 50 feet (15 meters). The outlines of the effigy will be created by over 400 individually designed and hand cut plywood shapes, all connected to the main structural beams.  

3D simulation of the statue - 

 

As customary in Midburn events "Man and Eve" effigy will be Burned on the day before last of the event.

We are a collective group of volunteers, woman and men, of all ages, dedicated to proudly representing our region and to experiencing this inspiring piece of art with the community.

100% of your donation will go to funding this project. As a group, we have already raised nearly $2,000 but need to raise more for lumber, metal, lighting, electronics and transportation to the playa. All labor is volunteer and will not require any money.  

Assembly: This is a tricky part. Because of the precise work, progress isn't fast. We have two construction sites, one near Tel-Aviv and the 2nd - in Northern Israel. 

Stability: A team of 4 engineers planned and modeled the correct angles of the wing plywood to withstand the winds and dust of the desert.In addition, we will be using steel cables to stabilize the massive structure.

Video Credits:
Directing and Editing - Erez Markovich (http://www.space-cat.com/)
Camera - Shahar Yerushalmi
Music: 
The Doors - Break on Trough (Jay Bovino Remix)
Sound Cloud: https://soundcloud.com/jaybovino

story:
The Artist.

I am Wilhelm Vincent, the artist.

I live between land and ocean, between sky and earth, in the aptly named South African coastal village of Wilderness. I have intentionally surrounded myself with the complexity and simplicity of nature, the magic and reality of nature. As an artist, my main creative theme is that of the homo-aesthetic – I am an artist who is a queer boy, who is a nature boy, and all station stops between.

I am a young South African visual queer artist who has been given a great opportunity to fly across Africa – to take part in two prestigious and exciting art venues a continent away in Europe.

QueerArt_InTransit?

This is about art in transit, about an artist being transported from one half of the world to the other in order to produce live and site specific artwork.

This is about me as a Queer South African artist being given the opportunity to take my personal creativity ; my fire and magic, my masks of persona, and to transport them to Europe, to two European capitals: London and Athens.

It is an opportunity to produce new work in both London and Athens, and as an artist represent myself at two important contemporary art events through October and November 2017.

In October 2017, I have been personally invited to take part in the internationally renowned Homosurrealism event (bit.ly/fb_homosurrealism), which is regularly held in cities across the planet, in October it is the turn of London to be the Homosurrealism venue.

In November 2017 I have been invited to take part in this year’s Civil Disobedience art event in Athens (ww.civildisobedience.gr). There I will be producing site-specific work for the event. It is not a matter of sending work to Athens, or bringing work with me. I, as Wilhelm Vincent the artist, will be producing work at Civil Disobedience, for Civil Disobedience

 I will be artist as performance.

How can you help?

To be a physical part of Homosurrealism in London and Civil Disobedience in Athens, I will need the help of you good people.

$1600 USD needs to be raised in order to be able to pay for my international flights from South Africa to London, then Athens, and then back to South Africa. Alongside the charges for the flights are charges for visas in order to allow me to enter Europe. 

It is such an honour to me as an artist, as a queer artist, and as a South African to be offered this opportunity to produce work on-site in Europe. I hope with your help that $1600 USD can be raised in order to see me soar over Africa and into Europe.

What's in it for you?

Because of my appreciation and deep gratitude of the generosity of others, I would like to give something back to those who are helping me to put this unique art journey together. Please see perk list that gives details as to what I would like to give back to those who contribute generously.

story:
Who We Are

Fashion Alliance World (FAW) was created to bring together fashion designers, fashion stylist, merchandisers, artists, illustrators, photographers, models, and hair/make-up to join forces in promoting the growth of the fashion/art industry in South Florida, and to showcase the work of Fashion Alliance World’s members called The Art Row. 

About This Project

Fashion Alliance World (FAW) presents “As the Sun Rises Over Fort Lauderdale,” a festival of fashion, art and film festival and benefit event, which will take place in Fort Lauderdale (FTL), Florida on September 29th. The purpose of this event is to raise awareness of the talents existed here in the fine arts industry in FTL and to showcase their work.  In addition, we have invited fashion designers, artisans and film makers from around the world to come into FTL to present their exclusive and exquisite collections, which will without a doubt, be some of the most stylish and welcoming designs from the different cultures. These different cultures include Haiti, Jamaica, Canada, Paris, Sweden, Russia, China and the USA.  This festival is also a benefit event which a portion of the proceeds will benefit Joe DiMaggio Children’s Hospital in Hollywood, Florida, helping children and families in need for medical assistance.

BACKERS CONTRIBUTIONS

We have been given the opportunity to reach out to everyone including you through this Indiegogo campaign. We are asking for your support, not only to this event project, but also to children and families in need for medical assistance. As the event date approaches, join forces with us in showing the world that this fashion, art and film festival is well worth it, as we will present a unique showcase in FTL – South Florida – that “you” will be apart of as well.

Other Ways to Help

If you can't support this project, here’s how you can still help:

Place this project on your Facebook, Instagram and Twitter, Google+, Pinterest, LinkedIn and etc. to all your social media contacts, and ask your friends to do the same. Spread the word! Also, stay tuned watching our Indiegogo campaign for forum updates. Again we cannot do it without you, therefore, please shout this out to your family, friends and neighbors, here, there, everywhere, because spreading the word will be a openhanded help to this project. Thank you all, and thank you INDIEGOGO!

Rewards for Backers

We have rewards for you - our supporters. Please see “perks” displayed to the right for more details. Please note: every backer will be credited on FAW’s website.

story:
Where: BURNING MAN 2017

Who we are:  We are group of four taking the art car plunge on our 4th year on the playa.   S’moreHaus was born because burners get hungry and sometimes you really wish one of those art cars would stop and ask you to ride...  and feed you.  

What we’ll do: We plan to pick you up, and go where you go on the playa. It’s important to us that the gifting spirit of Burning Man 2017 is part of our journey as some of our best memories have come from other’s generosity.   If you’ve ever been half way home and hungry, we hope to solve that.  

What you’ll do:  Donate.  Help us.  Come get toasty.    Plan a fire and we’ll visit.  Make some toasty sticks! Tell us what you want to do! 

Funds: Every year gets stricter, so we anticipate upgrades and requirements back from BM 2017 DMV.  We also need supplies as we are going ALL WEEK.   We’d like to get enough help to plan times we can park and give.  Sound/Music isn’t possible right now given all the rest of the expenses but if we can raise this, we could host a DJ or Musician on the roof.  

Impact: We’ve all been there, a little too tired or ambitious with our playa playing or hanging out at the many fires people create throughout the Playa.  Imagine bracing yourself for the long walk across the playa only to be picked up in a S’moreHaus.   We want to be the beaming S’moreHaus on the horizon.   I think the Playa need ‘smore art cars like the S’moreHaus.   The Biggest Little S'moreHaus that could... you get where we are going with this.

Ways you can help:  if you can’t donate, you can create.   We are busy employed adult people and running a S’moreHaus takes a lot out of you so get to know us.  We worry about having mechanical issues on Playa and have to have it towed out and in.     We’re in NYC and ATL so get to know us!

story:
Hello everyone!  Thanks for taking the time to check out our campaign! We want to give you a little backstory about us and go over the risks, ambitions and perks of our campaign.

 

Once Upon A Time...

 

We started Champaign Paper to make extra income after our youngest child was born and Elisabeth quit her full-time job to care for our three children. As our little business grew, Shaun was able to quit his corporate job and we both were able to pursue our company full-time. We love that we can work from home and also be able to care for our children simultaneously, but we have run out of room in our studio, and it's time for an upgrade!

 

 

After traveling all over the country attending markets and being able to bring our products to customers in over 60 stores across the United States & Canada, we are ready to grow even more. We've heard a great deal of amazing feedback about our products from our customers and it encourages us to keep pursuing our entrepreneurial spirit. Our small business has grown extensively in the last four years and we have several projects and ideas we'd love to pursue in the near future. Champaign Paper is ready to do epic shit!

We've been told by our customers that they'd love to see our products in a brick and mortar of our own and on other products such as t-shirts and mugs. In order to accomplish these goals, this campaign would facilitate our small business in creating new items, purchase the necessary equipment needed for development, and give us more space in a larger studio outside of our home. The support we would receive from this campaign would give us a head start on these goals and help Champaign Paper grow into the reality we've been dreaming of.

 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

 

You might be asking yourself: "Why don't they just have someone else print their shirts?"  Great question!  We design, print, package and ship all of our products from our in-home studio.  We love the DIY aspect of our company and we strive to make everything that we sell (with the exception of enamel pins because who knows how to make those???) ourselves. 

Our goal for this campaign is to reach or surpass $3,000. It's enough to get us started in the direction of our dreams and tackle two very important goals: t-shirts & a new studio.

We will begin by purchasing the necessary equipment needed to make our very own t-shirts! We will also continue our efforts of finding an affordable studio that would be large enough to create all of our products and store our equipment. We have some places in mind, so stay tuned! ;)  Even if we do not reach our entire goal, anything will help us pave the way for our future plans!

 

 

PERKS!

 

We have several perk levels to choose from and every little bit helps!

$5 - You can select one of our most popular greeting cards to have shipped directly to you!

 

$25 - You can select one of our prints (8" x 10") and one of our cards shipped directly to you!

$50 - Be one of the first people who get their hands on a Champaign Paper T-shirt!  We will email you after the campaign has ended with the shirt options available and to get your size!  This perk also comes with a print (8" x 10") and one of our greeting cards which will all be shipped directly to you!

 

THE IMPACT

 

Our dream is valuable to us and to other young entrepreneurs because it allows us to fulfill our ambition of creating beautiful paper goods and other fine products people can be delighted about.  One of our favorites parts of running Champaign Paper is the excitement that our art gives people when they experience it in person.  Bringing joy, comfort or making people laugh at one of our cards is one of the best parts of our job!

 

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

 

We've had the comfort of being able to do what we do within our home and the thought of moving our studio to its own building is a little scary. However, we have a tiny room we currently use and we haven't been able to develop certain products (like shirts!) simply because we do not have the space. Adding an additional monthly expense is a little terrifying, but we believe where there is a will there is a way! 

 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

 

Even if you aren't able to contribute to our campaign, it's extremely important that we spread the word! Please share this with anyone who you personally feel could help us grow!  Utilizing social media effectively and sharing our campaign will go a long way in helping us spread the word!

Thanks for stopping by and check us out online!

Website:

https://www.champaignpaper.com/

Instagram:

https://www.instagram.com/champaignpaper/

Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/ChampaignPaper/

$5 - You can select one of our most popular greeting cards to have shipped directly to you!

 
$25 - You can select one of our prints (8" x 10") and one of our cards shipped directly to you!

$50 - Be one of the first people who get their hands on a Champaign Paper T-shirt!  We will email you after the campaign has ended with the shirt options available and to get your size!  This perk also comes with a print (8" x 10") and one of our greeting cards which will all be shipped directly to you!

 
THE IMPACT
 
Our dream is valuable to us and to other young entrepreneurs because it allows us to fulfill our ambition of creating beautiful paper goods and other fine products people can be delighted about.  One of our favorites parts of running Champaign Paper is the excitement that our art gives people when they experience it in person.  Bringing joy, comfort or making people laugh at one of our cards is one of the best parts of our job!
 

 
RISKS & CHALLENGES
 
We've had the comfort of being able to do what we do within our home and the thought of moving our studio to its own building is a little scary. However, we have a tiny room we currently use and we haven't been able to develop certain products (like shirts!) simply because we do not have the space. Adding an additional monthly expense is a little terrifying, but we believe where there is a will there is a way! 
 

 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
 
Even if you aren't able to contribute to our campaign, it's extremely important that we spread the word! Please share this with anyone who you personally feel could help us grow!  Utilizing social media effectively and sharing our campaign will go a long way in helping us spread the word!Thanks for stopping by and check us out online!Website:
https://www.champaignpaper.com/
Instagram:
https://www.instagram.com/champaignpaper/
Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/ChampaignPaper/

story:
Some Science and Some Art

The Home Brewer's Formulary is a poster featuring a collection of formulas, charts, graphs and other info used in a typical home brewery. It is also an attractive, full color poster about beer and beer making for brewers, homebrewers and beer enthusiasts.  Each poster will be offset print on 100b, glossy paper in full color, and will measure  24" by 36".They look great framed or laminated.

Current Goals and Perks

This fundraising effort is to get me the capitol to do some revisions and updates and do another print run of this popular poster.   Supporting this effort means you'll help revive a home brewing classic, and the main perks are - posters!  Supporters will be the first people who can get this poster, which is not currently available anywhere else.  And check out the perks section for a few useful bundles and higher quality print versions.

 

A little History

This project grew out of a desire on the part of a couple of dedicated home brewers to have better references on hand. Originally introduced in 1998 and sold until the early 2000's at homebrew stores, at beer festivals and online, the poster was out of print for a number of years. In 2013, I revived it, did a print run, and sold those posters online, mostly to individuals and pretty much just paying back the print run costs and other expenses. Now those posters are gone, and people still want copies.

Time for an update

So, it's time to do another print run, and I think it's a good time to update some of the info. Particularly I want to revise the information on Hop Varieties, which is pretty dated, and does not reflect trends over the past few decades. I'll also take this opportunity to review information on grains, and just check and make sure that nothing else has changed. The poster will remain virtually the same visually.

story:
The Lovemark 

The world's first crowdfunded monument of Love!

An actual, physical architectural structure, The Lovemark, will be constructed out of thousands of love cubes - the actual building blocks of the monument.

Personalize your own love cube with an inscription of your own love message and leave your lovemark in history!

Every love cube helps The Lovemark grow into a true landmark!

story:
Delve into a rich setting inspired by Shadowrun, the SCP Foundation and the cosmic horror genre popularized by H.P. Lovecraft.

Global conspiracies, ancient and nightmarish horrors, crime-laden hive cities, seductive yet deadly characters. This is the world of a Memory of Eternity, where cyberpunk meets eldritch powers.

The technological singularity has already occurred. An unimaginably powerful artificial intelligence now holds the world firmly in its grip, just as utterly alien beings from beyond our reality start to break through. Now, these titanic forces battle for supremacy as humanity clings to a last desperate hope for survival.

Artists: Houpo, Dartdara, Satoshi, TORii

 

Redefining cyberpunk

High-tech, low life. That has long been the mantra of cyberpunk, which has traditionally focused on the questioning and subversion of authority through technology. 

Usually, the holders of authority are shady government agencies, monolithic corporations, or some other real world analogue. In this setting however, as runaway AI development heralds a new age, and where the fabric between reality and the Barren Wastes have begun to fray, true Authority resides in those who view humanity as mere toys, and easily broken ones at that. 

Artist: Satoshi

 

What is included?

 

  • A 64+ page, full-color artbook
  • Illustrations by dozens of different artists, both professional and amateur
  • A variety of different art styles
  • A 18+ NSFW section, including coverage of the Courtesan's Guild
  • The lore and history behind the great nations and factions of the setting
  • SCP Foundation-inspired reports by the Traveler’s Mandate on the various anomalies that exist in the world
  • 10+ years of worldbuilding, finalized in one book

Artist: Dartdara

 

What is A Memory of Eternity?

 

A Memory of Eternity is an experimental and narrative-driven video game series, with both SFW and NSFW entries. Currently the third game is in development, Memoirs of a Battle Brothel, following the beautiful and deadly women of MoonFall’s Courtesan’s Guild. Trained as both fighters and high-class escorts, the courtesans of MoonFall take the main stage in Cyberpunk Babes and Lovecraftian Horrors.

 

A Memory of Eternity also contains a strong meta-narrative and loads of what many people would consider weird or mind-screwy elements.

 

You can check out the series on Steam or on A Memory of Eternity's Patreon page below:

 

 

18+ (NSFW) content

Since we have been working in both SFW and NSFW (18+) categories, we've accumulated a lot of art that is unmistakably more adult in nature. Please be aware that the artbook will have art exploring human (mostly human, at any rate) sexuality. Sometimes in weird and unexpected ways. 

Risks and Challenges

Hi everyone, this is TORii, I've been working with A Memory of Eternity/Manly Mouse Dan for a while now, and I'm in charge of putting this artbook together. I have to say that I'm super excited to finally be able to put the shared universe that we've been building for so long finally on real pages.

Between the two of us, we have extensive experience in both publication design and writing, so I see no barriers to a digital PDF release of the artbook. As for a physical print publication, that is something new to me, but I don’t expect it to be an issue either.
