story:
Blanc Canvas strives to create a sociable space where friends and strangers can come together, cheers, and create unique masterpieces and memories. 

Kirk Morrison and Jade Tantillo are trading palm trees and seas for tulips and canals, inspired to add to the inventive atmosphere in Amsterdam. Both deriving from marketing fields, Kirk and Jade were beyond impressed with the culture and creativity that lives and blooms in Amsterdam on each advertisement, flyer, brand, and storefront when they explored the city with nothing but backpacks and daydreams. 

Kirk is willing to be uncomfortable and vulnerable, which motivates him to do and say things others won't. He produces his failures into lessons and grows from those lessons. He strives toward the pursuit of improvement in every aspect of life. Although stoic (and perfectly sculpted) as a Roman statue on the exterior, internally, he is the happiest and most grateful soul. 

Jade Tantillo has an unbreakable passion for travel. She adores conveying messages through mediums of writing and art and is eager to learn and explore any dimension of creativity. This desire to learn causes Jade to challenge herself to reach new goals every day. She seeks to inspire and be inspired. Jade believes that introducing paint and sip classes to Amsterdam will open doors to incredible adventures, exciting experiences, and unparalleled life lessons. She hopes to gain real-world knowledge from running a business abroad and influence others to follow their passions, as well.

In order to follow this journey, Jade and Kirk (and Mavis) need to leave everything familiar behind. Exiting stage left, far and out of their comfort zones, they'll have to discover and create a new life for themselves and their new venture. Blanc Canvas hopes to bring people together over a glass and a painting class.

Once across the Atlantic Ocean, Jade and Kirk will have 90 days to acquire a Visa to keep their business plan in the works. This requires a lot of hard-work on their part and a bit of support from their friends and family. Any kind of support (emotional or monetarial) is beyond appreciated. "Perks" are ready to be claimed! Or simply show your support by following the journey at @blanccanvas.nl on Instagram or visit the website.

story:
Hi everyone!

I am a student of Masters in Fine Art in digital art at University of Malta. Currently I have been working on my thesis and the project based on it. The topic of the thesis is Time and Presence and the project consists of a mix between Performance art and Video art (a video sample for the project you can find over here :  https://vimeo.com/154039165) 

My background in in various art media, but the most used are photography, video and installation art. Video art has been chosen as a main medium by this project, as it would fit the concept of being present in time best. The videos have been filmed and edited already and are prepared to be shown as a part of group degree exhibition in Spazju Kreativ in St.James cavalier (contemporary art exhibition space), Valletta starting from the 6th of May 2016. 

Needless to say, the organisation of such an event entails certain expenses such as 

  • logistics - building temporary walls and a ceiling in the gallery space to separate exhibition areas;

  • advertising - printing of booklets, posters, leaflets; 

  • media coverage;

  • expenses towards the opening night itself - catering and photographer's services. 

All expenses should not exceed 500 per person, which is nonetheless quite a large amount for a student. 

You, the contributor will help me and my group to create a good quality contemporary art event, expose our projects to the viewer, raise level of contemporary art on the island and share our final projects in mostly new digital media with the world.

The goal is to reach 500 euro in total, but if the goal isn't reached the money collected would be used for the expenses listed above.

If you can't contribute, please share this page with your social circle.

Thank you for reading this!
Leta Shtohr

story:
Support Our Campaign!

Hello! We are Gaysper Pins, designers and makers of high-quality enamel pins with Gaysper: The Lovable LGBT Phantom. In early May, we started selling pins with the original Gaysper. But after countless requests from around the world for pins with Bisper, Transper and more, we want to expand our catalog even further! However, offering so many different pins at once is an expensive endeavor. That’s where you can help!

Every contribution brings us closer to offering unique pins for all LGBTIQAP+ identities! For our primary goal, we chose our most requested pins: Bisper, Transper, Pansper, Enbysper, Acesper and Leathersper. And as our reach goals succeed, even more will become available.

Your support will not only bring the love of Gaysper to more people, but let you bring home pins of Gaysper’s love too! Our primary goal is $1,400, the initial cost to produce all of the six new pins. We set a fixed goal because we want to fulfill our promise completely, or your money back! To reach our goal, all of our perks offer the new charming pins at a discount.

You can help bring Gaysper to even more people, while enjoying pins for yourself, friends and family. Act now before they return to full price! Please enjoy our campaign, and help support our goal!

The Gaysper Pins Story

Gaysper is based on the “ghost” emoji for Google Android 4.3, released in 2012. In 2015, Spanish creator Baiiley added five pride flags to the emoji, making the famous Gaysper.

Gaysper came to fame in April 2019 after a Spanish far-right group used the rainbow-colored ghost in a rogues’ gallery of their enemies. However, the group’s post backfired, and the little phantom, dubbed “Gaysper” on social media, quickly became an adorable companion of the LGBT community!

Gaysper Pins brings the charm and love of Gaysper, the LGBT phantom, to persons everywhere. We started in April 2019, to help the LGBT community reclaim Gaysper from anti-LGBT voices! As the entire Gaysper Pins team are members of the LGBT community, we are dedicated to fostering a community of love and empowerment for LGBT people worldwide.

Please visit our website at gaysper.lgbt and contribute to our campaign!

How Else You Can Help

Our Reach Goals!

Support our campaign even further, and make every pin a reality. As reach goals are successful, backers who selected enamel pins of choice can opt to receive any unlocked pin of Gaysper's friends!

1st Reach Goal: $2,100: Bearsper, Lipsper and Intersper!

2nd Reach Goal: $2,800: Allysper, Aromsper and Polyamsper!

3rd Reach Goal: $3,500: Agensper, Demisper and Queersper!

4th Reach Goal: $4,200: Bigensper, Fluidsper and Polysper!

5th Reach Goal: $4,900: Butchsper, Volitsper and Gaysper (Muted Tones)!

6th Reach Goal: $5,600: Gaysper (1978-1979), Gaysper (1978 Original) and Gaysper (Victory against AIDS)!

7th Reach Goal: $6,300: Gaysper (9 Bars), Gaysper (7 Bars) and Gaysper (10 Bars)!

8th Reach Goal: $7,000: Gaysper (5 Bars), Gaysper (Vertical Bars) and Gaysper (Diversity)!

. . . and Beyond!

Potential Changes

Gaysper Pins has already rolled out its first pin, the original Gaysper! We also already have a proud relationship with our manufacturer in Vermont. Moving forward, the most important concern is that every new design is equally as brilliant and prideful.

Some designs may change as production specifications are finalized, and colors may be adjusted. But once completed, all pins will faithfully represent their Gaysper identity!

story:
Currently I am studying Theatre Education and Production & Design at Central Washington University in the blustery town of Ellensburg. Through this education, I have found an insane obsession with drawing and thankfully, that obsession has found an outlet.

Folklore is something I am immensely passionate about, from my own Celtic folklore to Norse, Germanic, and even to Americana, I want to bring to life the oral stories of our history.All of that aside, you might be wondering why I mentioned my study at CWU and how that connects to this art - well, as a theatre educator, I believe that theatre is the truest form of human connection, and perhaps the closest tie we have to the old ways of life. Live theatre can take many forms, from staged plays, musical performances, spoken word, political protest, and so on, but at it's core it is humans telling stories to other humans. And that, in my opinion, is the core of Folklore and it's importance to our humanity, culture, and existence.

You're probably wondering by now when I'll get to my goals and how indiegogo will help me achieve them. I have, in the past, over committed and underdelivered, so my first step is to keep it simple and achievable.

Indiegogo contributions will go to the following things...

- Establishing a domain name and website with an easily manageable store for people to make purchases from. I have a background in graphic design and already have a website made, it's just a matter of paying the fees of the domain and hosting. (~$160)

- Allow me to more easily purchase the tools (a proper drawing tablet to do digital linework, finding a printer, set-up supplies) I need to create the first Coloring Book in (hopefully) a series of many more.  (A drawing tablet. I will be getting one no matter what, but the sooner, the better!)

- Help me build up a small inventory of prints, original art, and other things for the online store, future conventions, Ren Faires, and local art-walks that I will be exhibiting with.

What will you GET for you contribution?

Well, different levels will get different things, but every person will be given access to discounts on store items, process-shots, videos, and tutorials, as well as the ability to contribute your own ideas and suggestions! All contributors will also be credited in print versions of any Coloring Books created.

story:
Ballad for Earth

Every year since 2014, I've had the privilege of creating limited edition calendars to carry people through the year that lies ahead. 

This year we journey through land and sea; a dreamscape of hope and wonder to remind us that we are all connected to and through nature, as well as to each other on this planet we call home. The images in this calendar will be mostly derived from my own photographs / double exposures and great imaginings that seem to endlessly swim through my mind. 

Over the years, this project has become more than just a calendar and has grown into a real labour of love. These projects have allowed me to share my art in accessible and meaningful ways, and to connect with people through creativity. Art seems to transcend so many boundaries. Its purpose for me: to awaken emotion and awe in myself and the viewer, something all of us are capable of experiencing if we take the time to see and feel the world around us. 

✶ Calendar Details ✶

Printed on beautiful linen paper (this is so important to me, however, we have had humidity and paper issues in the past that have required me to change the stock. I am using a printshop that I've had a wonderful working relationship with for the past 10 years on all of my projects. However, as is the case when working with third parties, unforeseen challenges can arise)

Wire-o binding + hook for hanging

Limited edition calendars are approximately 13in x 8.5in

Larger Calendars are 13x19 inches

Available in both French and English 

 

✶ Financial Details ✶

Production costs: Printing and proofing Calendars, Prints, Cards, & Postcards

Transportation and Courier

The unfortunate reality of Shipping Costs

Packaging and Envelopes for shipping

Indiegogo and Payment Processing fees

mood board / some reference images

story:
What is Burning Man?

 

Every year from late August to early September,

70,000 people around the world will flood into Nevada 's Black Rock Desert.

To establish a new city within a week.

In this city ,the only sold products are ice and coffee.

People must bring their own supplies.

All the amazing ,abstract art installation and lighting equipment,

All radical forms of self –expression,

Made the city what it is .

 

 

After 8 days, all the residents are evacuated.

All devices and works of art come to ashes

The city will be evaporated in the air.

 

 

Since 1986 ,

Burning Man Festival is an utopia where money ,class and boarder dose not really matter .

It  draws an deep attraction for the top CEOs from Silicon Valley too,

Google 's Larry Page, Tesla's Elon Musk , they have all been a keen participant of Burning Man.

This is the ultimate carnival for all the  artists.

Hippie’s utopia,

Dead Poets Society for the youngsters

Benjamin Barton 's boat for the seniors

It is a journey of Nirvana .

 


 


Who are we?

 

We are a group of young people from different parts of Asia

Taiwan, Hong Kong, Beijing, Shenzhen

We gathered in China Shenzhen New Who Art Village and Reno studio in the USA

In the past two decades,

We have been the largest -scale Asian art project that has made its way into Burning Man.

In the year of 2016,

We will lead the Zulai art car,Mazu theme camp.

Buddha hand carnival parades to the Burning Man.

To  introduce the beautiful mysterious oriental flavor into Burning Man ‘s fantasy

 

 

Zulai Art Car

Each finger of our huge Buddha Hand Zulai Art Car is made of delicate bamboo, hand crafted by our vey own artists.

Oriental bamboo stands for insistence , resoluteness and honourability.

It will wave in the storm and stand in the Black Rock desert.

 

 

In our Asian Youth 's studio in Reno,

we use the knife to carve the Buddha image,

and paint the golden glory of Zulai by our own hands.

 

 

Mazu Theme Camp

The entrance of the Mazu theme Camp area is featuring the tongue of devil.

It’s the entry of the chaos of emotions, confronting the darkness and cruelty.

But when you really come inside,

Then you can alienate the chaos outside.

And strive to pursue your inner peace.

From darkness to light.

From death to reborn.

 

 

Mazu Prosseion

The Black Rock Desert ,

Is allegedly used to be an part of ocean.

Goddess Mazu, is actually the protector of sea in our culture .

Faced with goodness and beliefs,

Even we across boarders and boundaries,

We share the same goodwill and understanding .

Burning Man Festival, as the symbol of free spirit,

Mazu, the representative of Eastern philosophy and love,

The subtle conflicts of this two images will spark discussion and thoughts .

 

 

We even hired Sam ,a professional samba drum player from Taiwan

To give us professional training in order to accompany the Mazu procession.

Our training time was very long and lasted until midnight,

Only because the rhythm of the procession is inside each of us .

 

 

We also tailor made our clothing for each character

The innocent good girl with long sleeves.

The sexy pirates swing the fishnets in the air.

We  will sing and dance with the procession in the desert

 

 

When The Dream Becomes Reality

Dream Community in Taiwan

 

We are very grateful that Dream Community in Taiwan has given us the opportunity and platform to do this art project,

To let us have the chance to show our creativity and imagination.

If  the tale of Burning Man is to build a city out of nothing within 8 days,

The tale of Taiwan Dream Community ,is one of the warmest and sweetest.

A group of people spent 18 years of their life, to build an utopian dream.

 

 

Why We Do Fund Raising


Dream Community has built a bridge of communication.

They introduce art, fun, creativity, courage and passion into normal people's life.

With various community carnivals and artist exchange projects.

They tell us with their action that dream could become true,

And your love and passion will become the  celebration of life.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Who Are We

 

Asian Youth Team of Burning man

We are 17 youngsters from different parts of Asia ,pursuing their dreams .

Taiwan

Peggy Su

Mingchun Li

Yaojia Su

Bingxuan Wu

Yunting Weng

Jianru Lv

Jialing Zhang

Guanqian Li

Xianwei Luo

Qianyi Li

Shenglong Xie

Mainland China 

Sibo Wang

Yi He

Ying Xu

Yao Yu

Hongyi Liu

As the largest scale Asia art project that made its way into Burning Man Festival in two decades ,we aim to introduce our oriental philosophy and value into the  Black Rock Desert City. This is a very crazy dream !

The fund  raised will be used in following subjects : 50% for art materials , 30 percent for Asian Youth training costs , 20% for transportation and tickets.

We want to promote our project the raise the influence.Also ,we hope to  give the inspiration that everyone has the right to pursue a dream .

“I am not the same, having seen the moon shine on the other side of the world.”

story:
An American Black Photographer N Greece - Overview

“An American Black Photographer N Greece” is a short documentary film that will follow up-and-coming photographer DJ Noj as he visits galleries in Thessaloniki and Athens, Greece (where two of his photos will be featured in exhibits from mid-November to mid-December 2019. One of the exhibitions is even hosted by American film actor Billy Zane).

He’s had  20 photos accepted in gallery exhibits in 9 countries demonstrating more than 15 types of photography in just this year alone, prompting him to want to actually see a show for himself.

This could be the start of a series where DJ Noj visits other countries where his photos are displayed and takes more photos along the way.

This is also an opportunity to show what it’s like to be a Black photographer from America traveling abroad, meeting artists and people, and sharing his art and outlook.

 

What is it? 

It’s a short documentary film chronicling DJ Noj, an American Black photographer, as he travels overseas to see his art on display in gallery exhibitions (in Greece, this time), and to take more photos and interact with artists and people who may have few instances of connecting with Black Americans. 

 

Who is DJ Noj? And why is this so important?

DJ Noj is a photographer, DJ, spoken word poet and filmmaker, who co-founded GravenImageFilms, LLC, with Geoffrey Bennett Ulrich, a writer, animator and filmmaker,

He’s been able to get his photos exhibited in gallery exhibitions in 9 countries this year alone, but he has yet to actually attend any of the openings.

In November 2019, he’ll have photos in three separate exhibits, two in Spain and one in Greece, and then another one in Greece in December. He’d love to be able to go see them all in person, but since that's a huge expense, Greece is more of a priority. 

He started taking pictures in elementary school, really getting into the art again six years ago. Perfecting his use of various types of gear at the lower end of the price range, but still managing to get photos in international exhibits right alongside those who have high-end gear and many more years of experience.

This is the very first year he’s ever even had a passport or been out of the Americas. He was invited as a guest to spend a week in Australia on a tour of various communities of indigenous people and, of course, he took a ton of pictures while he was there.

He couldn’t help but notice that Australians assumed he, too, was indigenous, and were very surprised to find that he was a Black American instead. On his trip he noticed just how few Black people were even getting on any planes. Recently, traveling domestically up the West coast, he noticed the same lack of Black travelers. 

So, being a filmmaker, he wants to chronicle his trip to Greece, the very model of Western Democracy, in the form of a documentary of a American Black Photographer experiencing another culture.

This could even be the start of a documentary series, as he  gets into other galleries in other countries.

And there are perks of course, for donating, from photo prints to swag. Check out our campaign for more details.

 

What’ll it take to make?

Even though it’s a documentary the costs will still include some typical filmmaking expenses such as writing, editing, music, equipment, marketing and distribution, in addition to the cost of travel, interviews, insurance, lodging, meals, and crowdfunding fees. 

We can manage with a skeleton crew (DJ Noj and GBU), as we have for years, because Graven Image Films, LLC knows how to stretch a dollar. We’ve released feature films, shorts, documentaries, music videos, and animations to name a few (www.GravenImageFilms.com). We’ve been invited to showcase our work at various venues and events including pop-up clubs, an underground museum, an art house, and, yes, even a film festival.

We have paid for our trips by selling t-shirts, unique merchandise, and even ad space on programs and gift bags.

This, however, is our most ambitious project yet.

 

The budget is $29,000 all in, which will be a tight budget, but it breaks down to: 

 

One month of pre-production and getting equipment, 

One month of travel and production, 

Two months of post-production, and then 

Two months of marketing and distribution. 

 

As well as the crowdfunding fee of 5%.

 

During and beyond that is the ongoing networking with various community groups, artists and minorities some of whom may never have been out of the country.

And that’s just the initial push. The money earned along the way, from merchandise and additional sponsorships will allow us to add to the series that this could become. 

 

What impact will this message have?

Through the combined power of film, the internet, and even interactive mobile apps, the impact of this message could have a global reach that could affect millions of people who believe that art and travel are only for the rich and the privileged.

 

Besides funding, what are some other ways to help?

Help us spread the word. Ultimately we want to make this world a better place to travel and exchange art and culture, and so, by sharing, you can help with that!

story:
My name is Aurelian R. Dinu and I am from Romania. 

The good news: I recently received the tremendous news that I was accepted to the MA in Art, Law and Business at Christie’s Education London.

This makes me very happy and proud as I will be the first person in my family to earn a postgraduate degree.

The bad news: I don’t have funds to pay for tuition and fees.

I am asking for your help — please!

Why this Master? I love the arts. I was born with this love in my blood. My father was a sculptor and painter. His last request to me, before he passed away after a long battle with cancer, was to encourage me to study art at a great institution. Christie’s has the only Master that combines Art, Law and Business, which I feel will give me the best shot at living my dream.

My hope is that, after completing this master, I will return to Romania to share what I’ve learned and to help in some way, somehow — helping Romanian artists express themselves internationally and exposing people to the healing power of art through youth and hospital programs.

I really love art and I would be more than happy to study there. And it is not because is the single master in the world that combine Art, Law and Business, not because is the single MA in the world that is owned by an auction house for real. Because I love art and I make a promise to my father!

To keep my seat in the class I must pay £1800 / €2016 / $2360 by August 15, 2018. The full Master is £ 36.000 / €40.320 / $ 47.214 divided into installments over the year.

You don’t know me. So your support would be somewhat of a miracle. But miracles happen and, I promise, I would put every dollar you donate to good use. I apologize for my desperation — but I was accepted too late to apply for a scholarship, so this is my best bet.

I want to make art my life — and, in the process, help others do the same.

Please help in any way you can – no matter how large. No matter how small.

Thank you in advance from the bottom of my heart!

story:
What is JSOUV?

Jsouv is a collection of 15 finely crafted souvenirs of extraordinary architectural landmarks from around the world. Using natural materials, minimalistic design and precision machining, Jsouv was created to experience the simple beauty of each architectural wonder in the palm of your hands.

My passion for travel and background in civil engineering inspired me to create architectural souvenirs with clean lines, durable materials, and a style that could complement the decor of a modern home or office space.



 

As Featured In


 

Memories From Around The World

I love to travel and visit extraordinary architectural and historic sites around the world. For every place I visit, I want to bring home a small, elegant piece to cherish and share the memory of these remarkable structures.


 

The Collection

The Jsouv collection features 15 landmarks from New York, London, Berlin, Istanbul, Dubai, Tokyo, and more. Each souvenir is CNC machined from a solid piece of aluminum or brass to ensure quality and precision.

The approximate dimensions of each souvenir is 6x6x6 cm (2.3 x 2.3 x 2.3 inches), and the average weight is 70 grams.


 

The Golden Edition

For those who love really precious things we created the special brass series. Each souvenir of this series is made of solid brass and polished to present a golden shine. They are more weighty in hand weighing approximately 150 grams, and look even more premium.


 

The Base

Each souvenir  comes with a natural walnut base engraved with a 2D emblem of the city landmark.

You can personalize the base with an engraving, made especially for you or someone you want to share your memory with.  See the Perks section below.

 

The Packaging

The souvenirs are individually packaged by hand and arrive in a beautiful package, ready to discover.


 

The Creation Process

I have spent the last two years creating the ideal collection from sketching ideas to machining and assembling each souvenir. My goals throughout the process have always been to create a souvenir with the smoothest finish and cleanest lines.

Sketching of Ideas

I started the process with many hand-drawn sketches.  I drew a lot of popular architectural attractions and then selected 15 of them for the first collection.


 

First Pre-Prototypes

The first prototypes were made of plasticine. This enabled me to determine the optimal size of the products.


 

3D Modeling & Engineering of Drawings

The next step was a long process and involved 3D modeling and the development of engineering drawings.


 

Production of Samples

In the development process, I experimented with different shapes, materials, and production technologies in order to achieve the ideal proportions and surface quality of the souvenirs.


 

The two methods that we used to produce the final samples are casting into a gypsum mold and direct CNC machining of metal. Many-axis CNC metal processing is an expensive method, but it allowed us to achieve the highest surface quality and create a unique product in small editions.
 

To complete the souvenir, I used a laser to engrave the base with the 2D emblem of the city landmark and neodymium magnets to secure the souvenir to the base.

I experimented with different kinds of wood for the base to find the perfect shade, and I tested a number of different magnets to provide a strong, delicate coupling.

The magnets enable the souvenir to be experienced by itself or with the base to create a different type of display.

 

Perks

We ship worldwide!
We will send you a survey by email so that you can specify the model of the souvenir.




If you don't see a perk that you want or have any questions, contact me at hello@jsouv.com
If you want to see another landmark in our collection please send us a request to made this. When we get a sufficient number of requests, we will design this one.

Jsouv t-shirts collection

Jsouv t-shirts feature the unique, stylish 2D emblems of each city and landmark in the collection. T-shirts are sewn from high-quality, soft fabric (95% cotton, 5% lycra). Male and female sizes range from XS to XXL. T-shirts are made using multi-color silk-screen printing in several layers to create a high saturation of ink that will resist fading even after repeated washing.


 

The Results From Two Years of Work

The result of the last year is the collection of 15 souvenirs of amazing architectural landmarks.

I have loved the process of discovering Jsouv and now I’m ready to share this collection with people around the world, to reminisce about great travel and to inspire new adventures. Travel is such an important life experience and we all should have the opportunity to do it throughout our lives.

Thank you for your support and safe travels!


Konstantin. Creator of Jsouv.
Rostov-on-Don, Russia
www.koskolesov.com
 

Timeline

 

Risks and challenges

We’ve already produced a batch of souvenirs to special order. Initial production allowed us to study the particularities of the technologies we use, and learn through trial and error. Now, we are ready to begin serial production of the souvenirs and make them available for purchase worldwide.
In case of a successful funding campaign, we will continue to add new cities and landmarks to the collection.

 

FAQ

How can I choose a souvenir for order?
1. Chose your perk and complete the payment
3. We will send you a survey by mail so that you can specify the model of the souvenir.

What are the approximate dimensions of the souvenirs?
Approximate dimensions of souvenirs are 6x6x6 cm (2.3 x 2.3 x 2.3 inches)

How much do the souvenirs weigh?
Average weight of aluminum souvenir is 70 grams.
Average weight of brass souvenir is 150 grams.

What are my choice of metals?
Aluminum (metallic surface) and Brass (shiny golden surface).

What comes with my souvenir?
Metal piece, wooden base and card with thanks and a wishes.

How are the souvenirs packaged?
They are packed in kraft boxes filled with wooden wool.

How do I customize the base of my souvenir?
You can personalize the base with an engraving. An inscription is specially designed for you and engraved on the back of a wooden base (Up to 30 characters)
1. Choose this perk in addition to your souvenir
2. We will contact you to find out your text

How do the souvenirs stay connected to the base?
The metal pieces are connected to the base by neodymium magnets and can easily be removed whenever you like.

Where are the souvenirs made?
Souvenirs designed and assembled in Rostov-on-Don, Russia. T-shirts also produced in Rostov-on-Don.

Why is Jsouv only offering these 15 souvenirs? What about other structures?
We hope that these 15 souvenirs are just the beginning of our great work. You can contact us and suggest another landmark for the future.
If you are a dealer, we can design and produce a new souvenir according to your special order.

What is Jsouv’s goal after Indiegogo?
We plan to sell our products in souvenir shops in popular tourist spots


If you have any questions, feel free to contact us at hello@jsouv.com. We’d love to hear from you.
story_txt:
What is JSOUV?
Jsouv is a collection of 15 finely crafted souvenirs of extraordinary architectural landmarks from around the world. Using natural materials, minimalistic design and precision machining, Jsouv was created to experience the simple beauty of each architectural wonder in the palm of your hands.




My passion for travel and background in civil engineering inspired me to create architectural souvenirs with clean lines, durable materials, and a style that could complement the decor of a modern home or office space.

 

As Featured In

 
Memories From Around The World
I love to travel and visit extraordinary architectural and historic sites around the world. For every place I visit, I want to bring home a small, elegant piece to cherish and share the memory of these remarkable structures.


 
The Collection
The Jsouv collection features 15 landmarks from New York, London, Berlin, Istanbul, Dubai, Tokyo, and more. Each souvenir is CNC machined from a solid piece of aluminum or brass to ensure quality and precision.
The approximate dimensions of each souvenir is 6x6x6 cm (2.3 x 2.3 x 2.3 inches), and the average weight is 70 grams.
 

The Golden Edition
For those who love really precious things we created the special brass series. Each souvenir of this series is made of solid brass and polished to present a golden shine. They are more weighty in hand weighing approximately 150 grams, and look even more premium.
 
The Base
Each souvenir  comes with a natural walnut base engraved with a 2D emblem of the city landmark.
You can personalize the base with an engraving, made especially for you or someone you want to share your memory with.  See the Perks section below.

 
The Packaging
The souvenirs are individually packaged by hand and arrive in a beautiful package, ready to discover.
 
The Creation Process
I have spent the last two years creating the ideal collection from sketching ideas to machining and assembling each souvenir. My goals throughout the process have always been to create a souvenir with the smoothest finish and cleanest lines.
Sketching of Ideas
I started the process with many hand-drawn sketches.  I drew a lot of popular architectural attractions and then selected 15 of them for the first collection.
 
First Pre-Prototypes
The first prototypes were made of plasticine. This enabled me to determine the optimal size of the products.
 
3D Modeling & Engineering of Drawings
The next step was a long process and involved 3D modeling and the development of engineering drawings.

 
Production of Samples
In the development process, I experimented with different shapes, materials, and production technologies in order to achieve the ideal proportions and surface quality of the souvenirs.

 
The two methods that we used to produce the final samples are casting into a gypsum mold and direct CNC machining of metal. Many-axis CNC metal processing is an expensive method, but it allowed us to achieve the highest surface quality and create a unique product in small editions. 
To complete the souvenir, I used a laser to engrave the base with the 2D emblem of the city landmark and neodymium magnets to secure the souvenir to the base.
I experimented with different kinds of wood for the base to find the perfect shade, and I tested a number of different magnets to provide a strong, delicate coupling.
The magnets enable the souvenir to be experienced by itself or with the base to create a different type of display.

 
Perks
We ship worldwide!We will send you a survey by email so that you can specify the model of the souvenir.

If you don't see a perk that you want or have any questions, contact me at hello@jsouv.comIf you want to see another landmark in our collection please send us a request to made this. When we get a sufficient number of requests, we will design this one.
Jsouv t-shirts collection
Jsouv t-shirts feature the unique, stylish 2D emblems of each city and landmark in the collection. T-shirts are sewn from high-quality, soft fabric (95% cotton, 5% lycra). Male and female sizes range from XS to XXL. T-shirts are made using multi-color silk-screen printing in several layers to create a high saturation of ink that will resist fading even after repeated washing.
 
The Results From Two Years of Work
The result of the last year is the collection of 15 souvenirs of amazing architectural landmarks.
I have loved the process of discovering Jsouv and now I’m ready to share this collection with people around the world, to reminisce about great travel and to inspire new adventures. Travel is such an important life experience and we all should have the opportunity to do it throughout our lives.
Thank you for your support and safe travels!
Konstantin. Creator of Jsouv.Rostov-on-Don, Russiawww.koskolesov.com 
Timeline

 
Risks and challenges
We’ve already produced a batch of souvenirs to special order. Initial production allowed us to study the particularities of the technologies we use, and learn through trial and error. Now, we are ready to begin serial production of the souvenirs and make them available for purchase worldwide.In case of a successful funding campaign, we will continue to add new cities and landmarks to the collection.
 
FAQ
How can I choose a souvenir for order?1. Chose your perk and complete the payment3. We will send you a survey by mail so that you can specify the model of the souvenir.
What are the approximate dimensions of the souvenirs?Approximate dimensions of souvenirs are 6x6x6 cm (2.3 x 2.3 x 2.3 inches)
How much do the souvenirs weigh?Average weight of aluminum souvenir is 70 grams.Average weight of brass souvenir is 150 grams.
What are my choice of metals?Aluminum (metallic surface) and Brass (shiny golden surface).
What comes with my souvenir?Metal piece, wooden base and card with thanks and a wishes.
How are the souvenirs packaged?They are packed in kraft boxes filled with wooden wool.
How do I customize the base of my souvenir?You can personalize the base with an engraving. An inscription is specially designed for you and engraved on the back of a wooden base (Up to 30 characters)1. Choose this perk in addition to your souvenir2. We will contact you to find out your text
How do the souvenirs stay connected to the base?The metal pieces are connected to the base by neodymium magnets and can easily be removed whenever you like.
Where are the souvenirs made?Souvenirs designed and assembled in Rostov-on-Don, Russia. T-shirts also produced in Rostov-on-Don.
Why is Jsouv only offering these 15 souvenirs? What about other structures?We hope that these 15 souvenirs are just the beginning of our great work. You can contact us and suggest another landmark for the future.If you are a dealer, we can design and produce a new souvenir according to your special order.
What is Jsouv’s goal after Indiegogo?We plan to sell our products in souvenir shops in popular tourist spots
If you have any questions, feel free to contact us at hello@jsouv.com. We’d love to hear from you.

story:
'Experience Architecture' Book

A collection that will take you on journey between abstract and detailed architectural photographs. A journey in photos that you don't normally take with the architecture around you.

In the book, you will experience the way that Isaac Burrier experiences the architecture around him. Burrier wants to change the way you interact with the buildings you interact with on a regular basis because there is more of a beauty to the architecture than most people realize. He also wants you to see architecture as an art form through the beauty in the photos.

'EXPERIENCE.everything' Brand

'Experience Architecture' is just the start to a bigger project that Isaac Burrier is working on. With the help of both the book and this campaign, Burrier will be able to launch the beginnings of his brand, 'EXPERIENCE.everything.' He plans on using the brand to continue sharing his photographed experiences through books, photo prints, and t-shirts. 

Why 'Experience Architecture' and 'EXPERIENCE.everything' Need Funding

The money in this campaign will go towards the following items:

  • Printing the first 50 books
  • The ISBN for the book
  • The costs of labels and packaging for the books
  • Launching the first stages of 'EXPERIENCE.everything'

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate anything, 'EXPERIENCE.everything' would love you if you did any of the following things:

  • Give love to the brand's social media
    • Instagram: @experience.everything
    • Tumblr: @experienceeverything
    • Facebook: EXPERIENCE.everything
  • Share the online store (once launched): www.experienceeverything.storenvy.com
  • Share this campaign on your social medias

Thank you!

story:
Who's that for?

  1. Star Wars fans  
  2. Interior Designers and Decorators 
  3. For people who like to assemble their own hands
  4. Origami and Lego lovers
  5. Handmaders, who are in searching of inspiration

 

Who is behind the scenes

Alex Odincov, 29, founder of Studio66Designs

Since 2012 working as a low-poly 3D artist, once being in search of inspiration came across a post on Pinterest about papercraft. That was amazing! That is what can bring to life 3D models (without having 3D printer of course). Being a fan of the Star Wars universe decided to implement a long-standing plan - to create a sculpture made of paper of his own vision, so was born the First Order Stormtrooper, and then Darth Vader. In the plans to create a whole line of sculptures such as Boba Fett, Imperial Stormtrooper, C-3PO, etc.

 

Paper brings 3D on a new level!

 

Darth Vader Papercraft Bust

Darth Vader doesn't need to be represented, for sure there is no one person who wouldn't have heard or seen him at least once. Now you can make your own, using paper, cardstock or even recycled paper. Recommended to use at least  160g/sq.m paper, better 220g/sq.m

Assembled size of ready sculpture:

  • Height: 62cm (24.4in)
  • Width: 56cm (22in)
  • Depth: 33.1cm (13in)

Consists of 113 parts on 39 pages (ready to print on both A4 and US letter paper)

 

Difficulty Level: Hard (not recommended for beginners)

It will take about 12-18 hours to create a Darth Vader Bust. 

This time is a great opportunity to test your patience, 

also to relax and forget about everyday hustle and bustle! 

For detailed instructions you can look this link on Instructables.

 

 

First Order Stormtrooper

Papercraft Bust

Stormtrooper is the second most famous character of the Star Wars universe, there are at least 15 variations in appearance and purpose, but this, the First Order Stormtrooper, attracted me more than anyone else. Now you can make your own, using paper, cardstock or even recycled paper. Recommended to use at least  160g/sq.m paper, better 220g/sq.m

Assembled size of ready sculpture:

  • Height: 60cm (23.6in)
  • Width: 48.2cm (19in)
  • Depth: 26.5cm (10.4in)

Consists of 117 parts on 35 pages (ready to print on both A4 and US letter paper)

Difficulty Level: Medium 

It will take about 10-15 hours to create a Stormtrooper Bust. 

This time is a great opportunity to test your patience, 

also to relax and forget about everyday hustle and bustle! 

 

 

Awesome masterpiece shouldn't be expensive, but worth it to build your own!

 

But what is papercraft?

The most accurate description that comes to mind - 3D Puzzle.

As Wikipedia says: Papercraft - is the collection of art forms employing paper or card as the primary artistic medium for the creation of three-dimensional objects. It is the most widely used material in arts and crafts. It lends itself to a wide range of techniques, as it can for instance be folded, cut, glued, molded, stitched, or layered.

To bring to life any 3D model you will need:

  • Printer
  • Ruler
  • Brush (recommended)
  • Tweezers (optional)
  • Utility knife or scissors
  • Glue (PVA-based or gluestick)

  • Cutting mat (where you can cut paper, without harming your table) Also you will need a nonworking pen or something similar to score the edges.

  • And strange as it may sound - Paper - (I recommend to use at least 160g/sq.m paper, better 220g/sq.m) Since patterns goes blank you can use both colored paper and white (and then paint it)​

Seems nothing difficult, but in fact you need one more thing - Pattern! So here we are!

With detailed instructions and "what is the part" images it will be fun way to test your patience and accuracy, but the result worth it!

The process of assembling is easy, you just need to print, cut/fold and glue parts together. All parts goes in alphabetical order, so you just need to adhere to the assembly order, starting from A1, A2 and so on. 

 

After cutting, scoring and folding all parts, you can start assembling. I recommend to spread the details into groups, like A- parts together, B- parts together and so on. 

 

Why Indiegogo?

I believe that Indiegogo community positively perceives new initiatives and with interest supports ideas, people gather here, in search of something unusual. I have much to grow, have many ideas and far-reaching plans. Therefore, I ask you to support my project, and in return I offer you ready-made models with a discount. This will be a PDF file with detailed instructions and the unwrap of the selected model for self-assembly. All models are designed with an intuitive and convenient assembly. This is indicated by the feedback of my customers. 

 

Risks, Goals & Delivery

Risks

I believe that without a working idea it is difficult to earn the confidence of the backers. Successfully running online shop on Etsy since 2016 with more than 280 sales and over 30 "5-star" reviews, due to the nature of product there are absolutely no risks since both models are ready, the instructions are written, tested for ease of assembly and are ready to please real fans of the series. 

Goals

In case of successful campaign:

  1. I'm going to continue the series with new models, so far in the minds of Boba Fett, Imperial Stormtrooper, C-3PO. Maybe some of the contributors will tell their ideas. 
  2. Customize the production of ready-to-assemble kits (printed and pre-cutted)

In case of non-successful campaign - Even if I do not achieve goal, I will continue to move forward, because this is my real passion.

Delivery

Due to the nature of digital files there is no need for physical shipping, in case of successful campaign you will receive a digital link to download your PDF pattern(s) within 24 hours after campaign is ended. The campaign is due by May 4 - May the 4th be with you! If you want to please your friends - you can specify their email and the pattern you selected will be sent to them in the form of a gift!

 

I Am One with the Force and the Force is With Me

If you have no idea why you need these patterns or don't interested - you can help by sharing a word out with people about this project through blogs/social media/etc. Maybe among your friends or acquaintances there are true fans of Star Wars, and you have no idea about it, let them know!

+ Karma

You can use any type of sharing (including Indiegogo sharing tools) or links below (clickable)

 

or

 

 

F.A.Q.

I am new to Papercraft, is it for me?

Absolutely yes, as practice shows, if you follow the instructions - there is nothing complicated. The complexity of models is determined by assembly time rather than by real difficulty.

 

What type of paper should I use? 

I recommend to use at least 160g/sq.m paper, better 220g/sq.m. You can use both colored paper and white (and then paint it).

 

What I will get if I will make a contribution?

In case successful campaign, you will receive digital DIY PDF Pattern for self-assembling, depending on chosen perk, of course.

 

Can I ask for a refund?

Absolutely, until you haven't downloaded(received) the file, I will refund you as soon as you contact me with such request as long as it is within Indiegogo refund policy.

 

Product Gallery

 

Thank you for your time and support!

story:
Short Summary

ArtPrt, launched in 2018 year, has already site - artprt.com, Instagram page (art.a.part) and 41 freelancer! We are a totally self supported platform, trying to create fair wages and a safe working environment for freelancers around the world. Our technology is simple to use, mobile adaptive! ArtPrt have no charges any for freelancer! We help them.

At the moment we have sections: logo design, portraits by photo, audio section, business card design, t-shirt design, package design and create a new service.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for funds to complete one or both of these some features:

1. CREATE A SECTION "DO IT BY YOURSELF".

The peculiarity of this section will be the online designing of any service for a very low cost. For example: a person needs to make a logo. Instead of ordering it from a freelancer for $ 10, he can make it himself in a special designer for only $ 2. At the same time, the logo will not look awful, we have our own logo creation system based on the interests of clients in different business niches. The creation of the system costs $ 350. The creation of systems will take our own freelancers Nick Lavetsky and Tian Tao.

2. UNIQUE COLLABORATION SYSTEMS: EMPLOYEE-STAFF, STAFF-CUSTOMER (CREATIVE SPACE).

Often, several people are required to perform complex tasks (computation, coding, 3d graphics, animation, music). To do this, this system will be made, which is a cabinet with a mindmaps, a chat with a file transfer and many convenient functions.

3. LOGIN-PASSWORD SYSTEM, SCORE SYSTEM, CHAT.

We need a mandatory login-password system for the visitor and freelancer (cost of creation, implementation, testing - $ 500), a system of accumulating points when buying on the site ($ 200) and a chat system for visitors and freelancers ($ 110). The creation of systems will take our own freelancers Nick Lavetsky and Tian Tao, programmers with a lot of experience. Why hire when you have yours? :)

4. SECTION "PHYSICAL SERVICES".
We want to add a section of physical services to the site. Customers want, for example, to get a carpet cleaned or walk a dog, put up their inquiry and wait for the performer. The creation of this section is almost the creation of a new site and costs $ 200.

5. ADVERTISING IN ADWORDS, SOCIAL NETWORKS, INTERNET IMPRESSIONS.

Of course, we need to grow, so a small part of the money will be invested in advertising the service. How to attract attention without advertising? It will be engaged in our PR manager - Kate. The amount of expenses is 230 $ (Adword, Yandex Ad, Social Networks, publications).

And of course, we help freelancers to find means of subsistence, the meaning of life, a career. This is also a very important task!

The Impact

The main goal is to provide work to professionals who have remained without a permanent job. Losing money leads to loss of life and health!

Creating a "DO IT BY YOURSELF" section will help people who have so many tasks (draw hundreds of portraits or make many logos) to save, and enterprising people to earn money.

"UNIQUE COLLABORATION SYSTEM" will speed up the work and make life easier for both parties.

LOGIN-PASSWORD SYSTEM, SCORE SYSTEM, CHAT will add the necessary conditions for the learning of the site by the client and freelancer.

ADVERTISING help to find the face of the company and give work.

Risks & Challenges

Our site will continue to exist because, he also brings bread to me, not only to other freelancers, I'm a freelancer. You can also check the functions of the site in the course of time.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are only asking for a $1-5 contribution! There is strength in numbers and we are a growing community.  If you can't contribute financially, please spread the word about ArtPrt. 

Share our site:

www.artprt.com

Share our campaign, too.

At the same time, the logo will not look awful, we have our own logo creation system based on the interests of clients in different business niches. The creation of the system costs $ 350. The creation of systems will take our own freelancers Nick Lavetsky and Tian Tao.
2. UNIQUE COLLABORATION SYSTEMS: EMPLOYEE-STAFF, STAFF-CUSTOMER (CREATIVE SPACE).
Often, several people are required to perform complex tasks (computation, coding, 3d graphics, animation, music). To do this, this system will be made, which is a cabinet with a mindmaps, a chat with a file transfer and many convenient functions.
3. LOGIN-PASSWORD SYSTEM, SCORE SYSTEM, CHAT.
We need a mandatory login-password system for the visitor and freelancer (cost of creation, implementation, testing - $ 500), a system of accumulating points when buying on the site ($ 200) and a chat system for visitors and freelancers ($ 110). The creation of systems will take our own freelancers Nick Lavetsky and Tian Tao, programmers with a lot of experience. Why hire when you have yours? :)
4. SECTION "PHYSICAL SERVICES".We want to add a section of physical services to the site. Customers want, for example, to get a carpet cleaned or walk a dog, put up their inquiry and wait for the performer. The creation of this section is almost the creation of a new site and costs $ 200.
5. ADVERTISING IN ADWORDS, SOCIAL NETWORKS, INTERNET IMPRESSIONS.
Of course, we need to grow, so a small part of the money will be invested in advertising the service. How to attract attention without advertising? It will be engaged in our PR manager - Kate. The amount of expenses is 230 $ (Adword, Yandex Ad, Social Networks, publications).
And of course, we help freelancers to find means of subsistence, the meaning of life, a career. This is also a very important task!

The Impact
The main goal is to provide work to professionals who have remained without a permanent job. Losing money leads to loss of life and health!
Creating a "DO IT BY YOURSELF" section will help people who have so many tasks (draw hundreds of portraits or make many logos) to save, and enterprising people to earn money.
"UNIQUE COLLABORATION SYSTEM" will speed up the work and make life easier for both parties.
LOGIN-PASSWORD SYSTEM, SCORE SYSTEM, CHAT will add the necessary conditions for the learning of the site by the client and freelancer.
ADVERTISING help to find the face of the company and give work.

Risks & Challenges
Our site will continue to exist because, he also brings bread to me, not only to other freelancers, I'm a freelancer. You can also check the functions of the site in the course of time.

Other Ways You Can Help
We are only asking for a $1-5 contribution! There is strength in numbers and we are a growing community.  If you can't contribute financially, please spread the word about ArtPrt. 
Share our site:
www.artprt.com
Share our campaign, too.

Short Summary

PRACHEEN SHREE SHIV MANDIR CHARITABLE TRUST is located in Chandigarh Chandigarh . PRACHEEN SHREE SHIV MANDIR CHARITABLE TRUST is registered as a Trust at Chandigarh of state Chandigarh with Ngo unique registration ID 'CH/2013/0070980' . The NGO registration is done by Sub-Registrar with registration number 4810 on the date of 15-12-2008, Its parent ORganaisation is Pracheen Shree Shiv Mandir Charitable Trust. TheChairman of PRACHEEN SHREE SHIV MANDIR CHARITABLE TRUST is Krishan Kumar Mishra and Chief functionary officer is Krishan Kumar Mishra

What We Doing

This PRACHEEN SHREE SHIV MANDIR CHARITABLE TRUST NGO charity is working on Key Issues of Aged/Elderly, Art & Culture, Children, Civic Issues, Differently Abled, Disaster Management, Education & Literacy, Health & Family Welfare, Rural Development & Poverty Alleviation, Vocational Training, Women's Development & Empowerment, Any Other

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About the Artist:

Kelley Anderson is an artist based in Los Angeles who has been working with plants and natural materials since childhood. Drawing on her meditative practice and the woods of her native Connecticut, her work is intended to inspire and connect people back to nature. Her work has been featured at SXSW, TED talks, WE  RISE LA, Forbes, West Elm, Create & Cultivate, and in various architectural installations around the globe.

‘ I think of my botanical art as a window into the harmony of the natural world. I want people to feel and experience that joy, love, and divinity that can be seen so clearly in nature.’-Kelley Anderson

Fraktel is my next large scale experiential installation that is intended to support people's internal emotional state. The installation immerses people within a controlled multi-sesory environment, that leads them to journey within themselves, connecting to their inner self, and to nature, eliciting feeling of awe, joy and peace. 

My vision is to heal people through immersive environmental art, and to touch thousands and thousands of hearts across the globe.

Fraktel's team is composed of 10 volunteers from a structural engineer and architect, to contractors, life coaches and therapists. We need your support to raise the fund to cover the cost of the materials to build Fraktel and all our sweat, tears and Love will go to build it!

We get to raise $12,000 to cover the materials to build the structure and to transport it to and from BRC, NV.  Any additional funds we will receive will go to support Fraktel's fall tour and get it out into the world for more people to experience.

Risks and Challenges: getting any art work to the playa is challenging work but we are 100% committed to getting it there any way we can! With your support to fund the materials, you will ensure this dream becomes a reality and touches the hearts of thousands!

story:
Who we are...

We are four creatives: artists, a gallerist, a publisher, and a charity professional.

Maria Sel, the mastermind behind the Macte Art project, is an artist, healer and feminist. In her ‘Love Yourself’ project, she was painting abstract works while pleasing herself with a clitoral stimulator. After her work was dubbed as ‘pornographic’, she rebelled against the double standards of the conservative society and decided to create a safe space for people to explore themselves and their sexuality and express it through art.

Jannah is on the board of Street Child EU Charity organization and has been involved with them for 9 years. She is a trauma therapist working with PTSD / anxiety / fears & sometimes use art in the therapy work. She is a photographer and painter, whose works were exhibited in London and the US.

Cristina is a curator and art historian specialized on latin american women studies, who is living between Barcelona and Mexico city. She has been involved in many curatorial projects and has a substantial background as a gallerist.  

Anna worked for a famous art newspaper for 4 years. Having delivered a range of print and digital projects, she moved from London to Barcelona, where she works on a magazine, dedicated to the Russian Art scene and as a freelance marketing manager.

What we are doing now...

The Macte Art project is aimed at supporting emerging artists working across different genres and media. As females, we know how challenging it may be to navigate the art world and pass the gatekeepers. As immigrants, we know that finding a place for you and your art in a foreign country requires ruthless energy and determination. And as artists, we know it is hard enough to find your way, find representation and showcase your work.

We create the Macte Art space to address all of these issues. We want to create a safe space for artists from countries, where freedom of expression is politically oppressed or stigmatised by the conservative society, and religion. We also aim to support local artists from Barcelona and to facilitate the connection among the local art scene and the international art communities. Finally, we are eager to give emerging artists, especially females and LGBTQI, a voice and strength to express themselves through art. As we realise the cultural sensitivities at play, we will make sure that each artist, regardless of the gender, sexual orientation, religion or origin feels safe, free to create and welcome by others in our artistic residency.

We are going to create a bespoke educational programme for collectors to guide them through new ways to understand art and political and sexual context underlying it.

What we need...

We have already prepared the physical space and set up a company according to the Spanish law. We’re currently building our website, setting the programme for the residence and making research for our first exhibitions. Because starting a business is difficult and although we’ve done a lot already, we need your help to get it off the ground.
The money will be used for the research and administrative overheads, such as:

 

  • Space lease
  • Artistic residency, materials, teachers and speakers salary
  • New website  
  • Educational and outreach programme
  • Research
  • Hosting, email marketing software, CRM
  • Art mounting and art shipping fees
  • Misc. Bills

*Any money raised above our goal will go to help artists launch their career.

Your support will help us cover the cost of running the space and administrative overheads for a year–time enough to build a database and establish the exhibition programme and art residence.

Perks

Our backers will receive an original postcard, a print with an artwork of our founder, Maria Sel, from her "Rebirth" series, featuring a hatching egg and her provocative "Love Yourself" series featering orgasms, annual membership of Macte Art Club or one of original artworks from Inner World series made by Maria Sel.    

Spread the WORD!

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially, so please help us get the word out and share this with your friends and family. Let's make some noise!

story:
Hey, I'm Krystle Brown

I'm a visual artist living in working in Boston for the past decade and a lifelong New Englander. Recently, I completed my Master's of Fine Arts degree at the School of the Museum of Fine Arts at Tufts University. While I was in school, I was the curator of the first year exhibition, "defunthisshow", was a recipient of the Montague Travel Grant to conduct research in Northern Ireland, and was awarded the Katherine Romero Graduating Student Award. Since this May, I have been in numerous exhibitions, including the Webster Court Project in Newton MA, where I was Co-Curator. I also was an artist in residence at Lazuli Residency in Corinth Vermont this past September, which was a very transformative experience. Basically, I have been a very busy gal.

Then whoa...I got into another residency!

Two weeks ago, I got the news that I was accepted to attend the Vermont Studio Center for this coming February. This is an excellent opportunity for an emerging or established artist alike. Artist residencies like Vermont Studio Center give artists time and space to develop their projects and connect artists together from across the globe that may never be able to meet otherwise. Residencies are a gateway for future collaborations, exhibitions, and grant funding. If you are a visual artist, then being an artist in residence shows that you are serious about your work, and others will notice that. In short, it is an absolute privilege to go somewhere like Vermont Studio Center, and sadly, many artists do not get this amazing chance.

To help defray the cost of going, I was awarded the VSC Grant and the Community Service Award, totaling in $1,650 of financial aid. The rest of the cost is up to me to come up with, a nice sum of $2,300. That is just to go, however, I will also need money for: 

                           February Rent for my Studio and Apartment plus utilities: Roughly $900

                           Some way to make up for a month of no income: $700

                           Transportation and other materials: $100

Overall, I would need to raise $4,000 to be able to attend VSC and not be financially in trouble. This is where I am asking you, friends, family, art supporters, for any amount you are willing to give to help me achieve this dream!

What you can get in return:

Well first and foremost, my undying gratitude. Seriously! Being a working artist in a society that isn't always as supportive of the arts is hard work, but I am here and I'm doing it!

But Christmas is coming up and I have quite a few photographs, paintings, and drawings that would love new homes. So you would be helping an artist and get the chance to score some art, while also clearing up space in my apartment? That's a triple win situation right there, better get on it!

You will be able to select a piece when you choose to donate. I will be updating this page regularly with photos of the work (I have quite a few pieces). Photographs will be in editions of five and the sizing of everything will be noted.

In addition to the selling of original artwork, I will be offering a private cake decorating classes at Oakleaf Cakes. This would be one on one class with me in either Buttercream Basics or Fun with Fondant, in which you would come home with a 5" cake that you have decorated with my guidance! Just please note that this class would need to be set up at least a week ahead of time and on a weekday evening, so that way I can plan and have space in the bakery.

Risks & Challenges

There aren't any risks involved with supporting this campaign. You will be helping an emerging artist go to a very well known and sought after residency. My biggest challenge is just to raise this large sum of money before February.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the cash to spare, you can always spread the word! Maybe someone in your extended network would love to support the arts more and some of the best ways to do that is by direct giving, such as this campaign!

story:
About Abalon

Abalon was established in London in 2015 and works across a range of porcelain designs (candles, jewellery and lamps).

I started Abalon to bring high quality and original design to porcelain. The pieces have been loved by many and exhibited in many different places (including London, Paris, New York and Madrid). I am also listed in the Crafts Council directory.

I am also passionate about sustainability and the environment. That is why I only use organic soya wax and do not manufacture with additives or paraffin (unlike many other candle producers). 

 

So what am I working on at the moment?

I am using kickstarter to support the launch of our new refill range. This is more sustainable than buying non-eco candles or having a new candle holder with every purchase.

Your support will allow me to buy the materials that I need and to support the marketing campaign to establish the refill subscription. And allow you to be the first to receive these beautiful works of art.

Our refill subscription will include:

- a hand made translucent porcelain candle holder (London Black range) with gold lip; and

- a six month subscription to candle refills (delivered at the start and in month three).

 

Everything we do is sustainable. This includes using eco-friendly soya candles and wicks :-) and we will be making the candles in both lavender and lemon grass scents.

Our candle refills are simple to use: once the candle has burnt either wash it by hand or use a dishwasher (always remove the remaining wax with warm water before placing it in the dishwasher). Our online video shows how to do this!

 

Tea Light

I am also offering this porcelain tea light to those who wish to support this project outside of the subscription. These beautiful objects are made in a similar way to the translucent holders and are finished in glaze as well as gold.

 

A bit more detail on how we make our porcelain candle holders and candles:

– The porcelain is sourced in Stoke-on-Trent

– We only use real gold in the finishes

– Our wicks are eco-friendly and made of cotton

– We only use 100% natural Norfolk distilled pure essential oil

– The candles are made from sustainable, renewable plant-based wax

– Which contains no herbicides or pesticides and is biodegradable

– Non-toxic. Burns for around 25-30 hours (initial candle) and 15-20 hours (each refill)

– Dimensions: 7cm x 9cm.

story:
Breve reseña

Festival Venezolano de Cine de la Diversidad nace en 2011 como una nueva plataforma para exponer los derechos de las personas LGBTI. Nace más allá de una mirada exclusivamente militante o política.

Este 2015 cumple 5 años y nuestros lemas #CINEVERSATIL y #AmarEsRespetar identifican la necesidad de "no ir en contra del sistema heteronormado" sino aprender a "convivir con el sistema heteronormado". Se trata de respetar, convivir y amar.

Gracias al financiamiento de los colaboradores podremos seguir concienciando a través de nuestras actividades al público en general sobre la necesidad de amar y respetar sin importar si somos LGBTI.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos 500$ para completar  gastos de impresión, transporte, refrigerios y material POP. Venezuela atraviesa un difícil momento económico y no queremos dejar de realizar el festival.

Al recaudar los 500$ el Festival puede realizar todas las actividades educativas planteadas.

De no lograrse la meta los fondos serán destinados al mismo rubro e igual realizaremos el festival.

El impacto

Nuestro proyecto es novedoso en Venezuela, somos el único festival de cine LGBTI competitivo. Nos hemos mantenido durante ya 5 años y nuestra meta siempre ha sido luchar contra la polarización política que vive Venezuela. No podemos pregonar la no discriminación a los LGBTI si discriminamos por razones políticas. Es incongruente.

El festival va más allá de la exhibición de películas. Hemos publicado libros y artículos sobre cine de diversidad sexual, hemos visitado universidades y realizado actividades educativas conjunto con las embajadas.

Riesgos y desafíos

Nos hemos caracterizado por no decepcionar al público asistente. En 2012 no logramos financiamiento e igual se realizó el festival con éxito. En ese momento todos los miembros del festival contribuimos con el mayor esfuerzo y pasión posible. El norte no es el lucro.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Aquellas personas o empresas que no puedan realizar donaciones pueden difundir esta campaña usando las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo y todas las redes sociales.


FESTDIVQ 2011

story_txt:
Breve reseña Festival Venezolano de Cine de la Diversidad nace en 2011 como una nueva plataforma para exponer los derechos de las personas LGBTI. Nace más allá de una mirada exclusivamente militante o política.
Este 2015 cumple 5 años y nuestros lemas #CINEVERSATIL y #AmarEsRespetar identifican la necesidad de "no ir en contra del sistema heteronormado" sino aprender a "convivir con el sistema heteronormado". Se trata de respetar, convivir y amar.
Gracias al financiamiento de los colaboradores podremos seguir concienciando a través de nuestras actividades al público en general sobre la necesidad de amar y respetar sin importar si somos LGBTI.
  


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes
Necesitamos 500$ para completar  gastos de impresión, transporte, refrigerios y material POP. Venezuela atraviesa un difícil momento económico y no queremos dejar de realizar el festival.
Al recaudar los 500$ el Festival puede realizar todas las actividades educativas planteadas.
De no lograrse la meta los fondos serán destinados al mismo rubro e igual realizaremos el festival.
  




El impacto
 Nuestro proyecto es novedoso en Venezuela, somos el único festival de cine LGBTI competitivo. Nos hemos mantenido durante ya 5 años y nuestra meta siempre ha sido luchar contra la polarización política que vive Venezuela. No podemos pregonar la no discriminación a los LGBTI si discriminamos por razones políticas. Es incongruente.
El festival va más allá de la exhibición de películas. Hemos publicado libros y artículos sobre cine de diversidad sexual, hemos visitado universidades y realizado actividades educativas conjunto con las embajadas.   

Riesgos y desafíos Nos hemos caracterizado por no decepcionar al público asistente. En 2012 no logramos financiamiento e igual se realizó el festival con éxito. En ese momento todos los miembros del festival contribuimos con el mayor esfuerzo y pasión posible. El norte no es el lucro.   

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar  Aquellas personas o empresas que no puedan realizar donaciones pueden difundir esta campaña usando las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo y todas las redes sociales.



FESTDIVQ 2011

FESTDIVQ 2012

FESTDIVQ 2013

FESTDIVQ 2014

FESTDIVQ 2015

story:
Grace and I - and our school - have had a lot of exposure in the papers, on the radio, and online because we did the original drawings for Anthony's charity children's book, "Charlie, The Migrating Snail", so we decided to give other children the opportunity to do the illustrations for Book Three which will be published next year. The thing is we need a website to run the painting competition and get the message out to showcase all the entries.

We've raised a lot of money for charity with Book One so far, and are helping the homeless, helping buy school supplies for underprivileged school children, and have even helped out a widows and orphans center in Africa, and with Book Two coming later this year we want to sponsor and name a Guide Dog! But we need your help and support.

WHY?

We believe that giving back to the community you live in and helping those less fortunate than you is the right thing to do. Not only that, but it feels really good to just do the right thing. We don't want to be artists, we're both studying business and want to eventually work full time when we leave school for Charlie's Causes, the Social Enterprise behind the "Charlie, The Migrating Snail" series of books. That's why we want to give kids that love art and want to become artists and illustrators a chance at fame and exposure by entering Charlie's GREAT Painting Competition.

HOW?

We want to create a website and run a worldwide painting competition for children sixteen and under to discover the next great, young illustrators for Book Three. We've found a brilliant web designer, but it's going to cost us  £6,000, because there's a lot of hi-tech stuff that needs to work behind the scenes! We have some of that raised already, but we'd rather that money go to charitable causes instead, so we're reaching out to you! We've set our initial target low (£500) as we'd like to at least get some money in, and we only get the money, if we reach our target.

WHAT?

Our web designer is great and has broken our project into two phases to help spread the cost, but we need to give them £1,500 in order to start work. The first phase will allow people to pre-register for the competition and allow us to generate some more income to pay the whole cost for phase one and hopefully fund phase two as well. It is our hope that this will not only generate a lot more revenue for us to donate to worthy causes, but also help spread the word about our book and our work. We're independently published, so we don't have a big publisher with deep pockets funding us, we have done all this ourselves (with the help of Aimee's Mum, Lisa, and Anthony!)

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

As if feeling great about helping our cause wasn't enough, we've got some amazing perks lined up for all those that do help support us. We have great little perks for those that can only afford to pledge a small amount, all the way up to corporate perks at the high end, where you'll get a year-long advertisement on our competition website! And even if you can't afford to pledge anything, if you just share our campaign on social media to help get the word out we'll send you an MP3 reading of Book One by the author, Anthony James Donnelly. So, come on, what are you waiting for... please help us hit our pledge target :)

CHARLIE, THE MIGRATING SNAIL

For those of you that want to know more about the book series, read a sample passage, hear part of the reading, or look at some of the great artwork already sent in by children, check out our blog: Charlie's Blog Page.

But don't take our word for it, have a listen to one of our youngest early adopters: Video Book Review.

story:
New cultural venue in Vienna’s 19th district


ART 9TEEN is a new concept that will delight many. Art gallery on the one hand, event space on the other, ART 9TEEN combines the best of both worlds. Be it a number of aspiring & established artists with international experience who are looking for an affordable setting in a dignified atmosphere, the company that wants to hold press conferences or training courses surrounded by art or small private companies that wish to enjoy their private dinees surrounded by masterpieces want to get to show just some of the possibilities of ART 9TEEN.

ART 9TEEN - Vienna’s Private Art Club & Events, located in the heart of Vienna’s 19th district, makes this possible for the first time.

 

Private Art Club

In addition to that we bring the concept of Private Art Club to Vienna.  The main idea of a Private Art Club is that people from the art-sector are coming together for networking, exchange of experience and to enforce the cultural activities of a region. Artists, gallerists, art-dealer, curators, journalists, collectors, promising new talents, international established VIP’s are gathering and celebrate art. More then this, art-lovers and connoisseurs from other sectors of the business environment and the society as administrations, politics, sciences and research, medicine and humanistic-professions are invited to join. The club is open for everyone, enjoying art.

Every first Tuesday of the month, the Art Club is meeting in it’s headquarter at ART 9TEEN, located in Billrothstrasse 29 in Vienna’s 19th district. Reservation is strongly recommended. At the beginning of every club-meeting an impulse speech is given by a curator, museum-director, art-historian or other significant people from the art sector. 
Further the club will organize visits of important art-fairs, studios, exhibitions and guided tours and organize invitations for its members to selected VIP-Tours and events.

 

What we do with your support

The best way to support us is by joining our Private Art Club. If you are not decided yet we invite you to become a Art Lover or Supporter and visit our events. If you join then we will deduct the paid amount from your membership fee for the first year.

The collected amounts will be used for marketing activities, necessary acquisitions of equipment and support our budget for rents and operation expenses to bring us through this hard time. Our gallery is closed due to the actual situation but bills keep coming.
