story:
Explorers Collectible No.1 : Gorden the Captain

See the Explorers series come to life as limited edition 3D-printed miniatures.



Story

Gorden is the leader and captain of the Explorers, four souls sent from the Apus system across the galaxy to discover new worlds. An accidental hero, Gorden leads his team into danger as they race against time to discover new star systems and planets worthy of calling home. Along their journey they discover several of the star systems they visit are closer to the brink of extinction than their own. While few star systems have been evacuated, others are nothing more than wastelands. Gorden bravely decides to change course to save those who need saving and return home in time to save their own.



Gorden Copernicus

Gorden Copernicus is the brave captain of the Explorers whos big heart gets the team into a lot of trouble. Though not initially pleased to be embarking on such a perilous adventure, Gorden`s true heroic colors come to the surface when his home world, team and the many beings encountered along the way are met with  unthinkable dangers.


Full Collection

Gorden is the first collectible figurine of the series. With the success of this campaign, our backers will get VIP ACCESS to get other characters to collect. Help us bring the whole team to life by backing this first campaign.  Each campaign will only be available for a LIMITED TIME and in LIMITED QUANTITIES.  Don't miss your opportunity to collect them all.


3D Printing Material 

These models are made from 3D printed sandstone. Sandstone is the only material capable of full-color 3D prints. Produced on Z-Corp printers, it is perfect for figurines, life-like models, avatars, and other products that lend themselves to colorful, high-quality printing. Models are created by printing binder material and colored ink layer-by-layer into a bed of gypsum-based powder. After printing, the models are finished with a cyanoacrylate (super glue) sealant to ensure durability and vivid colors. The final product is a hard, brittle material that works great for figurines and visual models. Models should be handled carefully, and not exposed to water as it will cause fading.

From the Artist

Hi there! My name is Cody Schroder. I am a professional 2D artist currently Art Directing in mobile games. I have worked professionally for many years on many different projects in all kinds of styles and platforms. I whole heartedly enjoy what I do, but I think every artist has a deep desire to freely express their creativity in their own form. With this Explorers project, I feel I have been able to do that.

I have been driven to continue expanding on the Explorers universe. It has really become something enjoyable and unique. With much positive feedback it seemed only natural to seek new avenues to apply these creations. And what better way to utilize Explorers than creating collectible figurines from the cast of characters that have been designed. With your help, we can make this possible. We can bring Explorers to life!

To do this we are asking for your help in raising the necessary funds to attain the goal of $5900. With the success of this campaign we will not only be able to create our first character but also be able to dive further into the cast. Can't contribute? No worries! There are other ways you can help out. Feel free to spread the word about this campaign to others with social media websites like Facebook and the Indiegogo share tools! Let's make this happen!


Risks & Challenges

Every project has risks. As with any I've ever worked on you can plan all you want, but always leave room for adjustments. Though we may not be able to immediately see any issues, you never know what may come. However, regardless of the obstacles I know that because we are a team and this project means so much to us that we will work through them to find the best solutions. 

What if the necessary funds are not met? That's okay because those who have pledged will receive their perks regardless.


Trusted Quality

This campaign is being brought to life with the help of the ConceptKicker team, the winners of the Global Start-Up Battle. 

 

ConceptKicker helps artists take their 2D designs and brings them to life through their 3D modeling and printing expertise. 




Get it now

This is a one-time opportunity to start collecting the Explorers Limited Edition Collection of miniatures. Their uniqueness and quality tell a story that you can't discover anywhere else. 

As the story unfolds about Gorden and his team, you'll be the first to hear about it and have an opportunity to discover the worlds he visits.


Shipping

For any questions or concerns with shipping there is a $15 fee for Canadian and US residents and $25 for International residents. This fee can be added once a Perk is selected. Under the Additional Gifts section simply hit the CUSTOM button and enter the appropriate amount. Unfortunately this function is not available on the mobile site. To complete a transaction that includes shipping fees please use a computer. And that is all! Thank you very much!

story:
I am Ann Marie Hoff, an artist, animal communicator & intuitive medium. I am the author of “Animal Lover: one woman’s fantastic journey to uncover the spiritual purpose of pets”. I have a MS in Animal Science Immunology, and double undergraduate degrees in Art and Animal Science. I was extremely successful in Pharmaceutical sales for 25 years. GotBalls4Pets? combines both of my degrees & my sales knowledge to create an educational fundraiser for the No-Kill community. I believe that all animals came here for a reason, that they have gifts to share with humans that are needed in the world. By creating a positive campaign to educate people that we need to stop the needless killing in shelters, those animals will be available to add to the love in the world.

After 25 years in sales, I know that it isn’t just what you say, it is how you say it. I am sure all of you know people turned off by the images of suffering animals, that don’t go into animal shelters because they don’t want to be reminded of the horrible situation we have with destroying healthy, loving, purposeful animals. That instead of being motivated to save animals, they shut down and don’t want to hear about it. Even I flinch when I see the “to be destroyed” photos of cats & dogs on Twitter & Facebook not knowing what I can do to save them

The reason for this campaign is to educate EVERYONE. That all lives are improved by animals being in their lives, and we need to create the environment where that is possible. Do you know that the majority of criminals on death row never had a pet as a child? They didn’t receive that unconditional love and responsibility created by owning a pet. Through my work as an animal communicator, I KNOW that animals do not come randomly into a person’s life. That they always have a reason to be with their human.

“Until one has loved an animal, a part of one's soul remains unawakened.”― Anatole France

The no-kill movement is about much more than the implementation of efficiencies in shelter operations to reduce killing. It is at once an affirmation of the unique and irreplaceable quality of the lives of every pet in a shelter, and a repudiation of the longstanding and mystifying idea that killing homeless animals is an acceptable solution- to whatever problem you care to name. The fact that our society has tolerated such institutionalized killing (yes, Killing) for more than a century suggests a much more fundamental problem that an excess of unwanted, stray and free-roaming animals. ~Francis Battista

How we are going to make a GIGANTIC difference:

We got the t-shirts!  Trust me, if you are wearing an attractive art quality t-shirt with “GotBalls?” on it, people ask you about it. That is YOUR opening to educate that person about the current pet overpopulation situation. How the implementation of no-kill needs to happen in every shelter.  That 70% of the cats killed in shelters are kittens who aren’t even given a chance at life! That a healthy dog is killed every 30 seconds in this country!

But If you are like me, you might not have the vocabulary to say this as eloquently as you want to. Then when you do get the words spit out, you get a response from them that you don’t know how to answer.  We have got you covered!

 This is where “GotBalls?” has your back! We are giving you a sales script, one that has different versions for the type of person you are talking to! Plus each t-shirt will come with the most current facts and figures on kill rates from shelters. You will have a visual showing how one unsprayed female cat will lead to 2,072,514 cats in only 8 years. Trust me, that has visual impact.

Another reason to wear a “GotBalls?” shirt; if someone hears something, and SEES it, the retention rate on the information sky rockets. That’s what we want people to remember: that there is a problem, but there is also a No-Kill solution.

You will also receive several objection flash cards. These cards will have a “Got Balls” painting on one side, then on the other side will be information on how to either contradict or minimize the objection you receive. From years in sales, I have learned that there are only so many objections to any situation. Being pre-armed with the Knowledge to handle these situations will make you an expert, someone who is a resource on this topic. You will be believed, and will change minds, while providing the passerby or friend with a good laugh. It has been proven that people learn better when they are in a higher vibrational space. It is a win-win. Seeing these animals in a positive light, as something that brings love and joy into a person’s life will

We shouldn’t sugar-coat the killing of more than 9000 pets in shelters every single day- Francis Battista

The reality of the situation in kill shelters is harsh. It can’t be sugar coated or glossed over. What the GotBalls? products create is an opening. The chance to HAVE a conversation instead of having an immediate NO. What we need to promote is the vision of a world where no animal dies unnecessarily. That they get to share their gifts they came to bring to the world. In this time of change and turmoil, animals bring a loving stable vibration to the planet. By choosing No-Kill, the choice is being made for love. That a cat will be able to console a teenager when she didn’t get a prom date, a dog will be able to help a disabled person make their way in the world easier. These gifts are simple, and yet utterly profound.

Why this is important to me

“The vital function that pets fulfill in this world hasn’t been fully recognized. They keep millions of people sane.” Eckart Tolle

I see the difference cats and dogs make in their owners lives every day. That these animals who can add so much to our world are being DESTROYED is a travesty. It speaks to a society who has their priorities out of balance. If we save pets, it is a step on the way to recognizing them sentient beings, of valuing them as they should be. When ALL animals are treasured and accepted as beings that improve the world on the whole, every person will be more valued also. Saving animals raises all boats. It makes us better humans.

The Outcome

This program is meant to change the world for both people and shelter animals. To concisely explain what is wrong about killing shelter animals and convince people of this is empowering. People will take action if they know they can affect real change. Everything will change with these steps.

I have excelled at every goal I have set my mind to, from 2 World Championships with my horses, my 4th degree black belt in TaeKwonDo, to consistently being in the top 10% in the sales force I was in, regardless of the product I sold or the market I was in. But that stuff wasn’t as important as saving animals LIVES! This is my life’s work!

I will also come and speak at any shelter or rescue that is within driving distance to discuss animal communication, how pets see humans, and the no-kill solution. ANYTHING to market the campaign.

The MONEY

I am raising money to get the business off the ground, and to support No-Kill Pima County. 50% of the profits raised will be used to create the company that keeps “GotBalls4Pets?”items available in the future. This includes promoting the GotBalls4Pets? National PR campaign.   The other 50% is going to No-Kill Pima County for them to use as they see fit.

I have a lot already invested in making the artwork, having it photographed, my current website, AnnHoff.com. I want to be able to keep this business separate from my own website, and always donating 50% of profits to the No-Kill movement.

Professional photos of Samson and artwork: $2000

Trademarking the GotBalls4Pets? Program and artwork $4000

Professional PR campaign for 4 months: $6000 ($1,500 per month).

Samson & I attending conferences (Global Pet, BlogPaws, Bark World, Super Zoo) to promote program: $3000- $5000.

New Website with Woo Commerce store: $1500.

This is a lifelong dream for me, that all animals are safe from being killed needlessly because of overpopulation. I have always wanted my artwork to be enjoyed by fellow pet lovers. This program creates a continuing revenue for no-kill and to grow the business. OF course, I will keep everyone up to date and also create more paintings & other items when I get input from donors.

Risks and Challenges:

I have a big vision for this program. I know I am asking for a lot of money, but it is the bare minimum I need to have this be successful. The program is meant to be nationwide if not world wide: the people in Boston should know about the GotBalls4Pets? Just as much as the people in Phoenix. I personally can’t do that without this campaign, because of the money it would take to have a national campaign.

 That is why I am doing IndieGoGo. It brings the campaign more exposure. I can get more Brand Awareness on social media. However, there is nothing that replaces meeting people, looking them in the eye and telling them how passionate you are about your program.  I am also an excellent blogger, and I will follow up this campaign with blog posts and articles. I will look at every avenue available to get GotBalls? into as many consciousness’s as possible. I am counting on the people I know and the people I have yet to meet to help me achieve this. When I have an unforeseen problem, I will discuss it with the investors, talk to business people I admire and brainstorm to find the exact unique solution. Thru the years in Pharmaceutical Sales I learned not to panic, stay grounded, and move forward, and continue with eyes on the goal.

Other ways you can help:

If you can’t donate, please post this campaign on your social media. Tell a friend or relative that you know would be excited about GotBalls4Pets? The Perks are going to be ready before Christmas, so they buy 1 for a pet loving friend!  Can you post a flyer on GotBallsForPets? At your business? A store you go to?  Any of this would be appreciated!

Remember you can also use the IndieGoGo share tools to promote this campaign too!

Thanks to everyone  who has loved & adopted a rescue pet! You are part of the solution!
story_txt: I am Ann Marie Hoff, an artist, animal communicator & intuitive medium. I am the author of “Animal Lover: one woman’s fantastic journey to uncover the spiritual purpose of pets”. I have a MS in Animal Science Immunology, and double undergraduate degrees in Art and Animal Science. I was extremely successful in Pharmaceutical sales for 25 years. GotBalls4Pets? combines both of my degrees & my sales knowledge to create an educational fundraiser for the No-Kill community. I believe that all animals came here for a reason, that they have gifts to share with humans that are needed in the world. By creating a positive campaign to educate people that we need to stop the needless killing in shelters, those animals will be available to add to the love in the world.After 25 years in sales, I know that it isn’t just what you say, it is how you say it. I am sure all of you know people turned off by the images of suffering animals, that don’t go into animal shelters because they don’t want to be reminded of the horrible situation we have with destroying healthy, loving, purposeful animals. That instead of being motivated to save animals, they shut down and don’t want to hear about it. Even I flinch when I see the “to be destroyed” photos of cats & dogs on Twitter & Facebook not knowing what I can do to save themThe reason for this campaign is to educate EVERYONE. That all lives are improved by animals being in their lives, and we need to create the environment where that is possible. Do you know that the majority of criminals on death row never had a pet as a child? They didn’t receive that unconditional love and responsibility created by owning a pet. Through my work as an animal communicator, I KNOW that animals do not come randomly into a person’s life. That they always have a reason to be with their human.“Until one has loved an animal, a part of one's soul remains unawakened.”― Anatole FranceThe no-kill movement is about much more than the implementation of efficiencies in shelter operations to reduce killing. It is at once an affirmation of the unique and irreplaceable quality of the lives of every pet in a shelter, and a repudiation of the longstanding and mystifying idea that killing homeless animals is an acceptable solution- to whatever problem you care to name. The fact that our society has tolerated such institutionalized killing (yes, Killing) for more than a century suggests a much more fundamental problem that an excess of unwanted, stray and free-roaming animals. ~Francis BattistaHow we are going to make a GIGANTIC difference:We got the t-shirts!  Trust me, if you are wearing an attractive art quality t-shirt with “GotBalls?” on it, people ask you about it. That is YOUR opening to educate that person about the current pet overpopulation situation. How the implementation of no-kill needs to happen in every shelter.  That 70% of the cats killed in shelters are kittens who aren’t even given a chance at life! That a healthy dog is killed every 30 seconds in this country!But If you are like me, you might not have the vocabulary to say this as eloquently as you want to. Then when you do get the words spit out, you get a response from them that you don’t know how to answer.  We have got you covered! This is where “GotBalls?” has your back! We are giving you a sales script, one that has different versions for the type of person you are talking to! Plus each t-shirt will come with the most current facts and figures on kill rates from shelters. You will have a visual showing how one unsprayed female cat will lead to 2,072,514 cats in only 8 years. Trust me, that has visual impact.Another reason to wear a “GotBalls?” shirt; if someone hears something, and SEES it, the retention rate on the information sky rockets. That’s what we want people to remember: that there is a problem, but there is also a No-Kill solution.You will also receive several objection flash cards. These cards will have a “Got Balls” painting on one side, then on the other side will be information on how to either contradict or minimize the objection you receive. From years in sales, I have learned that there are only so many objections to any situation. Being pre-armed with the Knowledge to handle these situations will make you an expert, someone who is a resource on this topic. You will be believed, and will change minds, while providing the passerby or friend with a good laugh. It has been proven that people learn better when they are in a higher vibrational space. It is a win-win. Seeing these animals in a positive light, as something that brings love and joy into a person’s life willWe shouldn’t sugar-coat the killing of more than 9000 pets in shelters every single day- Francis BattistaThe reality of the situation in kill shelters is harsh. It can’t be sugar coated or glossed over. What the GotBalls? products create is an opening. The chance to HAVE a conversation instead of having an immediate NO. What we need to promote is the vision of a world where no animal dies unnecessarily. That they get to share their gifts they came to bring to the world. In this time of change and turmoil, animals bring a loving stable vibration to the planet. By choosing No-Kill, the choice is being made for love. That a cat will be able to console a teenager when she didn’t get a prom date, a dog will be able to help a disabled person make their way in the world easier. These gifts are simple, and yet utterly profound.Why this is important to me“The vital function that pets fulfill in this world hasn’t been fully recognized. They keep millions of people sane.” Eckart TolleI see the difference cats and dogs make in their owners lives every day. That these animals who can add so much to our world are being DESTROYED is a travesty. It speaks to a society who has their priorities out of balance. If we save pets, it is a step on the way to recognizing them sentient beings, of valuing them as they should be. When ALL animals are treasured and accepted as beings that improve the world on the whole, every person will be more valued also. Saving animals raises all boats. It makes us better humans.The OutcomeThis program is meant to change the world for both people and shelter animals. To concisely explain what is wrong about killing shelter animals and convince people of this is empowering. People will take action if they know they can affect real change. Everything will change with these steps.I have excelled at every goal I have set my mind to, from 2 World Championships with my horses, my 4th degree black belt in TaeKwonDo, to consistently being in the top 10% in the sales force I was in, regardless of the product I sold or the market I was in. But that stuff wasn’t as important as saving animals LIVES! This is my life’s work!I will also come and speak at any shelter or rescue that is within driving distance to discuss animal communication, how pets see humans, and the no-kill solution. ANYTHING to market the campaign.The MONEYI am raising money to get the business off the ground, and to support No-Kill Pima County. 50% of the profits raised will be used to create the company that keeps “GotBalls4Pets?”items available in the future. This includes promoting the GotBalls4Pets? National PR campaign.   The other 50% is going to No-Kill Pima County for them to use as they see fit.I have a lot already invested in making the artwork, having it photographed, my current website, AnnHoff.com. I want to be able to keep this business separate from my own website, and always donating 50% of profits to the No-Kill movement.Professional photos of Samson and artwork: $2000Trademarking the GotBalls4Pets? Program and artwork $4000Professional PR campaign for 4 months: $6000 ($1,500 per month).Samson & I attending conferences (Global Pet, BlogPaws, Bark World, Super Zoo) to promote program: $3000- $5000.New Website with Woo Commerce store: $1500.This is a lifelong dream for me, that all animals are safe from being killed needlessly because of overpopulation. I have always wanted my artwork to be enjoyed by fellow pet lovers. This program creates a continuing revenue for no-kill and to grow the business. OF course, I will keep everyone up to date and also create more paintings & other items when I get input from donors.Risks and Challenges:I have a big vision for this program. I know I am asking for a lot of money, but it is the bare minimum I need to have this be successful. The program is meant to be nationwide if not world wide: the people in Boston should know about the GotBalls4Pets? Just as much as the people in Phoenix. I personally can’t do that without this campaign, because of the money it would take to have a national campaign. That is why I am doing IndieGoGo. It brings the campaign more exposure. I can get more Brand Awareness on social media. However, there is nothing that replaces meeting people, looking them in the eye and telling them how passionate you are about your program.  I am also an excellent blogger, and I will follow up this campaign with blog posts and articles. I will look at every avenue available to get GotBalls? into as many consciousness’s as possible. I am counting on the people I know and the people I have yet to meet to help me achieve this. When I have an unforeseen problem, I will discuss it with the investors, talk to business people I admire and brainstorm to find the exact unique solution. Thru the years in Pharmaceutical Sales I learned not to panic, stay grounded, and move forward, and continue with eyes on the goal.Other ways you can help:If you can’t donate, please post this campaign on your social media. Tell a friend or relative that you know would be excited about GotBalls4Pets? The Perks are going to be ready before Christmas, so they buy 1 for a pet loving friend!  Can you post a flyer on GotBallsForPets? At your business? A store you go to?  Any of this would be appreciated!Remember you can also use the IndieGoGo share tools to promote this campaign too!Thanks to everyone  who has loved & adopted a rescue pet! You are part of the solution!

story:
We are group of working class creatives; An artist/animator, an art director and a film maker. We have come together to create a new exhibition. 

We are very passionate and believe that creating a social housing gallery and bypassing industry gatekeepers is an important step towards inclusivity. 

To help with costs we have set up Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign. We have lots of perks and hope that you can visit once we open! 
If you aren’t local and you just want to support you can receive a limited piece of artwork created by Patricia Shrigley. Anyone who donates can choose a  special edition hand made mono print.

The exhibition is called Breeding Ground; A collection of paintings, drawings, sculpture and animation.


Breeding Ground looks at stereotypical ideas towards the
so-called underclass; as feral, animals living in social housing and breeding for benefits.

The Social Housing Gallery will be located in the artists studio in Hackney where she has lived for over 30 years. The effect of gentrification is most prevalent in this area of London and local working class artists are often overlooked by preexisting galleries. 

 

https://linktr.ee/Patriciashrigley

story:
The Story

When you walk into a home, you don't comment on the IKEA couch (no offense, IKEA).  Your eye is instantly drawn to the different.  To the piece that has quirks: a pop of color, a texture that emerges from the background, style that has character.  In essence, I want to give you a story to tell your friends and family.  It is a passion of mine to find the forgotten and left behind pieces and breathe new life into them.  I take what someone else wouldn't give a second look and make it a part of your home that you'll love and pass on. 

 

A Need for Healthy (and Affordable) Nostalgia

It's not easy for the average person to be able to acquire antiques or quality home decor pieces.  "Found" pieces and specialty items are sold at huge markups in retailers and few people can make the time to not only seek out these items, but also refurbish and re-purpose them for personal use.  We all deserve beauty in our homes; this is where we go to recharge, to engage with loved ones, and to express our honest selves.  I want to share my eye for character and charm with those who simply don't have the luxury of time to do it themselves.  And I want to do this at an affordable price.

 

What Your Funding Will Do

  • Provide the startup costs of building a proper website to showcase and bring my business to a wide market
  • Enable me to buy the best materials and tools for refurbishing 
  • Give me the opportunity to buy the finds as I find them vs. when I can afford them, thus allowing me to grow my original inventory
  • Fund marketing through social media and various platforms to get my message to a wider audience
  • Cover some upfront shipping supply costs
  • Allow me to pay for further technical training in my field (refurbishing, upholstering, woodworking, etc.)
  • Solidify my confidence that I can make my passion a career (something I didn't let myself consider for most of my life)

A Risk and a Reward

I'm very aware that all small businesses are a risk.  But coming from the cynic who always said she just wanted a job that she at least didn't hate, I can assure you that this has 100% of my passion and energy.  It has taken me years of searching to find something that would motivate me to work endless hours, skip a meal (I didn't think people actually did this voluntarily), and take a risk on.  But I know this: I have a Masters in Art History, five years of experience in merchandising and visual display, and a lifetime love of all things creative behind me.  I want to make people happy with what makes me happy; that's the dream.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the ability to help financially, lend a hand by spreading the word about my mission.  Tell that friend who still has his college dorm room posters thumbtacked to the wall.  Tell your uber busy professional friend who knows her aesthetic but simply can't take a lunch break to go thrifting.  Tell your mom. 

 

Share this page, my now live Etsy shop (www.etsy.com/shop/storyeyeddecor), my Facebook page, and Instagram account @storyeyeddecor.  Many thanks.

story:
PLAN: I started treatment and lightened my workload, but even my limited tattooing has proven to be too damaging.  The things I fill my days with, tattooing, muay thai, building / riding motorcycles, all of them are not possible until my hands recover. It's left me in a depression that I've hid until now.
There's a silver lining though! I can still paint and draw. for a few hours. I want to take this "opportunity" to really develop my skill and create things to inspire anyone I can to keep pushing for what they love.


TREATMENT:  My recovery is expected to take 5-8 months, and includes two weekly treatments with the AMAZING Zoe Benjamin Bodyworks, including scar tissue breakup, massage, and physical therapy.  I'm going to be adding steroid injections in the next couple weeks.  Additionally, I've been wearing braces, icing regularly, taking supplements, and being more aware of my diet. 

WHY $5K?:  I can't be sure how long it will be before my wrists are capable of my normal work.  Anything from opening my fridge to putting on shoes is pretty rough right now. While I do have insurance, the treatments required are not covered.  With 2-3 weekly treatments, I have no way to sustain payment for my recovery. I'm going to do my very best to earn money with the paintings and drawings I can do, but can't rely on that alone.

HOW'D IT HAPPEN?:  Hilariously, the answer is seriously, my hands are too little to be doing the amount of work I was doing. Tattooing alone is pretty rough on hands and wrists, turns out punching people and building motorcycles didn't help.  Once my tendons and ligaments heal, the goal is to build up muscle in my hands and wrists, and be smarter about the tools and methods I use in my work. 

HOW ARE YOU DOING?: Honestly this scares the living shit out of me and I'm trying to keep cool about it all.

story:
Emergence of the Feminine

Crystalis will be a featured exhibit at the Portland Winter Light Festival in Portland, Oregon. Now in its 5th year, the Festival draws over 150,000 visitors. One hundred exhibits will display cutting-edge art and technology throughout the city, brightening Portland’s winter nights.

Crystalis, developed by Eichinger Sculpture Studio and Koble Creative, creates a magical illusion through multiple projectors focused on a central pod. Synchronized images projected onto and through the pod’s translucent panels produce a mesmerizing effect visible from 360 degrees. Viewers walk around the display as the images dance and tumble within the projection chamber.

What We Need & What You Get

Last year’s introduction of Crystalis at the Festival was self-funded through contributions of the partners, vendors, borrowed equipment and hundreds of volunteer hours. Our goal this year is to purchase the processor, projectors, speakers, animation, programming, video editing and production services. Funds will allow us to upgrade our light sculpture and also take it to other festivals. Making our creative production available to wider audiences depends on financial support from people like you.

Our funding goal is $7,500 to purchase a processor, 3 projectors, 2 speakers, expanded animation and video production services. This will be more than matched by volunteer hours of our combined staffs.

$25 - Set of coasters and  weekly progress report (via email)

$50 - Attend our Wrap Party plus items above

$100 - Visit studio while work is in progress plus items above

$500 - Pair of etched "Crystalis" wine glasses plus items above

What motivates us

For over 40 years, Eichinger Sculpture Studio has created sculptural experiences, whether in traditional, figurative bronzes, science-based projects, and now electronic installations. Martin Eichinger’s philosophy is that sculpture should be a dialogue that captures the viewer’s curiosity. Koble Creative, emphasize an integrated team-oriented approach within their architectural practice. Through imaginative use of space and materials, they create structures that enable creative people to function more effectively and comfortably. Collectively, Koble Creative and  Eichinger Sculpture Studio engage festival participants  in the power of collaboration.

The 5th annual Portland Winter Light Festival is a city-wide event on February 6-8, 2020. It showcases illuminated art installations, vibrant performances, and kinetic fire sculptures. The festival will be held in several locations at the eastern foot of the Tilikum Crossing Bridge, the west side waterfront, and other locations throughout the city.  

Risks & Challenges

We are committed to participate in this event. With funds, we can make it better. Without funding, we'll just have to work harder, borrow equipment, use more duct tape.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you think this is a cool idea, share it! Getting in front of the right people helps. Thanks

story:
Notre projet en quelques mots: 

ENSEMBLE: C'est un projet, un rêve que nous avons avons en commun et que nous réaliserons ensemble, étape par étape.

STAGE: Ce projet est tout d'abord notre stage pré-professionnel, c'est à dire notre dernier stage de dernière année en tant qu'étudiants infirmiers. Il a donc pour but de nous responsabiliser et de prouver nos capacités à nous même mais également aux professionnels et aux patients qui nous entourent.

VIETNAM: Ce magnifique pays que nous avons choisit pour effectuer ce stage. Son mode de vie, sa culture, ses traditions mais également son système de santé qui diffère tellement du notre. 

EXPERIENCE: Ce stage nous fera grandir en tant que personnes mais également en tant que professionnels de santé. Cette expérience restera à jamais un moment clé de notre parcours professionnel.

Et enfin...

PASSION: Parceque nous aimons notre métier et que ce projet sera pour nous le passage du monde des études au monde professionnel. Nous pourrons enfin vivre de notre passion: prendre soins d'autrui.

NOTRE STAGE:


Nous partons grâce à l'association Missions Stages. Nous serons hébergés à l'orphelinat de Hoa Mai et nous effectuerons notre stage à l'hôtipal de Long Thanh (à mi-chemin entre la mer de Chine et la ville d'Hochiminh). Grâce à vous nous partirons du 18 avril au 27 mai 2016.
                                                         


Mais tout cela a un coût et c'est pour cela que nous avons besoin de votre générosité..


                     [img src="https://drfhlmcehrc34.cloudfront.net/cache/c/4/...">

Merci à vous de nous soutenir !

A quoi va servir le financement ?

Ce financement a pour but de nous aider à financer notre stage.

Détail par personne: 
- 1060€ pour l'association (prise en charge sur le lieu de stage, l'hébergement, la nourriture, les transports et l' interprète francophone) 
- Billets d'avions : environ 500€
- Frais divers : passeport, Visa, vaccins... : environ 150€

Mais vos dons servirons également à financer du matériel médical (gants à usage unique, charlottes, surblouses,...), du matériel pour les actions de préventions que nous comptons mettre en place au sein de l'orphelinat (hygiène bucco-dentaire, hygiène des mains,...). 

Si nous arrivons à récolter plus que ce que nous espérons, les fonds restants seront reversés à l'orphelinat Hoa Mai. 

C'est pour cela que même si notre objectif est atteint, continuez de partager et de parler de notre projet ! 

                                     

A propos du porteur de projet

QUI SOMMES NOUS ?

Nous sommes Alexis, Melissa, Grégoire, Chloé, Florent et Emeline, 6 étudiants infirmiers à l'IFSI (Institut en soins infirmiers) de Montereau (77).

Et dans 1 an nous partons pour le Vietnam pour réaliser un de nos rêve: effectuer un stage humanitaire ! 

                                   

NOS MOTIVATIONS:

Ce projet serait pour nous l'accomplissement de nos 3 années d'études. Nous partageons un rêve commun et celui-ci peut devenir réalité grâce à vous, vos dons, votre générosité.

Ce stage serait pour nous un moyen d'accroître nos connaissances et de découvrir le Vietnam sous nos yeux de soignants. En effet, le système de santé vietnamien diffère totalement du système de santé français. Les professionnels fonctionnent différemment et travaillent avec les seuls moyens dont ils disposent. Nous découvrirons la prise en charge de patients ayant un mode de vie, des coutumes et des traditions que nous n'avons jamais pu rencontrer dans le cadre de notre formation.

Cette aventure nous sera bénéfique, car la barrière de la langue nous amènera à accentuer nos efforts sur la construction d'une relation de confiance due à chaque patient. Il faudra pour cela faire favoriser la communication non verbale et adapter notre attitude afin que le patient soit rassuré quant à sa prise en charge.

Nous avons également comme objectif de sensibiliser les enfants de l'orphelinat de Hoa Mai à l'hygiène bucco-dentaire ainsi qu'à l'hygiène des mains afin qu'ils acquièrent une meilleure hygiène de vie.

Grâce à vous nous pourrions atteindre nos objectifs. Nous sortirons enrichit de cette expérience hors du commun !
story_txt:
Notre projet en quelques mots: 
ENSEMBLE: C'est un projet, un rêve que nous avons avons en commun et que nous réaliserons ensemble, étape par étape.
STAGE:
 Ce projet est tout d'abord notre stage pré-professionnel, c'est à dire 
notre dernier stage de dernière année en tant qu'étudiants infirmiers. 
Il a donc pour but de nous responsabiliser et de prouver nos capacités à
 nous même mais également aux professionnels et aux patients qui nous 
entourent.
VIETNAM: Ce magnifique pays que nous 
avons choisit pour effectuer ce stage. Son mode de vie, sa culture, ses 
traditions mais également son système de santé qui diffère tellement du 
notre. 
EXPERIENCE: Ce stage nous fera grandir en
 tant que personnes mais également en tant que professionnels de santé. 
Cette expérience restera à jamais un moment clé de notre parcours 
professionnel.
Et enfin...
PASSION: 
Parceque nous aimons notre métier et que ce projet sera pour nous le 
passage du monde des études au monde professionnel. Nous pourrons enfin 
vivre de notre passion: prendre soins d'autrui.
NOTRE STAGE:

Nous partons grâce à l'association Missions Stages. Nous serons hébergés
 à l'orphelinat de Hoa Mai et nous effectuerons notre stage à l'hôtipal 
de Long Thanh (à mi-chemin entre la mer de Chine et la ville 
d'Hochiminh). Grâce à vous nous partirons du 18 avril au 27 mai 2016.
                                                         

Mais tout cela a un coût et c'est pour cela que nous avons besoin de votre générosité..

                     [img src="https://drfhlmcehrc34.cloudfront.net/cache/c/4/...">
Merci à vous de nous soutenir !
                    

                    A quoi va servir le financement ?
                Ce financement a pour but de nous aider à financer notre stage.
Détail par personne: 
- 1060€ pour l'association (prise en charge sur le lieu de stage, 
l'hébergement, la nourriture, les transports et l' interprète 
francophone) 
- Billets d'avions : environ 500€
- Frais divers : passeport, Visa, vaccins... : environ 150€
Mais 
vos dons servirons également à financer du matériel médical (gants à 
usage unique, charlottes, surblouses,...), du matériel pour les actions 
de préventions que nous comptons mettre en place au sein de l'orphelinat
 (hygiène bucco-dentaire, hygiène des mains,...). 
Si nous arrivons à récolter plus que ce que nous espérons, les fonds restants seront reversés à l'orphelinat Hoa Mai. 
C'est pour cela que même si notre objectif est atteint, continuez de partager et de parler de notre projet ! 
                                     
                    
                    A propos du porteur de projet
                QUI SOMMES NOUS ?
Nous
 sommes Alexis, Melissa, Grégoire, Chloé, Florent et Emeline, 6 
étudiants infirmiers à l'IFSI (Institut en soins infirmiers) de 
Montereau (77).
Et dans 1 an nous partons pour le Vietnam pour réaliser un de nos rêve: effectuer un stage humanitaire ! 
                                   
NOS MOTIVATIONS:
Ce
 projet serait pour nous l'accomplissement de nos 3 années d'études. 
Nous partageons un rêve commun et celui-ci peut devenir réalité grâce à 
vous, vos dons, votre générosité.
Ce stage serait pour nous un 
moyen d'accroître nos connaissances et de découvrir le Vietnam sous nos 
yeux de soignants. En effet, le système de santé vietnamien diffère 
totalement du système de santé français. Les professionnels fonctionnent
 différemment et travaillent avec les seuls moyens dont ils disposent. 
Nous découvrirons la prise en charge de patients ayant un mode de vie, 
des coutumes et des traditions que nous n'avons jamais pu rencontrer 
dans le cadre de notre formation.
Cette aventure nous sera 
bénéfique, car la barrière de la langue nous amènera à accentuer nos 
efforts sur la construction d'une relation de confiance due à chaque 
patient. Il faudra pour cela faire favoriser la communication non 
verbale et adapter notre attitude afin que le patient soit rassuré quant
 à sa prise en charge.
Nous avons également comme objectif de 
sensibiliser les enfants de l'orphelinat de Hoa Mai à l'hygiène 
bucco-dentaire ainsi qu'à l'hygiène des mains afin qu'ils acquièrent une
 meilleure hygiène de vie.
Grâce à vous nous pourrions atteindre nos objectifs. Nous sortirons enrichit de cette expérience hors du commun !

experience and history will reduce the risks to zero. email to " Javaddarabi@pardisinc.com " with subject of your perks purchased.

 

On line support

Do not hesitate to contact us for any question 24/7 on skype ID of  "Javad.Darabi2"

story:
My story 

Hello, my name is Nastya Parfilo.

 I am 22 and I am an artist.

I don’t have higher education but it hasn’t put me off from what I am. You can check

all my works on the website.
http://www.parfilonastya.com

instagram - https://www.instagram.com/nastya_parfilo/

On 1 May 2017 I started a new project called 365 Horse Portraits in 365 Days. This

is a challenge to myself.

I’ve needed to draw a painting every day.

I use canvases (15 x 15 cm) and oil paints.

Horses...

 Why horses?

Because I care for these animals.

They are beautiful, graceful, intelligent and incredible.

But they are not always treated well. Some owners are cruel; they exhaust them, beat or train them out of their age group.

 I want this to stop.

This project is an attempt to draw people’s attention and teach love to these animals.

I have been drawing horses of real people, bloggers, trainers who take care of them,

love and cherish. Such people sparked this idea in me.

After the project end, 1 May this year, all the small paintings will combine into a large

painting – a mosaic, a horse portrait. And now I need your help to make my

dream come true.

I would like to publish an illustrated book about this project with the pictures of all

365 paintings.

This will be an amazing hardcover book with bright and colourful pictures.

We have been taking photos of the pictures day by day and developing a draft design.

We need your help and support to collect money for further promotion.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to collect 15 000 $ for the book making up and publishing, prints of the

paintings and notebooks.
This includes : 

  • Design of the book
  • Photographer services (We need to photograph 365 paintings)
  • Printing books
  • Printing notebooks
  • Printing prints
  • taxes
  • 5% for Indiegogo
  • Stripe (credit card processor) charges a processing fee of 3% 

You can purchase the book in hardcover.

Design aspects

Book 

  • more than 190 pages
  • books size 11.8 in x 11.8 in
  • 365 illustrations 
  • Thick, glossy paper

Notebook

  • size 5.9in x 5.9in
  • 96 pages

Prints

  • size 5.9in x 5.9in



 



Timeline

  • July: Full Production 
  • August: Printing
  • September: Start Shipping

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, you can help spread the word ! 
Please share this campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Youtube or send your email contacts who you thing might be interested in horses , books or paintings.

Thank you so much for your support !!!

story:
Welcome to AniDoodles Indiegogo

This year AniDoodles will be participating in Christmas at the Forum!  Christmas at the Forum is a yearly tradition for many Haligonians and brings Christmas spirit with presents, art, decorations, food to thousands of visitors each year. Eek! It's a very exciting and daunting opportunity, especially for a one-woman-show, small business artist...

 

There are a lot of up front costs to consider to be prepared for this craft fair - so why not start selling early? In an effort to fund stocking of my Forum shelves, I thought I'd host a pre-sale, especially for people who won't make it to the Forum! Please take a peek at the options you can purchase. All money raised here will go back into preparation for Christmas at the Forum to make the opportunity successful!

 

Thanks for taking a look,


Natalie

story:
This campaign is set up to be able to produce a documentary about my father as an artist and to bundle his life's work into a book. 

My whole life i have only known my father with a beard and the fact that he is an artist, primarily a sculptor. With my father already being in his seventies i wanted to start this campaign to honor his oeuvre. Once and for all a spotlight for him and his art. 

About a year ago my uncle came up with the idea to have a great exhibition on my father's work here in the Netherlands. A lot of things came to mind like transport costs, promotion costs and if the whole idea would be worth it even if only a handful of people eventually showed up...

I started thinking and instead of focussing all my time and energy into a one-time event i'd make something more durable and a way to give a more in-depth look into the kind of artist my father is. 

At first my focus was on the book so i started scanning and editting all the pictures i had of his art. Ranging from the 60's till present day it took me a few weeks to get everything digital. This summer i visited my father in Serbia, where he's currently living again, and found out i still had a long way to go! In his studio i found a lot of paintings and sculptures that i didn't have any pictures of!

So there's a lot of work to be done and it will be only possible with the right fundings. Once i have enough money i can attract a director and a graphic designer, just to name a few. The director will have to give shape how the story about my father is going to be told in a documentary. The graphic designer will tell the story of his oeuvre in pictures. I might even build a website if there are enough resources. 

I really hope i can turn this project into a reality!

story:
Vicino.co

Vicino is the first community of the craftsmen, designers and the people in Italy. On Vicino,  you can buy unique and handmade items directly from them.

You can now communicate with passionate craftsmen or people in Italy, send them messages and comments, customize your products with them, rate and check their reputations. 
Shopping on Vicino is a personalized experience for both buyer and seller. Buyers can even access unique and affordable crafted products and services directly from the Italian through Vicino.co on the internet.


Vicino Story 

Vicino is a group of aficionados of fashion, design and artistry who are passionate about Italy and everything Italian, most importantly, the leather goods for which the country is world famous. 

Excellent Craftsmanship, Story of passion and persistence, unique products and customer service are the spirit of Vicino.

"Before year 2012, I was looking for a pair of unique and crafted shoes that I would like to own in my life, that I can use and love. However, not being able to find anything suitable online, I came to Italy to find excellent shoes makers and created Vicino for some of my friends. 
Now, I'm now making Vicino a better marketplace for the people who live outside Italy. "   
- Vicino.co, Founder

What We Need & What You Get

We need USD 500 budget to start the marketing expenses and build the relationship with suppliers. We are now focusing on leather goods first. Your supports on social media or the contributions on Indiegogo can help a lot. 

In return for the contributions, we can now mention your name on one of our social media pages, send the testimonials to you from Italy. 

If this campaign is successfully funded, the amount of your contribution will become your credit on Vicino that you can spend. 

How it Works

THE BUYER

1. Sign up  

2. Find the product - It is OK to contact the craftsmen to know more.

3. Purchase and Review

THE SELLER

1. Create profile -  verification needed

2. Post a new listing  - No charge to list an item

3. Get Paid and Fulfill the order

VICINO MARKETPLACE

Listing a post on Vicino is free, we will only charge the seller 3% fee after the sale is made.

We help craftsmen to do Direct Email, SEO, Social Media marketing and provide Photography and Shipping guide, meanwhile the platform comes with English, Italian and support multi-languages. 

Vicino allows people to contact craftsmen freely. Vicino platform is equipped with reputation and review system, secure payment with Paypal. It is an open community built on trust and offering Italian life-style experience.


The Impact

  • Due to the economies crisis, some year-proved craftsmen also have to close their stores, and their offspring are not interested in their family business due to the financial reasons, the hand-made craftsmanship will be soon disappeared if there is no a marketplace helping the traditional craftsmen.
  • Fashion means personality. It means you. But more than just being a supplier of Made-in-Italy products, we want to help people to discover their true personalities, their inner selves, and to appreciate the world of beauty surrounding them. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We are only asking for a $1-5 contribution! There is strength in numbers and we are a growing community.  If you can't contribute financially, please spread the word about Vicino.co   


In Italian, Vicino is an adjective or a noun, meaning ‘near, nearby’ or ‘neighbour’. That’s the relationship we want with you – to be your Italian neighbours and close friends. 

Thank you for taking the time to check out our project. We truly appreciate it!

Share our site:

http://vicino.co

Join our Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/Vicino.co

Share our campaign:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/vicino-1st-marketplace-for-craftsmen-in-italy/

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Support SIRIUS and contribute to the production of art and the creation of community!

We are continuing our digital fundraising campaign to generate resources for commissioning new work and organising learning and outreach activities. This initiative will help sustain our commitment to providing meaningful professional development opportunities for artists and experiences for audiences.

Two artists with whom we have a special relationship, Marie Brett and Fiona Kelly, have created powerful, poetic and timely works in special limited editions as gifts for donors in primary categories.

In 2020, we have remained active while our doors were shut due to restrictions relating to the COVID-19 pandemic, setting up online programmes and preparing and/or delivering exhibitions and events both on site and offsite. We have also used this unusual operating context to reinvent ourselves: we are in the process of recalibrating our vision around civic practice and engagement to make us a more accessible, equal, diverse and inclusive institution.

We want to continue on this course in 2021, as we believe that the work that we want to do – topical and experimental, political and local, and with beneficial outcomes for society – is more urgent than ever. For this, we need your support!
story_txt:
Support SIRIUS and contribute to the production of art and the creation of community!
We are continuing our digital fundraising campaign to generate resources for commissioning new work and organising learning and outreach activities. This initiative will help sustain our commitment to providing meaningful professional development opportunities for artists and experiences for audiences.
Two artists with whom we have a special relationship, Marie Brett and Fiona Kelly, have created powerful, poetic and timely works in special limited editions as gifts for donors in primary categories.
In 2020, we have remained active while our doors were shut due to restrictions relating to the COVID-19 pandemic, setting up online programmes and preparing and/or delivering exhibitions and events both on site and offsite. We have also used this unusual operating context to reinvent ourselves: we are in the process of recalibrating our vision around civic practice and engagement to make us a more accessible, equal, diverse and inclusive institution.
We want to continue on this course in 2021, as we believe that the work that we want to do – topical and experimental, political and local, and with beneficial outcomes for society – is more urgent than ever. For this, we need your support!

story:
GARBAGE

My grandma used to say that history keeps going in circles. She survived the Holocaust. Now I notice the same mechanisms still being used to discriminate minorities. Are we unable to learn from ou mistakes? Is egoism the driving force of human nature? Should we be reminded every day of what has happened?

The city squares are full of statues of people who served the society well. Most of those people are dead, though. What about heroes that live today? There are fighters who battle with racism, homophobia, xenophobia, poverty. They spend their time making the world more inclusive. 

It's XXI century, yet we still segregate people and perceive lots of them as "trash"

This "trash" is the subject of my installation. It's a monument we would like to erect to appreciate the ones pushed to the margins of society. 

 

 

ABOUT INSTALLATION

We want to create the first monument that puts the focus on the people discriminated right now.

It will celebrate the life of those who are fighting for their dignity. Of those, who spend their life pursuing idea of freedom and equality. 

This is a monument that unites us and reminds of how we are forced to feel. Focused on the present time and present actions. 

 

 

I'M NOT A GARBAGE

In front of the monument, we want to install six plaques that honor our heroes. 

Every plaque will contain its own QR code. It opens a dedicated web page with short films and stories concerning the subject.  

People with disabilities are too often excluded from full participation in many fields of everyday life. They suffer economically, being unable to find any job despite their qualifications. They ae rarely invited into governing bodies and the society also keeps them at distance. Let's change it!

 

Though few countries have found a way to acknowledge the rights of LGBT+Q community, most of the world's governments and societies perceive non-heterosexual love as a form of crime. The expressions of love, individuality and queer sexuality can lead to persecution, harrassment, death. Things will get better, if we support freedom all the time. 

The last few months have shown that racism is rooted very deeply in our civilisation. All eyes were focused on the USA, but let's be honest - race-based reservations and prejudices run wild all over the world. We need to make a stand, as Martin Luther King once said: “He who passively accepts evil is as much involved in it as he who helps to perpetrate it. He who accepts evil without protesting against it is really cooperating with it.”

Sex discrimination is still a major issue around the world. Even in the western countries, 60 years after the sexual revolution, the women still fight for the right to own their body, still have to break through the glass ceiling, keep on struggling with sexual assaults. 

 

Many people are still persecuted because of their religion. Christians and Muslim, Buddhists and Jews, minor churches and religions are the subject of violent attacks or continuous repression. The victim often becomes a villain. Kindness and understanding are the keys to live together. 

One can be abused for being fat, the other - for having red hair. Whether you are skinny, super tall, smaller than average, when you have skin imprefections and body disabilities - you know that someone will harrass you. Unreal beauty standards made it tough even for those with regular bodies. We all should stop looking so hard at each other. 

 
 

 

Questions & Answers

 

WHY DOES THE MONUMENT REMINDS OF THE RANBOW?

All over the world, the rainbow have become a symbol of LGBT+Q rights. It symbolised harmony of values within a person. Not many know that in the Bible, the rainbow is a symbol of divine connection and understanding between people and God. 

For us, the rainbow is a phenomen of the nature. It's a beautiful fleeting moment of awe that belongs to everyone - kids, adults, majorities, minorities. A symbol of future, where the whole span of people will be able to look at each other with love. 

WHY IS THIS MONUMENT RELEVANT TO EVERY PLACE IN THE WORLD?

We see the world as a living organism. Every country is like a single organ. Sometimes it takes one failing organ to disrupt health of the whole body. It's enough to see how the anti-minority populism spreads in Europe, how leaders of the big countries learn the worst totalitarian methods from the tyrans. 

From our Polish perspective, we see the Russia's autocratic system infecting Hungary, Poland. We see right-wing populists in Netherland, France, Germany, Austria, Italy influencing each other.  We see how leaders of so called free world watch closely how China and social media are building the system of effective invigilation.

The countries and societies are one connected vessel. When the storm hits, the ripples are felt everywhere.

DO YOU THINK THAT THE ART CAN CHANGE THE WORLD?

Yes, of course! 

ANY PROOF?
Well, no one has ever proved something like that, but just see how American pop cultures influence Asia nations. That is also an art, an art of communicating emotions and cultural messages through pictures and dialogues. 
Look how religious art have influenced people through the centuries. 
Notice how the deconstruction in art foreshadowed deconstruction of the family model. 

The artist sees the world through a very sensitive lens. We need that magnification to see things that need to be changed. 

 

HOW DO WE WANT TO SPLIT THE BUDGET?

The amount of money we want to collect will be enough to create two installations. The first one we would like to install in Warsaw, as Poland is now struggling to keep the remaining forms of social equality.

We also consider Hong Kong as the place where the monument could become a very important symbol of freedom and equal chances for the brave independent society. 

The second monumet we want to install in New York. USA is still a country were freedom and discrimination are two side of the same coin.

If we succeed, we want to reach further. Africa needs a unifying symbol, as a continent that is exploited the most. Berlin, Moscow, Tokyo, San Francisco... the list goes on and on. 

We need your help to reach our goal!

 

10%  will allow us to finance small installation within a city landscape. (as pictured below)

20%  will be enough to bring small scale installations to number of cities in the world. (Warsaw, Hong Kong, New York, Lagos, Berlin, Tokyo, Moscow, Johannesburg)

 

 

30%  will allow to finance a limited version of the monument - without the postument, rainbow trait and six different plates.  

50% is enough to build one fully realised, full scale installation.  

150% from now on, every 50% more is another installtion - now we can install three monuments, in Warsaw, Hong Kong (if possible), New York. 

 

WHAT DO I GET IN RETURN

 

 

The installation will be painted with Vantablack paint - the blackest paint available, that reflects only 1% of light. The donator's name will be etched with and painted with glossy black paint. This wil create a "deep black hole" illusion that is very spectacular and instagrammable.

POSTCARDS

A number of postcards, one of them will contain our "thank you" note

 

 

ECO TOTE WITH SLOGANS

 

 

T-SHIRT DESIGNS 

 

 

FOR MORE DESIGNS, VISIT OUR INSTAGRAM

 

ART BOOK

The artist works are influenced by one of six topics of the monument. 

Every chapter is a selection of the best works. Printed on the top quality paper, ready to adorn a coffee table or to be cut into seperate wall prints. 

 

 

SCREENPRINTS 

Justice is blind, which means that if you do not change anything and remain passive, you may be the next target of discrimination.

 

 

TOGETHER WE CREATE ART, NOT DIVISION.

STOP LOOK THINK

SOCIAL MEDIA
