story:
INTRODUCCIÓN

Centro Arte Alameda necesita de tu apoyo para la continuidad con su labor de difusión y promoción para las diversas expresiones artísticas.

Somos un espacio cultural único, histórico, independiente y creativo en el corazón de Santiago de Chile. Un lugar que ha marcado hitos por más de 23 años.

Te pedimos que nos ayudes para continuar este sueño de muchos: el desarrollo de la cultura y las artes en nuestro país.

Nuestra meta es la tuya, vamos juntos en esta apuesta por la cultura independiente, creativa, de calidad y al acceso de todos.

#UnidosSomosVanguardia

  APOYA °°° APORTA °°° PARTICIPA.

www.centroartealameda.cl

  • El Centro Arte Alameda (CAA) es un centro cultural multipropósito, vanguardista y con diversos espacios para la realización de actividades culturales de todo tipo.

    A pesar de las fuertes limitaciones presupuestarias (el CAA no recibe subvención constante ni estatal ni privada), el CAA ha jugado un rol fundamental en el apoyo, fomento y desarrollo de nuevos proyectos culturales de calidad, sin censura, con un espíritu abierto a la diversidad y pluralidad cultural, étnica, política, social y espiritual.

    El Cine Arte Alameda es la columna vertebral del CAA. Su cartelera cuenta con un 70% de realizaciones nacionales, expresada en nano, corto, medio y largometrajes de diversos géneros de ficción y no ficción. Al mismo tiempo, ha fomentado la creación de audiencias con la proyección de estrenos y clásicos del mejor cine arte internacional. Una tónica similar se da en materia musical, fotográfica, gastronómica, literaria, de artes visuales, circenses, teatrales, performáticas, entre otras actividades sociales que se dan en los espacios generados por el CAA. 


  • ¿QUIÉNES SOMOS?
  • ESPACIOS DENTRO DEL CENTRO ARTE ALAMEDA:

El CAA integra de forma simultánea a diversas expresiones artísticas y culturales, divide sus espacios en:

- Cine Arte Alameda: Dos salas, una con capacidad para 300 personas y otra para 27, destinadas a la exhibición constante de lo mejor del cine arte nacional e internacional. Cuenta con alta tecnología en la proyección y el sonido. Se suceden a lo largo del año, muestras y festivales de diversos estilos y formatos, como el In Edit Nescafé, FIDOCS, Mecal Chile, FIFA de Mons en Chile, entre otros. La sala principal también cuenta con las instalaciones para el desarrollo de conciertos, obras de teatro, presentaciones de libros, charlas, coloquios, etc. Es una alternativa a la programación de las grandes multi-salas.

- El Living: Espacio con 13 años de existencia, dedicado a la música en vivo. Está ubicado en el segundo piso del CAA y cuenta con una capacidad para 250 personas. Da lugar a la presentación de bandas musicales de diversos estilos, emergentes y consagradas, nacionales y extranjeras, durante las noches de los fines de semana. Cuenta con un bar y una vista privilegiada a la principal avenida de la capital.

- Café Arte Alameda: Espacio íntimo para disfrutar de la mejor gastronomía popular y hogareña, siempre con alternativas vegetarianas. Un lugar ideal para los amantes de la música, la cocina, así como del intercambio y la reflexión.

- Hall Central: Espacio amplio y urbano. Cuenta con grandes muros de madera usados para exposiciones de pintura, fotografía, instalaciones, además de dos elementos característicos del CAA: una cascada de agua y un puente que interconecta los diversos espacios. Es un ugar para el desarrollo de acciones, presentaciones de libros, artes circenses,  ferias, entre otras actividades de encuentro e intercambio cultural.

  • PARA QUÉ NECESITAMOS LA RECAUDACIÓN (OBJETIVOS GENERALES)

Al ser un establecimiento reconocido en Chile por su labor en el fomento del cine arte y de la cultura vanguardista en general, es de primera necesidad, para el CAA conseguir los recursos para:


- Potenciar las actividades del CAA: Estableciendo un plan de difusión y programación cultural, permanente y a mediano plazo, que nos asegure un funcionamiento orgánico. Para asegurar lo anterior, necesitamos de un equipo humano y profesional que se mantenga en el tiempo y que abarque todas las áreas que hoy no tenemos cubiertas, además de mejorar plataformas y herramientas digitales y físicas, que nos permitan una mejor coordinación y planificación.

- Ampliar el alcance a los beneficiarios y consumidores de nuestra oferta cultural: Generando un plan comunicacional dirgido a los principales medios y haciendo crecer a nuestra comunidad virtual en nuestras redes sociales. ​

- Profundizar las alianzas: con Corporaciones, Embajadas, Fundaciones, Municipios, y otras entidades comunales, nacionales y/o internacionales para generar un mayor impacto en nuestros usuarios; con mejores beneficios, ampliando de manera significativa nuestro público objetivo en torno a una oferta cultural vanguardista, de calidad, y a la vez, que nos asegure una alta demanda, activa y permanente.

  • QUÉ SE HARÁ CON LO RECAUDADO (OBJETIVOS ESPECÍFICOS)

Se aumentará nuestra programación cultural integral, fomentando el desarrollo de:

 - Programación conciertos de "El Living": Duplicando la cantidad de bandas emergentes y eventos conceptuales que se presenten en vivo cada fin de semana.

 - Emprendimiento de ferias urbanas: Albergar y potenciar de mejor forma una mayor cantidad de ferias urbanas de diseño, gastronomía, libros, vinilos y otras temáticas; creando una real oportunidad a los pequeños emprendedores enmarcados en conceptos de originalidad y comercio justo, para mostrar y vender su trabajo.

 -Financiamiento próximos festivales y muestras de cine a desarrollarse en nuestro espacio. Este proceso va de la mano con la adquisición de derechos de exhibición de nuevas cintas, aumentando la diversidad de la cartelera cinematográfica.

- Mejoramiento de Infraestructuras del CAA: Instalando un sistema de calefacción global, de control inalámbrico y de calidad.

- Financiamiento de parte del arriendo del lugar físico en que se emplaza el Centro Arte. Espacio con 1500 metros cuadrados, ubicado en el centro neurálgico de la capital de Chile.

- Compra de un nuevo telón para proyectar nuestras películas en la sala principal de cine. Queremos que este implemento vaya acorde a las normas internacionales y sea adaptable a la tecnología 3D. Sus dimensiones son de 7 por 5 metros de superficie.

- Pintar y remodelar la fachada del Establecimiento

- Mejorando el estado de las butacas. Reparando y modernizando su estado en ambas salas de cine. De la sala principal se requiere una remodelación de todas las butacas (320), las que son de larga data y únicas en su estilo. Por cierto, este trabajo se realizará respetando la arquitectura del lugar.

- Remodelación de los baños de hombres y mujeres en el primer piso, además del baño inserto en El Living (segundo piso).

- Actualizando las instalaciones del “Living”, con un mejor equipamiento de audio e instalaciones técnicas.    

- Ampliando la carta de nuestro Café Arte Alameda, con una nuevas instalaciones que nos permitan diversificar la oferta gastronómica

- Reparar Sillones y mesas, del Hall Central y cafetería, respectivamente, para una mejor experiencia de los usuarios

- Instalar señaléticas e iluminar de mejor forma y bajo estrictas normas de seguridad, ciertas zonas de nuestros espacios como el Hall central o el Living.

- Compra e instalación de casilleros tipo custodia, seguros y amplios para nuestro personal, así también como para nuestros usuarios.

- Remodelación de las cortinas y rejas exteriores del lugar. Se necesita la actualización de estas instalaciones, acorde a las normas de seguridad y con el uso de nuevas tecnologías (control remoto, etc).

- Remodelación de la salida de escape, con techumbre nueva, una mezanina, puerta eléctrica para la entrada de los artistas, espacio para los usuarios y personal.

Se concretará un equipo de trabajo cohesionado y con proyección en el tiempo:

- Asegurando buenas remuneraciones a los trabajadores

- Generando equipos que se complementen en las diversas áreas, para así poder distribuir de mejor forma la carga laboral y hacer más eficaz el trabajo

Difusión y alcance de nuestras actividades:

- Contando con recursos para inyectar a las diversas campañas que realizaremos en nuestras redes sociales y plataformas

- Generando un equipo comunicacional más amplio que logre posicionarnos en más medios de comunicación y de forma más planificada y sostenida en el tiempo

- Lograr obtener espacios fijos en espacios públicos (Ej: el Metro) o en programas radiales y de TV, para difundir nuestras actividades semanales y mensuales.


  • OTRAS FORMAS DE AYUDAR

Si no puedes donar dinero para lograr los objetivos de esta campaña, te pedimos que nos ayudes con la mayor difusión que puedas hacer sobre esta iniciativa, compartiendo nuestra campaña en tus redes sociales o vía mail, con tus amigos, con tu entorno. La difusión es una poderosa herramienta que nos ayudará a nuestro cometido. ¡Hagamos eco para alcanzar la meta!

¡Todas las formas son válidas y las necesitamos!


INTRODUCTION

Centro Arte Alameda needs your support to continue with their labour and promotion for diverse artistic expressions. We are a unique cultural space, historic, independent and creative in the heart of Santiago, Chile. A place that has marked milestones for over 23 years. We ask you to help us to continue this dream of many: the development of culture and the arts in our country.

Our goal is your goal, come together in this commitment for independent, creative, quality culture for all.

#UnitedWeAreAvantGarde

  SUPPORT °°° DONATE°°° PARTICIPATE




WHO WE ARE?

The Alameda Art Center (CAA) is a multipurpose cultural center, modern and with 

various spaces for cultural activities of all kinds.

Despite severe budgetary constraints (The Alameda Art Center receives no state 

or private subsidy), the CAA has played a key role in the support, promotion and 

development of new cultural projects of quality, uncensored, with an open mind to 

the diversity and cultural, ethnic, political, social and spiritual pluralism.

The Art Cinema is the backbone of our proposal, this 70% of the billboard is of 

national producers, expressed in nano, short, medium and feature films of various 

genres of fiction and nonfiction. At the same time, we encourage the creation of 

hearings with the screening of new and classic films of the best international art 

cinema. A similar pattern occurs in music, photography, cuisine, literature, visual 

arts, circus, theater, performative, among other arts and social activities that take 

place in the spaces generated by the CAA.


CORNERS INSIDE THE ALAMEDA ARTS CENTER:

The CAA as a space that simultaneously integrates various artistic and cultural 

divides its spaces in:

 - Cine Arte Alameda: Two rooms, one with 300 seats and the other for 27, 

aimed at the constant exhibition of the best of national and international 

independent cinema. They feature high-tech projection and sound. They 

occur throughout the year, exhibitions and film festivals of different styles 

and formats, such as Nescafe Edit In the FIDOCS, Mecal, the FIFA or 

"Cinema and Love," among others. The main room also has facilities for the 

development of concerts, plays, book presentations, lectures, symposia, etc. 

It is an alternative to scheduling large multiplexes.


 - The Living Room: Space with 13 years of existence, dedicated to quality 

live music. It is located on the second floor of our Art Center, which seats 

150 people. Its aim is to accommodate the presentation of bands of different 

styles, emerging and women, local and foreign, during the nights of the 

weekend. It has a bar and overlooks the main avenue of the capital. 


 - Café Arte Alameda : intimate to enjoy the best popular and homely cuisine, 

always with vegetarian alternatives space. An ideal place for music lovers, 

the kitchen and the exchange and reflection.


-  Central Hall: large and urban space. It has large wooden walls are used for 

exhibitions of painting, photography, installations, plus two elements that are 

characteristic of the CAA: a waterfall and a bridge interconnecting the various 

areas of the Art Center. It is an enabling environment for the development of 

space events, book presentations, performances, circus arts, events, fairs 

design, cuisine, music, and other activities that promote cultural boiling of our 

space.


WHY WE NEED THE FUNDS (OBJECTIVES)

As a recognized establishment in Chile in the work of promoting the Film Arts and 

the avant-garde culture in general, it is of first necessity to the Alameda Art Center, 

get the resources that allow us to:

-  Keep the Art Center with its activities: Establishing a dissemination plan 

and cultural programming, permanent and medium term, to ensure us an 

organic operation. To ensure this, we need a professional team that is kept 

over time and covering all the areas that we have covered today, and 

improve platforms and digital and physical tools that allow us to better 

coordination and planning.

 - Expand the scope to beneficiaries and consumers of our cultural offer: 

Generating a communication plan to attack the mainstream media and grow 

our virtual community present in our social networks.

- Deepen alliances: with corporations, embassies, foundations, municipalities, 

and other community, national and / or international organizations that allow us to 

generate a much greater impact on our users with better benefits, significantly 

expanding our target audience around an avant-garde cultural offerings, quality 

and time, which assures us a high demand, active, faithful and permanent.

WHAT WILL BE DONE WITH THE COLLECTED FUNDS (specific objectives)

Our comprehensive cultural program will be increased by encouraging the 

development of:

- Programming concerts of "The Living": Doubling the number of emerging 

bands and conceptual events that occur live every weekend.

- Entrepreneurship urban fairs: Giving better promotion in order of hosting 

greater number of urban design fairs, food and other issues; creating a real 

opportunity for small entrepreneurs framed in concepts of originality and fair 

trade, to display and sell their work.

- - Financing upcoming film festivals to be held in our space. Process that 

goes hand in hand with the acquisition of rights to exhibit new films, 

increasing our movie listings.


Infrastructure Alameda Art Center will be improved:

- Installing a global heating system, wireless controlled and quality like.

 - Financing the rent part of the physical location where the Art Center is 

housed. A Space with 1500 square meters, located in the heart of the 

capitol of Chile.

 - The Purchase of a new ecran to project our films in the main theater. We 

want it according to international standards and adaptable to 3D technology. 

Their dimensions are 7 for 5 meters.

 - Paint and refurbish the front of the building,

 - Improving the state of the seats. Repairing and modernizing their status in 

both theaters. In the main room remodeling all seats (320) is required, which 

are long-standing and unique in its style. Incidentally, this work will be done 

respecting the architecture.

 - Remodeling bathrooms for men and women on the first floor, plus 

bathroom insert in the living room (second floor). Enabling bathroom for 

people with disabilities.

- Upgrading facilities for "The Living Room", with better audio equipment 

and technical installations.

 - Expanding themenu of our Café Arte Alameda, with a new facility that will 

allow us to diversify the cuisine

 - Repair chairs and tables, the Central Hall and cafeteria, respectively, for a 

better user experience.

 - Install signposts ad illuminate in a better way and under strict safety 

standards, some areas of our spaces as the central Hall or the living room.

 - The purchase and installation of lockers custody type, safe and wide for 

our staff and for our visitors.

 - Remodeling of curtains and outdoor bars for the venue. Updating these 

facilities is needed, according to safety standards and the use of new 

technologies (remote control, etc).

- Remodeling the emergency escape, with new roof, one mezzanine, electric 

door to the stage door, space for users and staff.

 - Cohesive team work and projection will be defined over time:

- Ensuring good salaries to workers. 

- Generating complementary teams in different areas, in order to improve, 

distribute the workload and effective work.

Broadcasting and scope of our activities:

 - Having to inject resources to the various campaigns that will take place in 

our social networks and platforms.

 - Generating a wider communications team that achieves positioning in 

more media and more planned and sustained manner over time.

- Achieve permanent spaces in public spaces (for example Metro) or on radio and 

TV programs, to spread our weekly and monthly activities.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

If you can not donate money to achieve the objectives of this campaign, we ask 

you to help us as widely as possible of this initiative, in your social networks with 

your friends, with your environment. Diffusion is a powerful tool that will help us in 

our mission.

All forms are valid and needed!
story_txt:
INTRODUCCIÓN
Centro Arte Alameda necesita de tu
apoyo para la continuidad con su labor de difusión y promoción para las
diversas expresiones artísticas.
Somos un espacio cultural único,
histórico, independiente y creativo en el corazón de Santiago de Chile. Un
lugar que ha marcado hitos por más de 23 años.
Te pedimos que nos ayudes para
continuar este sueño de muchos: el desarrollo de la cultura y las artes en
nuestro país.
Nuestra meta es la tuya, vamos juntos
en esta apuesta por la cultura independiente, creativa, de calidad y al acceso
de todos.
#UnidosSomosVanguardia
  APOYA °°°
APORTA °°° PARTICIPA.
www.centroartealameda.cl


El Centro Arte Alameda (CAA) es un centro cultural multipropósito, vanguardista y con diversos espacios para la realización de actividades culturales de todo tipo.
A pesar de las fuertes limitaciones presupuestarias (el CAA no recibe subvención constante ni estatal ni privada), el CAA ha jugado un rol fundamental en el apoyo, fomento y desarrollo de nuevos proyectos culturales de calidad, sin censura, con un espíritu abierto a la diversidad y pluralidad cultural, étnica, política, social y espiritual.
El Cine Arte Alameda es la columna vertebral del CAA. Su cartelera cuenta con un 70% de realizaciones nacionales, expresada en nano, corto, medio y largometrajes de diversos géneros de ficción y no ficción. Al mismo tiempo, ha fomentado la creación de audiencias con la proyección de estrenos y clásicos del mejor cine arte internacional. Una tónica similar se da en materia musical, fotográfica, gastronómica, literaria, de artes visuales, circenses, teatrales, performáticas, entre otras actividades sociales que se dan en los espacios generados por el CAA. 


¿QUIÉNES SOMOS?



ESPACIOS DENTRO DEL
     CENTRO ARTE ALAMEDA:

El CAA integra de forma simultánea a diversas
expresiones artísticas y culturales, divide sus espacios en:
- Cine Arte Alameda: Dos
salas, una con capacidad para 300 personas y otra para 27, destinadas a la
exhibición constante de lo mejor del cine arte nacional e internacional. Cuenta con alta tecnología en la proyección y el
sonido. Se suceden a lo largo del año, muestras y festivales de
diversos estilos y formatos, como el In Edit Nescafé, FIDOCS, Mecal Chile, FIFA de Mons en Chile, entre otros. La sala principal también cuenta con las
instalaciones para el desarrollo de conciertos, obras de teatro, presentaciones
de libros, charlas, coloquios, etc. Es una alternativa a la programación de las
grandes multi-salas.
- El Living: Espacio con
13 años de existencia, dedicado a la música en vivo. Está ubicado en
el segundo piso del CAA y cuenta con una capacidad para 250 personas. Da lugar a la presentación de bandas musicales de diversos
estilos, emergentes y consagradas, nacionales y extranjeras, durante las noches
de los fines de semana. Cuenta con un bar y una vista privilegiada a la principal avenida de
la capital.
- Café Arte Alameda:
Espacio íntimo para disfrutar de la mejor gastronomía popular y hogareña,
siempre con alternativas vegetarianas. Un lugar ideal para los amantes de la
música, la cocina, así como del intercambio y la reflexión.
- Hall Central: Espacio
amplio y urbano. Cuenta con grandes muros de madera usados para
exposiciones de pintura, fotografía, instalaciones, además de dos elementos característicos del CAA: una cascada de agua y un puente que interconecta
los diversos espacios. Es un ugar para el
desarrollo de acciones, presentaciones de libros, artes circenses,  ferias, entre otras actividades de encuentro e intercambio cultural.

PARA QUÉ
     NECESITAMOS LA RECAUDACIÓN (OBJETIVOS GENERALES)
Al ser un
establecimiento reconocido en Chile por su labor en el fomento del cine arte y de
la cultura vanguardista en general, es de primera necesidad, para el CAA conseguir los recursos para:

- Potenciar las actividades del CAA: Estableciendo un plan de difusión y programación
cultural, permanente y a mediano plazo, que nos asegure un funcionamiento
orgánico. Para asegurar lo anterior, necesitamos de un equipo humano y
profesional que se mantenga en el tiempo y que abarque todas las áreas que hoy
no tenemos cubiertas, además de mejorar plataformas y herramientas digitales y
físicas, que nos permitan una mejor coordinación y planificación.
- Ampliar el alcance a los beneficiarios y consumidores
de nuestra oferta cultural: Generando un plan comunicacional dirgido a los principales medios y haciendo crecer a nuestra comunidad
virtual en nuestras redes sociales. ​
- Profundizar las alianzas: con Corporaciones, Embajadas,
Fundaciones, Municipios, y otras entidades comunales, nacionales y/o
internacionales para generar un mayor impacto en
nuestros usuarios; con mejores beneficios, ampliando de manera significativa
nuestro público objetivo en torno a una oferta cultural vanguardista, de
calidad, y a la vez, que nos asegure una alta demanda, activa y permanente.

QUÉ SE HARÁ CON LO
     RECAUDADO (OBJETIVOS ESPECÍFICOS)

Se aumentará nuestra programación cultural integral, fomentando el
desarrollo de:
 - Programación conciertos
de "El Living": Duplicando la cantidad de bandas emergentes y eventos
conceptuales que se presenten en vivo cada fin de semana.
 - Emprendimiento de ferias
urbanas: Albergar y potenciar de mejor forma una mayor cantidad de ferias
urbanas de diseño, gastronomía, libros, vinilos y otras temáticas; creando una real
oportunidad a los pequeños emprendedores enmarcados en conceptos de
originalidad y comercio justo, para mostrar y vender su trabajo.
 -Financiamiento próximos
festivales y muestras de cine a desarrollarse en nuestro espacio. Este proceso va de la
mano con la adquisición de derechos de exhibición de nuevas cintas, aumentando
la diversidad de la cartelera cinematográfica.
- Mejoramiento de Infraestructuras del
CAA: Instalando un sistema de calefacción global, de control inalámbrico y de
calidad.
- Financiamiento de parte del arriendo del lugar físico en que se
emplaza el Centro Arte. Espacio con 1500 metros cuadrados, ubicado en el centro
neurálgico de la capital de Chile.
- Compra de un nuevo telón para proyectar nuestras películas en la sala
principal de cine. Queremos que este implemento vaya acorde a las normas
internacionales y sea adaptable a la tecnología 3D. Sus dimensiones son de 7
por 5 metros de superficie.
- Pintar y remodelar la fachada del Establecimiento
- Mejorando el estado de las butacas. Reparando y modernizando su estado
en ambas salas de cine. De la sala principal se requiere una remodelación
de todas las butacas (320), las que son de larga data y únicas en su
estilo. Por cierto, este trabajo se realizará respetando la arquitectura del
lugar.
- Remodelación de los baños de hombres y mujeres en el primer piso,
además del baño inserto en El Living (segundo piso).
- Actualizando las instalaciones del “Living”, con un
mejor equipamiento de audio e instalaciones técnicas.  
 
- Ampliando la carta de nuestro Café Arte Alameda, con una nuevas
instalaciones que nos permitan diversificar la oferta gastronómica
- Reparar Sillones y mesas, del Hall Central y
cafetería, respectivamente, para una mejor experiencia de los usuarios
- Instalar señaléticas e iluminar de mejor forma y bajo estrictas
normas de seguridad, ciertas zonas de nuestros espacios como el Hall
central o el Living.
- Compra e
instalación de casilleros tipo custodia, seguros y amplios para nuestro
personal, así también como para nuestros usuarios.
- Remodelación de las cortinas y rejas exteriores del lugar. Se necesita
la actualización de estas instalaciones, acorde a las normas de seguridad y con
el uso de nuevas tecnologías (control remoto, etc).
- Remodelación de la salida de escape, con techumbre nueva, una
mezanina, puerta eléctrica para la entrada de los artistas, espacio para los
usuarios y personal.
Se concretará un equipo de trabajo cohesionado y con proyección en el
tiempo:
- Asegurando buenas remuneraciones a los trabajadores
- Generando equipos que se
complementen en las diversas áreas, para así poder distribuir de mejor forma la
carga laboral y hacer más eficaz el trabajo
Difusión y alcance de nuestras actividades:
- Contando con recursos para inyectar a las diversas campañas que realizaremos
en nuestras redes sociales y plataformas
- Generando un equipo comunicacional más amplio que logre posicionarnos
en más medios de comunicación y de forma más planificada y sostenida en el
tiempo
- Lograr obtener espacios fijos en espacios públicos (Ej: el Metro) o en
programas radiales y de TV, para difundir nuestras actividades semanales y
mensuales.


OTRAS FORMAS DE
     AYUDAR

Si no puedes donar dinero para lograr los objetivos de esta campaña, te
pedimos que nos ayudes con la mayor difusión que puedas hacer sobre esta
iniciativa, compartiendo nuestra campaña en tus redes sociales o vía mail, con
tus amigos, con tu entorno. La difusión es una poderosa herramienta que nos
ayudará a nuestro cometido. ¡Hagamos eco para alcanzar la meta!
¡Todas las formas son válidas y las necesitamos!

INTRODUCTION


Centro Arte Alameda needs
your support to continue with their labour and promotion for diverse artistic
expressions. We are a unique cultural space, historic, independent and creative
in the heart of Santiago, Chile. A place that has marked milestones for over 23
years. We ask you to help us to continue this dream of many: the development of
culture and the arts in our country.
Our goal is your goal, come
together in this commitment for independent, creative, quality culture for all.
#UnitedWeAreAvantGarde
  SUPPORT °°° DONATE°°° PARTICIPATE



WHO WE ARE?
The Alameda Art Center (CAA) is a multipurpose cultural center, modern and with 
various spaces for cultural activities of all kinds.
Despite severe budgetary constraints (The Alameda Art Center receives no state 
or private subsidy), the CAA has played a key role in the support, promotion and 
development of new cultural projects of quality, uncensored, with an open mind to 
the diversity and cultural, ethnic, political, social and spiritual pluralism.
The Art Cinema is the backbone of our proposal, this 70% of the billboard is of 
national producers, expressed in nano, short, medium and feature films of various 
genres of fiction and nonfiction. At the same time, we encourage the creation of 
hearings with the screening of new and classic films of the best international art 
cinema. A similar pattern occurs in music, photography, cuisine, literature, visual 
arts, circus, theater, performative, among other arts and social activities that take 
place in the spaces generated by the CAA.

CORNERS INSIDE THE ALAMEDA ARTS CENTER:
The CAA as a space that simultaneously integrates various artistic and cultural 
divides its spaces in:
 - Cine Arte Alameda: Two rooms, one with 300 seats and the other for 27, 
aimed at the constant exhibition of the best of national and international 
independent cinema. They feature high-tech projection and sound. They 
occur throughout the year, exhibitions and film festivals of different styles 
and formats, such as Nescafe Edit In the FIDOCS, Mecal, the FIFA or 
"Cinema and Love," among others. The main room also has facilities for the 
development of concerts, plays, book presentations, lectures, symposia, etc. 
It is an alternative to scheduling large multiplexes.

 - The Living Room: Space with 13 years of existence, dedicated to quality 
live music. It is located on the second floor of our Art Center, which seats 
150 people. Its aim is to accommodate the presentation of bands of different 
styles, emerging and women, local and foreign, during the nights of the 
weekend. It has a bar and overlooks the main avenue of the capital. 

 - Café Arte Alameda : intimate to enjoy the best popular and homely cuisine, 
always with vegetarian alternatives space. An ideal place for music lovers, 
the kitchen and the exchange and reflection.

-  Central Hall: large and urban space. It has large wooden walls are used for 
exhibitions of painting, photography, installations, plus two elements that are 
characteristic of the CAA: a waterfall and a bridge interconnecting the various 
areas of the Art Center. It is an enabling environment for the development of 
space events, book presentations, performances, circus arts, events, fairs 
design, cuisine, music, and other activities that promote cultural boiling of our 
space.

WHY WE NEED THE FUNDS (OBJECTIVES)
As a recognized establishment in Chile in the work of promoting the Film Arts and 
the avant-garde culture in general, it is of first necessity to the Alameda Art Center, 
get the resources that allow us to:
-  Keep the Art Center with its activities: Establishing a dissemination plan 
and cultural programming, permanent and medium term, to ensure us an 
organic operation. To ensure this, we need a professional team that is kept 
over time and covering all the areas that we have covered today, and 
improve platforms and digital and physical tools that allow us to better 
coordination and planning.
 - Expand the scope to beneficiaries and consumers of our cultural offer: 
Generating a communication plan to attack the mainstream media and grow 
our virtual community present in our social networks.
- Deepen alliances: with corporations, embassies, foundations, municipalities, 
and other community, national and / or international organizations that allow us to 
generate a much greater impact on our users with better benefits, significantly 
expanding our target audience around an avant-garde cultural offerings, quality 
and time, which assures us a high demand, active, faithful and permanent.
WHAT WILL BE DONE WITH THE COLLECTED FUNDS (specific objectives)
Our comprehensive cultural program will be increased by encouraging the 
development of:
- Programming concerts of "The Living": Doubling the number of emerging 
bands and conceptual events that occur live every weekend.
- Entrepreneurship urban fairs: Giving better promotion in order of hosting 
greater number of urban design fairs, food and other issues; creating a real 
opportunity for small entrepreneurs framed in concepts of originality and fair 
trade, to display and sell their work.
- - Financing upcoming film festivals to be held in our space. Process that 
goes hand in hand with the acquisition of rights to exhibit new films, 
increasing our movie listings.

Infrastructure Alameda Art Center will be improved:
- Installing a global heating system, wireless controlled and quality like.
 - Financing the rent part of the physical location where the Art Center is 
housed. A Space with 1500 square meters, located in the heart of the 
capitol of Chile.
 - The Purchase of a new ecran to project our films in the main theater. We 
want it according to international standards and adaptable to 3D technology. 
Their dimensions are 7 for 5 meters.
 - Paint and refurbish the front of the building,
 - Improving the state of the seats. Repairing and modernizing their status in 
both theaters. In the main room remodeling all seats (320) is required, which 
are long-standing and unique in its style. Incidentally, this work will be done 
respecting the architecture.
 - Remodeling bathrooms for men and women on the first floor, plus 
bathroom insert in the living room (second floor). Enabling bathroom for 
people with disabilities.
- Upgrading facilities for "The Living Room", with better audio equipment 
and technical installations.
 - Expanding themenu of our Café Arte Alameda, with a new facility that will 
allow us to diversify the cuisine
 - Repair chairs and tables, the Central Hall and cafeteria, respectively, for a 
better user experience.
 - Install signposts ad illuminate in a better way and under strict safety 
standards, some areas of our spaces as the central Hall or the living room.
 - The purchase and installation of lockers custody type, safe and wide for 
our staff and for our visitors.
 - Remodeling of curtains and outdoor bars for the venue. Updating these 
facilities is needed, according to safety standards and the use of new 
technologies (remote control, etc).
- Remodeling the emergency escape, with new roof, one mezzanine, electric 
door to the stage door, space for users and staff.
 - Cohesive team work and projection will be defined over time:
- Ensuring good salaries to workers. 
- Generating complementary teams in different areas, in order to improve, 
distribute the workload and effective work.
Broadcasting and scope of our activities:
 - Having to inject resources to the various campaigns that will take place in 
our social networks and platforms.
 - Generating a wider communications team that achieves positioning in 
more media and more planned and sustained manner over time.
- Achieve permanent spaces in public spaces (for example Metro) or on radio and 
TV programs, to spread our weekly and monthly activities.
OTHER WAYS TO HELP
If you can not donate money to achieve the objectives of this campaign, we ask 
you to help us as widely as possible of this initiative, in your social networks with 
your friends, with your environment. Diffusion is a powerful tool that will help us in 
our mission.
All forms are valid and needed!

story:
Exhibition title: TEN YEARS: RELIGHTING THE NARRATIVES

When: 15-25 May 2015

Where: Mongolian National Modern Art Gallery, Ulaanbaatar


Short Summary


I am an artist, who was born and grew in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

I fell in love with art from a very young age, and spent most of my childhood and early adulthood drawing and painting. I studied at the Institute of Fine Arts (est.1945), the most prestigious art school in Mongolia and I learned a lot from my tutors. In 2004, I received a scholarship for my MA in Contemporary Fine Art Practice (MFA) degree course at Leeds Metropolitan University, U.K. After the graduation, I decided to pursue my practice-based research at a PhD level. In October 2012, I returned to Mongolia to start a new chapter in my artistic and creative path.


My life started with art, it is continuing through art, and I wish it ends with art.

The campaign helps me to showcase selected works from my last ten years of art practice, which encompasses photography, performance, video art, photo essays and public art. The exhibition will be curated by Ester Bozzoni, an Italian artist and a curator, who is based in Ulaanbaatar. 

What We Need & What You Get


Our goal is to raise $5000 to stage the exhibition at its best. Since March, we started a local fundraising campaign to raise $1500 of the total amount. The biggest part of the fund will be spent on printing the artworks in large formats on a specialist printer. Artwork printing will cost $2000, framing $700, installation $320, curator’s fee $500, graphic designer $300, catalogue design and printing $900, posters and labels $100, projectors and media players rental $150 and plus a series of small expenses such as papers, tools and inks.

In return for your kind support, I will print your names on the exhibition posters and catalogues with my artworks. In addition, we will send you postcards, posters, catalogues and Limited Edition Prints of my artworks.

Impact


Since 2004, I exhibited in many group exhibitions in the UK, Mongolia, U.S.A, and I was invited to take part in artist residencies at LeedsMet Gallery (2005, UK), The Light Centre (2010, UK), and MONGOL CITIZEN Festival (2014, Germany).

TEN YEARS: RELIGHTING THE NARRATIVES is my fifth solo exhibition to date and the first in Mongolia.

The exhibition will show artworks, created through performance, photography, video and public art. In addition, the exhibition promotes contemporary art and informs audience about different ways of practicing art. The set-up of the exhibition is different from a common approach to staging an art exhibition in Mongolia. I worked with my curator and developed the exhibition concept and overall design. This method of organising an art exhibition is rare in Mongolia and it will be a new experience for Mongolian viewers. 

It is vital to show my artworks to Mongolian audience, which I created over the last 10 years. For a very long time, I dreamed of displaying my artworks to the Mongolian public and share my experiences.

EXHIBITION SYNOPSIS 

Curator: Ester Bozzoni

Tsendpurev Tsegmid inaugurates her first solo exhibition in Mongolia, titled “TEN YEARS: RELIGHTING THE NARRATIVES” at the Mongolian National Modern Art Gallery in Ulaanbaatar. The public gallery displays her exhibition, which condenses the creative research of a personal identity, through experiences of emotional, cultural and social situations.

The artist draws inspiration from her inner world in order to produce photo-based works, and expresses the conflicts coming from the contrast between personal and outer realities. The selection of large format photographic images combined with writings, site-specific installations and video projections of re-edited audiovisual materials that Tsendpurev has created instinctively, often confiding her feelings to the camera.

­

The crucial moment of Tsendpurev’s life was the overseas relocation, which resulted in a long and emotionally challenging experience in Leeds – UK, where the artist had to cope with her “Being Mongol”, the stereotypes and the resulting redefinition of identity, and she fills the images with the dialogues of “Where I come from?”, “Who am I?, “Whom I could be?”

In her works, she narrates and analyzes the path of an individual, who might be defined as “the erudite stranger” through production of series of photographic works. Tsendpurev’s massive photographic production tells about the search for a balance among different identities, “Stranger”, “Woman”, “Daughter” and “Artist”, which are engendered by the comparison with the society and the internal conflict the definition of ego. This flow into the research that integrates her personal image and her daily surroundings creates a space, where the only guests are the artist/model and the camera. The resulted artworks come under the term “auto-photo-performance”, coined by the artist herself.

The constant presence of Tsendpurev’s art practice since 2012 is the gaze on women’s social role, still subordinate to men and subjected to social gender pressures. Through the external judgment – on art works, as well on the author – the female artist experiences a social constriction, which often diverts public attention from the conceptual and aesthetic qualities of the works, sadly in favor of a voyeurism against the body and the intimacy of the individual.

For the last three years, Tsendpurev has focused her practice-based research on this theme. The initial difficulty of adjusting back to life in Mongolia, gradually gave way to the exploration of social boundaries – as she had already addressed in the UK – using one’s own body – and no more of her own face – the preferred subject for her works. While remaining consistent to the previous modus operandi, Tsendpurev approaches a different aesthetic which results in a visual experimentation that leaves apart the aesthetic and compositional dogmas. Direct and ambiguous images point and disappoint the idealization of the female body. 

The curatorial objective is to show the questions addressed by the artist and to assemble Tsendpurev’s artistic path, since she left Mongolia in 2004 until today, under a new perspective and through a thematic grouping of art works produced by the artist during this period.

her “Being Mongol”, the stereotypes and the resulting redefinition of 
identity, and she fills the images with the dialogues of “Where I come 
from?”, “Who am I?, “Whom I could be?”
In her works, she narrates and analyzes 
the path of an individual, who might be defined as “the erudite 
stranger” through production of series of photographic works. 
Tsendpurev’s massive photographic production tells about the search for a
 balance among different identities, “Stranger”, “Woman”, “Daughter” and
 “Artist”, which are engendered by the comparison with the society and 
the internal conflict the definition of ego. This flow into the research
 that integrates her personal image and her daily surroundings creates a
 space, where the only guests are the artist/model and the camera. The 
resulted artworks come under the term “auto-photo-performance”, coined 
by the artist herself.
The constant presence of Tsendpurev’s art 
practice since 2012 is the gaze on women’s social role, still 
subordinate to men and subjected to social gender pressures. Through the
 external judgment – on art works, as well on the author – the female 
artist experiences a social constriction, which often diverts public 
attention from the conceptual and aesthetic qualities of the works, 
sadly in favor of a voyeurism against the body and the intimacy of the 
individual.
For the last three years, Tsendpurev has 
focused her practice-based research on this theme. The initial 
difficulty of adjusting back to life in Mongolia, gradually gave way to 
the exploration of social boundaries – as she had already addressed in 
the UK – using one’s own body – and no more of her own face – the 
preferred subject for her works. While remaining consistent to the 
previous modus operandi, Tsendpurev approaches a different 
aesthetic which results in a visual experimentation that leaves apart 
the aesthetic and compositional dogmas. Direct and ambiguous images 
point and disappoint the idealization of the female body. The curatorial
 objective is to show the questions addressed by the artist and to 
assemble Tsendpurev’s artistic path, since she left Mongolia in 2004 
until today, under a new perspective and through a thematic grouping of 
art works produced by the artist during this period.

story:
10 years of hard work

IRREVERSIBLE Projects a true platform for artists all over the world.

Success comes in all shapes and colors. You can be successful in your job and career but you can equally be successful in your marriage, at sports or a hobby. Whatever successes you are after there is one thing all radically successful people have in common: Their ferocious drive and hunger for success makes them never give up. Successful people often paint a picture of the perfect ascent to success. In fact, some of the most successful people in the art business have failed. Many have failed numerous times but they have never given up. Successful people are able to pick themselves up, dust themselves off and carry on trying. This is simply the best description of what “10th IRREVERSIBLE years have been for me.”

OUR BIG GOAL

My goal is to achieve with this fundraiser to cover the cost of shipping, airfares and food for 20 international artists (AUSTRALIA, CUBA, USA, NICARAGUA, VENEZUELA, ETC)  whom I have been working so HARD  for the past 10th years can meet in Chicago to participate in our 10th Anniversary exhibition taking place at one of the most prestigious art Center in the USA The Zhou B Art Center. Thanks to the amazing honor and opportunity given to us by Curator / Exhibitor Director Sergio Gomez we can exhibit in such of large and important audience our 10th anniversary

The magnitude of this opportunity will help us to achieve GROW AND CHANGE, our commitment with this exhibition is that the work of 20 amazing international artists will have the unique ability to engage individuals in a very deep and personal way. Art can help us understand our humanity and the historical conditions we live in, but importantly this exhibition will draw us into thinking whether our reality needs to be changed. 

What We Need 

20 artists trip expenses 
  • Airfare: Round trip tickets 
  • Shipping Artwork 
  • 1 week airbnb expenses
  • 1 week food/drinks

    What You Get -    Unique Perks
  • $10   THANK YOU NOTE and shout out in our social media (send us your photo)
  • $20   Complimentary copy of Irreversible Art Magazine
  • $50    IRR Magazine + EDO ILUSTRADO Signed Tshirt
  • $100  IRR Magazine - MEET THE ARTIST (come and join us in our studio.)
  • $250  IRR Magazine (5 Collectibles back Editions)  - Dinner /Miami based artist
  • $500   Art Fair VIP pass Art Basel Miami week + Original Artwork -
    Small size- (12 x12 in)
  • $1000 Art Fair VIP pass Art Basel Miami week + Original Artwork-
    Medium Size (20 x20 in)

The Impact

  • In a culture obsessed with measuring talent and ability, we often overlook the important role of inspiration. Inspiration awakens us to new possibilities by allowing us to transcend our ordinary experiences and limitations. Inspiration propels a person from apathy to possibility, and transforms the way we perceive our own capabilities. Inspiration may sometimes be overlooked because of its elusive nature. Its history of being treated as supernatural or divine hasn’t helped the situation. But as recent research shows, inspiration can be activated, captured, and manipulated, and it has a major effect on important life outcomes.

Risks & Challenges

WE LOVE OUR SUPPORTERS if you have any questions do no hesitate to contact us

NOOR BLAZEKOVIC c 786 4442790
irreversibleprojects@gmail.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our link, help us to spread the word  help us to make some noise about your campaign

www.irreversibleprojects.com

https://www.facebook.com/irreversiblemagazine

Vimeo
https://vimeo.com/home/myvideos

story:
Sziasztok,

Monostori Ferenc vagyok, homokszobrász. Hosszú évek óta foglalkozom homokszobrászattal, és régi álmom, hogy egy évről-évre megújuló fesztivál keretében a magyar közönséggel is megismertethessem a homokszobrok lenyűgöző, varázslatos világát.

A tavalyi évben néhány jó barát segítségével önerőből elindítottunk egy négy szoborból álló, ingyenesen látogatható kiállítást Tinnyén, amely egyedülálló módon a szobrok készítésének ideje alatt is látogatható volt, és már a szobrok születését is hatalmas érdeklődés kísérte. Ezért úgy gondoltuk, hogy idén valami nagyobbat szeretnénk, immár egy fesztivált, hónapról-hónapra készülő új szobrokkal, zenei és verses rendezvényekkel, gyermekprogramokkal.

A kampánycélunk 14000 USD, amelyre a homokszobrok elkészítéséhez van szükségünk; minden efelett befolyó dollárt pedig a szobrok átadását kísérő zenei és kulturális programok megszervezésére költünk. Adományozni természetesen bármekkora összeget lehet, akár 1 USD-t is - mint ahogy az óriási homokszobrok is sokezer vödörnyi homokból állnak össze.

Egyedi ajándékkal szeretnénk megköszönni támogatóinknak a segítséget:

Minden 8 USD-t elérő adományért dedikált képeslapot, 40 USD feletti adomány esetén a képeslap mellett dedikált, a korábbi munkáimat tartalmazó katalógust, 80 USD esetén pedig a képeslap és katalógus mellett egy dedikált, A2 formátumú posztert adunk ajándékba.

Fontos, hogy fix kampánycélt határoztunk meg, tehát, ha nem sikerül összegyűjtenünk a minimum célként kitűzött összeget, a felajánlások visszakerülnek a támogatókhoz.

Szenvedélyem a homokszobrászat, és szeretném, ha Magyarországon is minél több emberhez eljutna. Nézd meg a bemutatkozó videómat, a korábbi munkáimat a képgalériában, és ha Téged is megragadott a homokszobrok különleges és változatos világa, kérlek, támogatsd a kezdeményezésünket!

story:
My Third World

How did it all begin? Here we go!

As a young Iranian artist, I find myself confronting oppression and censorship when presenting my own art. In Iran, I have never been allowed to freely express myself as a female artist. Art like so many other subjects is controlled by censorship. As long as I was aware of the socio-political condition of my community any form of expression or ideology has been deemed as a threat to the political structure. I believe that art can be a form of growth and advancement for a country. Unfortunately, it isn’t recognized by the ruling parties.

Currently residing in the United States I have been able to exercise my freedom of expression through my art practice. There have been times when my western audience has viewed my work through a filter of based on generalizations surrounding the current political climate of Iran. The centrifugal force of the region is all consuming and it seems to follow me around the world. Its gravitational pull has affected my individual and social identity, my perception of the world, and my internal being at times.

We, the young Iranian generation, cannot separate ourselves from our motherland and the oppression that we have endured. We are the children and grandchildren of an oppressed generation whose attempt to obtain freedom has always been ridiculed, punished, and suppressed. Perhaps now is the time that we celebrate (instead of mourn) who we are; a frustrated, and lost generation full of contradictions. Our vision has been systematically calibrated to oppression to the extent that it becomes hard to identify freedom. These conflicts and frictions within us do not make us victims, but a driving force against this singular perspective. It emboldens us to fight and subdue our internal destructive habits and external biased perceptions. This has led us to begin practicing a sense of individual identity far from self-censorship and social boundaries originating from religion and traditions.

What is this project about again?!

"My Third World" is a curatorial project by a collective group that celebrates the interwoven oppression as a cultural identity that is a political and environmental consequence by acknowledging it not as a victim but as an exponent. This is a journey for the oppressed to gain control of it in order to purge it from society through time. Maybe by purging this collective suppression, we can find our way towards free individual expression, (expressing it, hearing and respecting another’s).

Five artists working in different mediums, (such as painting, video, performance, photography, mixed media) are invited to create works within the mentioned context. These five artists are all of a younger generation who are born and raised in Iran.

This exhibition is an opportunity to showcase the perception and insights of young Iranian artists through their artwork far from cliché propaganda.

This exhibition includes visual arts, artists talks, and films screenings.

Acrylic on paper, 2017, Pegah Ahmadi (one of the participant artists)

Stranger, Acrylic and charcoal on board, Farshad Nasaji (one of the participant artists)

Spark, Brass, Copper and Warm Enamel, Khorshid Joulaee (one of the participant artists)

The other important note:

This project also aims to provide a larger audience for these emerging artists, so their message can be seen and heard internationally. It is important for us to bridge the younger generations of both eastern and western communities. Sharing conversations and perceptions one of the most important roles in breaking down the walls between eastern and western communities (a wall that has been made and emphasized through media and political propaganda)

This is not a project with mortal life and limited duration, this is a project to create and increase the opportunities for the young emerging Iranian artists and strengthen the direct bridge between western and eastern societies; in the hope that This project is an effective step to achieve this great goal.

 

So where is it going to be?!

New System Exhibitions (NSE) is an artist-run exhibition space in the West Bayside neighborhood of Portland, Maine. Founded in late June 2018 with a non-profit mission of providing exhibition, curatorial, and performance opportunities for local and regional emerging artists, NSE is focused on facilitating direct engagement with the community and increased creative autonomy for artists. This autonomy manifests in shows that are artist-directed, curated, and audience-expanding. We rely on grants and donations to run the space, taking the financial pressure away from the artist and allowing for presentation of artwork without regard to salability. Our 2019 summer season will span six shows and present work by over 17 exceptional emerging artists from Maine, New England, Texas, and Iran.

We are so excited for Golaleh Yazdani's exhibition of emerging Iranian artists. Golaleh is bringing us a body of work from artists we haven't had the far-seeing ambition to access. Their diverse work will demonstrate the universal artistic themes, but introduce us to a cultural picture that is normally obscured by political and ideological preconceptions. We're lucky to have the opportunity to present this phenomenal show in our space.

New System Exhibitions Directors

Why do we need financial support:

We are an independent group without any financial support from any institutions or organizations. Your funding will help us to ship the artworks from Iran to the United States of America, and it will enable us to compensate our brilliant artists.  Your funding will also help us with the installation of the artwork, marketing, and all the other costs related to the execution and production.

Our future hopes for this project:

We hope to be able to show this collection in more than one place. This inaugural first exhibition is a step toward opening up a platform for dialog, and exposure to a western audience for these young emerging Iranian artists. We hope that this will be the first of an ongoing collaboration that will expand to more artistic venues, with hopes of developing this into an annual exhibition that would include more Iranian artists as well as artists from other Middle Eastern countries. We believe these conversations need to happen and we are seeing it as our responsibility to be a part of it. This is a long journey, there is still a long road ahead, but we are ready to take on the challenge. We appreciate you helping us take the first step on this journey.

Acrylic and colored pencil on paper, 2017, Pegah Ahmadi

About the Curators:

Golaleh Yazdani

Golaleh Yazdani (b. 1993, Iran), is a mixed media artist using video, sculpture, installation and stop motion animation as part of her studio practice. Born and raised in Tehran, Iran, she received her BFA from University of Art in Tehran, and she got her Master of Fine Arts at Maine College of Art in Portland, Maine, U.S.A. She has exhibited in solo and group exhibitions in Tehran, Iran and United States of America.

Mixed media is Golaleh’s language. She is inspired by the theater and incorporates video, sculpture and performance in her work.

Growing up in a conservative society with a dictatorial climate was a major influence on Golaleh’s studio practice. In her work; Golaleh talks about the suppression forced upon her family as a consequence of politics and cultural conditions. Her focus is on the emotional effects of suppression and how it is passed down from one generation to the other. She describes how this suppression has became a social identity: “ I believe members of a suppressed society are victims of repressions forced upon them by the community and without noticing it, they become suppressors to the next generations.”

Joseph Gurka

Joseph Gurka was born in Roselle, NJ. He grew up navigating the neglected creek behind his childhood house collecting objects of interest that would call out to him. He would spend weekends frequenting scrap yards with his father when he wasn’t retreating to sparsely forested areas with friends or the occasional retreat to shore points. These experiences gave Joseph Gurka a penchant for objects that operated as time capsules, as well as a connection to natural environments.

Joseph Gurka is primarily known for his sculptural and site-responsive installation works that take on the form of micro-environments. He creates situations for the viewer to become more aware of their body in time and space. He received his Bachelor in Fine Arts from Humboldt State University, Arcata, CA and his Master of Fine Arts in Studio at Maine College of Art, Portland, ME. He has exhibited his work throughout the United States and Europe. He will be attending an artist residency at School of the Alternative in Black Mountain, NC this summer. He lives and works in Portland, Maine.

Risk and Challenges

We need to raise a minimum of $5000 to get this project off the ground. We are considering to push the date back—within reason—until our target goal is met.​

The other challenging part of this project is to ship all the artworks from Iran to the United States. Issues with timing, shipping, and the safety of the artwork over its long journey to the States is both challenging and expensive. This is the reason that we need your support because it will able us to make sure that the artworks are in good hands and they are shipped in safe conditions with care. We are dedicated to this project and look forward to sharing it with you.

Please contact us with any question or concern. 

Other Ways You Can Help

The most important help is to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!!

He has exhibited his work throughout the United States and Europe. He will be attending an artist residency at School of the Alternative in Black Mountain, NC this summer. He lives and works in Portland, Maine.Risk and ChallengesWe need to raise a minimum of $5000 to get this project off the ground. We are considering to push the date back—within reason—until our target goal is met.​The other challenging part of this project is to ship all the artworks from Iran to the United States. Issues with timing, shipping, and the safety of the artwork over its long journey to the States is both challenging and expensive. This is the reason that we need your support because it will able us to make sure that the artworks are in good hands and they are shipped in safe conditions with care. We are dedicated to this project and look forward to sharing it with you.Please contact us with any question or concern. Other Ways You Can HelpThe most important help is to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!!

story:
About the pins

  • Soft enamel with an epoxy coating, making them smooth and shiny
  • Rose gold metal plating
  • Sized 30 mm x 30 mm 
  • Butterfly clasp backing

About the stickers

  • Durable, high quality, waterproof sticker paper
  • Holographic, glitter finish
  • Custom die cut shape
  • Sized 2.5 in x 2.5 in 

Which Pride flags are available?

Enamel pins are available in lesbian, rainbow, or bi colors. Stickers are available in lesbian, rainbow, bi, trans, and pan colors. If you'd like stickers in other pride colors, message me and I can make it happen!

Who am I?

I'm a graphic designer with 8 years of professional experience and have successfully completed 3 crowd fundraisers to produce enamel pins. 

Stretch Goals

  • If the campaign reaches $600 I'll make pan pride pins too!

story:
Hi Indiegogo crew!!! We are a couple from Romania and we're making an unique style of wooden furniture and handcraft.



Our project is all about creativity, giving birth to something new and unique, designed and built to last a lifetime. Each piece is handcrafted in Romania, using only new and reclaimed wood. We are making wood burning paintings as well using reclaimed wood and fiberboard. 




We want to raise money to build a workshop (now we are working in our yard, but everything depends on weather and this is making our job harder), to buy better tools and materials and to make us known worldwide. Bellow you have a picture with our workspace. :)



This project will help us very much and will mean the most for us, because we try to give good vibration in every home through our creations.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us with money, but you like our campaign, spread the world, by share this on Facebook, Instagram , Twitter etc, and email it to your friends and family! And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out. Please help us reach our goal!

story:
THE BASICS

Clockwork Creatures will be at least 100 pages long, featuring numerous original illustrations both new and old, a selection of illustrations created in partnership with our Conservation Partners, as well as commissions and suggestions from backers like you! The core rewards are the books and the commissions. We’re looking to raise $3,500 to cover printing costs. A grant from the Indiana Arts Commission has helped to support the hundreds of hours of illustrations that have already gone into making this book. After platform fees, 10% of all funds raised by this campaign go to help our Conservation Partners' life-saving work they do for real-life creatures in need!

 

THE BOOKS

Clockwork Creatures is a lustrous book destined for a favored place on your shelf or coffee table. Wrapped in soft faux leather with beautiful brass-style corner hardware, it comes with your choice of blind or gold foil stamp. With 70 interior pages and measuring in at 10"x10", you will not only enjoy reading it yourself, but will want to share this tactile and visual experience with your guests! Every copy comes signed and numbered.

Guaranteed delivery in time for Christmas.

 

COMMISSIONS

Our campaign is offering the opportunity to get fabulous, unique illustrations in the book. Backers are able to select one of their favorite animals – including mythical creatures! Your animal of choice will be illustrated in this unique style, as a clanking, steaming clockwork critter and included in the book.

Backers are also able commission their individual pets! By supplying our team with photos of their favorite furry (or scaley, or feathery, or otherwise marvelous) friends, you can watch them transform into a mechanical companion inside the book.

The Core Illustration List

Anaconda
Angler Fish
Ankylosaurus
Antelope
Barn Owl
Bat
Bearded Dragon
Bison
Boar
Brown Bear
Butterfly
Camel
Centaur
Cerberus
Chameleon
Chimera
Cobra
Coelacanth
Crab
Crane
Crocodile
Crow
Dog (Generic)
Dolphin
Eagle
Elephant
Falcon
Fennec Fox
Flamingo
Giraffe
Gorilla
Hare
Hedgehog
Horse
Hyena
Kangaroo
Koala
Lion Fish
Llama
Manatee
Manta Ray
Mollusk
Moose
Orangutan
Panther
Penguin
Peryton
Platypus
Polar Bear
Porcupine
Puffer Fish
Pug
Rabbit
Rhino
Sabretooth Tiger
Scorpion
Sea Turtle
Shark
Sleipnir
Sloth
Squirrel
Stag
Stag Beetle
Tarantula
Tiger
Tortoise
Toucan
Tree Frog
Triceratops
Unicorn
Vulture
Walrus
Water Buffalo


 

RESCUE & CONSERVATION EFFORTS

The only reason you need to help someone is that you can. With that in mind, I wanted to find a way to help animals as a part of this book. I have partnered with a handful of really fantastic not-for-profits that are doing great work for animals across America.

10% of funds raised by this campaign (after platform fees) will be donated to our Not-For-Profit partners. We are also putting in a custom mural at Indy Humane to help beautify their facility and create wonderful memories for new pet adopters!

It is my hope to use this campaign to share the mission of our Not-For-Profit partners with a wider audience and bolster support through outreach and community awareness. I'll be including illustrations and stories in Clockwork Creatures inspired by the work being done by each of these groups.

To help spread awareness about the incredible work these organizations do, a section at the back of the book will be reserved for stories and images about the real world rescues. Fans will be able to see both the steampunk versions and the real animals that inspired them!

Indy Humane Society

The Humane Society of Indianapolis (casually known as IndyHumane) is a household name for animal lovers in the Circle City. Providing a wide suite of services to the community, HSI is a pillar of the community and a boon to every stray, pet, foster and animal lover in the city. Whether it is their foster program, their adoption center, the low-cost vaccine clinic, or the low-cost spay and neuter program, they’re here to help our furry friends, big and small. My own pup is a “foster failure” from their halls and I cannot sing their praises loudly enough.

IndyHumane Mural Project

As part of the community engagement behind the project, I'll be painting a mural in one of the entry areas at IndyHumane. Organizers are excited to have a place for adopters to take photos with their furry new family members! The project will be completed during the campaign's run time, so be sure to watch the Updates section to see progress on the selection process and mural completion.

 

Natchitoches Humane Society - "Happy Tails"

The Happy Tails program in Natchitoches Parish, Louisiana, was founded in 2008 with the vision of creating a no-kill shelter that would rehabilitate abused and abandoned animals to ultimately transport them out of the area and into their forever homes. Located on the Parish’s Detention Center grounds, the Happy Tails program works with correctional labor to help care for their many needy charges. By helping to care for and look after the animals, inmates make great strides towards rehabilitation and reintegration. The Happy Tails program has been recognized by the Governor’s Animal Welfare Commission, and recommended as a prototype for other programs within the state.

 

On Wings Of Care

On Wings Of Care is a truly incredible organization. A network of pilots, veterinarians, and plenty of folks in between, OWOC provides rescue and relief assistance all across the country. From flying animals from high-kill shelters in the Southern US to forever homes across the country and in Canada, to ecological surveys and even humanitarian missions, the scope of their love is just so impressive. It is hard to know where to start, given just how much incredible work they've done. OWOC also works to prevent illegal poaching of whales, and research assistance with great white sharks and elephant seals in Baja, Mexico. As part of their ocean conservation work, they've documented damage of oil spills and other ecological disasters in the Gulf of Mexico. They've aided veterinarians in Galapagos with rescueing, raising, and releasing small mammals and birds, and transported supplies and doctors to people in need from Alabama to Tibet!

 

 

Risks and challenges

The risks with a project like this are fairly minimal. I'm working with a factory in China to produce these books, and we've used them for several projects successfully in the past (Young Puffin's Wonderfully Grand Mystery, Ani and The Grumbull). I've run multiple successful Kickstarter campaigns (The Chronicles of Cornelius Cross, Young Puffin's Wonderfully Grand Mystery, CaveGeek's Zodiac Constellation Maps) and have experience with managing fulfillment. I've also tested out shipping options with the United States Postal Service to ensure that our quoted shipping rates will cover the necessary postage.

The most likely cause of any potential delays are related to my labor as the illustrator, or vendor issues. Vendors have already been selected for all items included as rewards or materials that will be made into rewards, but unexpected supply line issues are always possible. Having worked on numerous books before, I have lots of relevant experience to make sure this project moves along swiftly to completion. The very solid foundation of illustrations is already almost done, and will certainly be complete by the time this campaign's funding period ends. Depending on the popularity of the campaign and the number of additional illustrations required, there may be some delays, but having the body of the book already completed makes this a very minor concern.

The steam is hot...

Engines are firing up. Gears are turning. Pistons pumping. It's time to get started! Pledge for your copy of Clockwork Creatures today!

story:
(details in English below)

De quoi s'agit-il?

Ce projet a pour but de promouvoir la marche méditative ainsi que ses bienfaits par l'aménagement d'un labyrinthe classique (unicursale) dans le parc de la Voie maritime à Saint-Lambert sur la Rive-Sud de Montréal. 

L'idée a pris son envol il y a un an avec la rencontre de Noelle Fraser (instigatrice) et feu Josée Lafrenière (architecte paysagiste et visionnaire). Depuis, nous avons parcouru un chemin sinueux et articulé mais toujours vers le but, tout comme le chemin d'un labyrinthe! Nous voici maintenant un OSBL avec 4 administrateurs bénévoles, ainsi qu'une équipe de personnes-ressources talentueuses, qui s'engagent à construire dans le parc de la Voie maritime, un espace paisible et avant-gardiste vis-à-vis la santé et le bien-être.

De gauche à droite: Denyse Verret (Directrice du pavillon Saint-Lambert au Collège Durocher Saint-Lambert), Noelle Fraser (propriétaire de Yoga-B studio boutique), Marie-Claude Roulier (gestionnaire chez LeChasseur avocats) et Claude Portelance (propriétaire de la boutique Terre Essences).

Pourquoi?

Les labyrinthes classiques sont reconnus pour leur conception simple, mais irrésistible, qui attire les gens de tous âges. Par opposition à un labyrinthe «contemporain» («maze» en anglais) qui est conçu comme un casse-tête dans lequel on se perd parmi les différentes voies possibles, le labyrinthe classique propose un seul chemin à suivre pour se rendre au centre du parcours. Ce genre de parcours méditatif existe depuis 4000 ans et connaît en ce moment un regain d'intérêt grâce aux effets thérapeutiques de l'emprunt de son chemin. Parmi les bienfaits de la marche méditative on trouve: la réduction de la tension artérielle, le ralentissement du rythme respiratoire, la diminution de la douleur chronique et la promotion générale d'un sentiment de bien-être. 

«Nous reconnaissons la valeur qu’un labyrinthe classique peut apporter à la communauté de Saint-Lambert», dit le maire de Saint-Lambert, Alain Dépatie. «L’originalité de ce projet nous a séduits car nous croyons que le Labyrinthe a aussi le potentiel de devenir une destination qui permettra à Saint-Lambert de rayonner au-delà de ses frontières», rajoute-t-il.

Où?

La municipalité de Saint-Lambert a généreusement offert un superbe emplacement et a accepté de s'occuper entièrement de l'entretien du labyrinthe une fois construit. Voici un montage de deux photos du site du futur labyrinthe dans le parc de la Voie maritime sur la Rive-Sud de Montréal:

Voici une esquisse du futur labyrinthe (le design final pourrait varier en fonction du budget et de l'approbation de la Ville):

Les animations suivantes illustrent la découverte progressive du futur labyrinthe:


Comment?

Il est important de préciser que cet endroit distinctif et même magique ne sera pas aménagé sans votre appui, quel qu'il soit. 

Une fois l'objectif de financement atteint, nous visons le printemps 2016 pour le début des travaux d'aménagement. Notre équipe d'experts paysagistes étant déjà en place, il ne reste que votre contribution pour procéder à la construction.

Qui?

Nous sommes privilégiés de compter parmi nos partenaires jusqu'à présent:

  • Ville de Saint-Lambert
  • Collège Durocher Saint-Lambert
  • Fondation Eulalie Durocher
  • LeChasseur, avocats
  • Terre Essences
  • Groupe Marchand Design
  • Yoga-B studio boutique

  • et vous!

D'autres façons d'aider

  • Faire passer le mot pour faire connaître le projet de construire un labyrinthe classique aux abords du Saint-Laurent
  • Partager cette page Indiegogo dans vos réseaux, que cela soit par courriel, Facebook ou Twitter !

Labyrinthes inspirants

Voici quelques beaux exemples de projets de labyrinthe classique tel que nous proposons:

À Trinity Square Park à Toronto


Le labyrinthe de l'Armenian Heritage Park à Boston, MA

Labyrinthe chez Maggie's Cancer Caring Centre, Dundee, Royaume-Uni


MERCI!


(fin version française)
____________________________________________________________________________

Classical Labyrinth on the Shores of the Saint Lawrence

Be a part of this one of a kind project in the Greater Montreal Region!

What?

The goal of this project is to promote meditative walking and the health benefits of this activity by building a unicursal labyrinth in Saint-Lambert's Seaway Park, on the South Shore of Montreal. 

The idea to build a labyrinth really took off when Noelle Fraser (project initiator) and the late Josée Lafrenière (landscape architect and visionary) joined forces about a year ago. Since then the road has been winding but always in the right direction, just like the path of the labyrinth! Now a non-profit organization with 4 volunteer administrators as well as a team of talented collaborators, Labyrinthe Saint-Lambert  is committed to building this peaceful, avant-garde space dedicated to health and wellness.

From left to right: Denyse Verret (Saint-Lambert Pavilion Director, Durocher College, Saint-Lambert), Noelle Fraser (Owner of yoga-B, studio boutique), Marie-Claude Roulier (Administrator at LeChasseur, Law Firm) and Claude Portelance (Owner of Terre Essences, boutique).  

Why?

The simple but irresistible design of a labyrinth attracts people of all ages. Sometimes confused with a “maze”, a puzzle in which one loses oneself in a series pathways and dead-ends, a unicursal labyrinth has but one path to follow to the centre. This kind of labyrinth has existed for 4000 years and is receiving renewed interest worldwide due to the therapeutic benefits of following its path. The long term health benefits of meditative walking include lower blood pressure and breathing rates, reduced incidents of chronic pain, reduction of insomnia, improved fertility and can promote a general sense of well-being.

“We realize the value that a traditional labyrinth can bring to the community of Saint-Lambert,” says mayor Alain Dépatie. “The originality of the project is also very appealing as we believe that a labyrinth has the potential to become a destination and as such, will attract visitors from a wide number of regions,” he adds.

Where?

The city of Saint-Lambert has generously offered a perfect location for the labyrinth, and has agreed to take responsibility for its upkeep once built. Shown in the two photos below is the site of the future labyrinth in Seaway Park on the South Shore of Montreal:


Below is an illustration of the labyrinth (the final design may vary, depending on the budget and city approval):


The following animations illustrate the unfolding of the future labyrinth:  


How?

It is important to emphasize that this distinctive and magical space will not be created without your support – every donation counts! 

Once we reach our financial goal, we intend to begin construction of the labyrinth in Spring, 2016. Our team of landscaping experts is ready to go – all that remains is your contribution!

Who?

We are very pleased to be associated with the following partners:

  • City of Saint-Lambert
  • Durocher College, Saint-Lambert
  • Eulalie Durocher Foundation
  • LeChasseur, Law Firm
  • Terre Essences
  • Marchand Design Group
  • Yoga-B studio boutique

  • and you!

Other ways to help

  • Spread the word - let people know about this project!
  • Share this indiegogo page with your contacts and on your preferred social networks such as Facebook or Twitter!

Sources of Inspiration

Here are some compelling examples of unicursal labyrinths, similar to the one proposed for this project:


Toronto's Public Labyrinth in Trinity Square Park


Armenian Heritage Park Labyrinth in Boston, MA


The labyrinth at Maggie's Cancer Caring Centre, Dundee, United Kingdom

Thank you!
