Une fois l'objectif de financement atteint, nous visons le printemps 2016 pour le début des travaux d'aménagement. Notre équipe d'experts paysagistes étant déjà en place, il ne reste que votre contribution pour procéder à la construction.
Qui?
Nous sommes privilégiés de compter parmi nos partenaires jusqu'à présent:


Ville de Saint-Lambert
Collège Durocher Saint-Lambert
Fondation Eulalie Durocher
LeChasseur, avocats
Terre Essences
Groupe Marchand Design
Yoga-B studio boutique


et vous!

D'autres façons d'aider

Faire passer le mot pour faire connaître le projet de construire un labyrinthe classique aux abords du Saint-Laurent
Partager cette page Indiegogo dans vos réseaux, que cela soit par courriel, Facebook ou Twitter !

Labyrinthes inspirants
Voici quelques beaux exemples de projets de labyrinthe classique tel que nous proposons:

À Trinity Square Park à Toronto
Le labyrinthe de l'Armenian Heritage Park à Boston, MALabyrinthe chez Maggie's Cancer Caring Centre, Dundee, Royaume-Uni
MERCI!(fin version française)____________________________________________________________________________

Classical Labyrinth on the Shores of the Saint Lawrence
Be a part of this one of a kind project in the Greater Montreal Region!

What?



The goal of this project is to promote meditative walking and the health
benefits of this activity by building a unicursal labyrinth in
Saint-Lambert's Seaway Park, on the South Shore of Montreal. 
The
idea to build a labyrinth really took off when Noelle Fraser (project
initiator) and the late Josée Lafrenière (landscape architect and
visionary) joined forces about a year ago. Since then the road has
been winding but always in the right direction, just like the path of
the labyrinth! Now a non-profit organization with 4 volunteer
administrators as well as a team of talented collaborators, Labyrinthe Saint-Lambert  is committed to building
this peaceful, avant-garde space dedicated to health and wellness.


From left to right: Denyse Verret (Saint-Lambert Pavilion Director, Durocher College, Saint-Lambert), Noelle Fraser (Owner of yoga-B, studio boutique), Marie-Claude Roulier (Administrator at LeChasseur, Law Firm) and Claude Portelance (Owner of Terre Essences, boutique).  
Why?


The
simple but irresistible design of a labyrinth attracts people of all
ages. Sometimes confused with a “maze”, a puzzle in which one
loses oneself in a series pathways and dead-ends, a unicursal
labyrinth has but one path to follow to the centre. This kind of
labyrinth has existed for 4000 years and is receiving renewed
interest worldwide due to the therapeutic benefits of following its
path. The long term health benefits of meditative walking include
lower blood pressure and breathing rates, reduced
incidents of chronic pain, reduction of insomnia, improved fertility
and can promote a general sense of
well-being. 



“We
realize the value that a traditional labyrinth can bring to the
community of Saint-Lambert,” says mayor Alain Dépatie. “The originality of the project is also very
appealing as we believe that a labyrinth has the potential to become
a destination and as such, will attract visitors from a wide number
of regions,” he adds.


Where?


The
city of Saint-Lambert has generously offered a perfect location for
the labyrinth, and has agreed to take responsibility for its upkeep once
built. Shown in the two photos below is the site of the future
labyrinth in Seaway Park on the South Shore of Montreal:

Below is an illustration of the labyrinth (the final design may vary, depending on the budget and city approval):

The following animations illustrate the unfolding of the future labyrinth:  



How?


It is
important to emphasize that this distinctive and magical space will
not be created without your support – every donation counts! 


Once we
reach our financial goal, we intend to begin construction of the
labyrinth in Spring, 2016. Our team of landscaping experts is ready
to go – all that remains is your contribution!


Who?


We are
very pleased to be associated with the following partners:




City of Saint-Lambert
Durocher College, Saint-Lambert
Eulalie Durocher Foundation
LeChasseur, Law Firm
Terre Essences
Marchand Design Group
Yoga-B studio boutique


and you!

Other ways to help

Spread the word - let people know about this project!
Share this indiegogo page with your contacts and on your preferred social networks such as Facebook or Twitter!

Sources of Inspiration
Here are some compelling examples of unicursal labyrinths, similar to the one
proposed for this project:

Toronto's Public Labyrinth in Trinity Square Park

Armenian Heritage Park Labyrinth in Boston, MA

The labyrinth at Maggie's Cancer Caring Centre, Dundee, United Kingdom

Thank you!

story:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

As featured on Comedy Central's '@midnight' (our campaign mentioned at 6:26) and the New York Observer!


There's still plenty of time left to donate SO DONATE. Any amount--even $1, less if Indiegogo let you do that--helps. And we use FIXED FUNDING (woah!). If we aren't funded, you get your money back.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The Need to See Ted Cruz as a Dick

How many nights have you paced the floor, sleep refusing to come to your eyes, tortured by one question: how can I get Ted Cruz's face on a thick ol' dildo?


Well tonight you can ease your troubled mind, for peace has come. After four months of intensive work, our rag-tag team of designers has finally placed Ted Cruz's smug gaze at the tip of a dildo.



We've spared no detail. A subtle curvature of the shaft, firm testicles, confident smirk, a "Come and Take It" lapel pin (a lapel pin Ted has been known to wear; it's an allusion to an old Texas flag)--it's all there.

We love the results, you love the results, and we just want everybody to finally be able to grasp Ted by the shaft.

From Dream to Dildo: What We Need From You

While we have the design, getting actual silicone dildos made was more expensive than we imagined. Right now we have a completed 3d printer model in .stl format; what we still need to do is:

  • Get a prototype produced
  • Create a mold
  • Have a manufacturer use the mold to produce as many Ted Cruz dildos as possible
  • Package and ship the Ted Cruz dildos

Based on our existing cost estimates, we expect funds will be spent as follows:



If we surpass our goal, all funds will go towards:

  1. Producing more Ted Cruz dildos
  2. Creating customized packaging
  3. Allowing for customized dildo orders

Make Ted Cruz a Dick, Change the World

His college roommates call him "abrasive", "arrogant", and "creepy." His classmates remember him as a "college debate prick." Fellow Republicans have claimed he shows a "smug arrogance" and say he's "off-putting", "unlikeable" and "annoying". In other words, Ted Cruz is a.... well, you get it.

What's more, the people who know Cruz from college say that humor was the one thing that would "unravel him" and completely throw him off course.

What better way to satirize Cruz's political career than by making the most long-lasting legacy of his presidential campaign the transformation of Ted Cruz into a literal dick.

Shout it From the Rooftops: Ted Cruz is a Dick!

Regardless of what you are able to contribute, tell your friends and spread the word: Ted Cruz is becoming a dick, and it's happening any day now.

Show them our Facebook or Twitter.

Let them know that over 50,000 years of human history have worked to make Ted Cruz a dildo.

story:
I've been dreaming about and planning this project for years: I want to make a difference in the world and I want to do it with my existing set of skills and strengths: I am an artist; I have spent my life building community in the art; I have an easy time connecting with people; I have loved motorcycles since I was 8 years old. I decided to combine all of that and make it the basis of my new adventure. 

It seems to me that fear and prejudice have been growing in the past few years, and after thinking about this a lot, I realized that I truly, sincerely believe that making personal connections worldwide is the solution. It is a powerful way to contribute to a better world, and it is already "here": I have the skills right now, I don't have to go get another degree or look outside. It is here, now, inside of me: I can travel, listen to people's stories, record them, share my experience, do art, and basically engage deeply with the world I live in and am a part of. 

Because my main objective is to connect with people, I became a member of Servas (www.servas.org), MotoStays (www.motostays.com), and couchsurfing, so that in addition to camping, I will stay with those organizations' hosts to deepen my understanding of their culture and daily lives.

My plan is sell my artwork in order to raise funds to defray my traveling expenses. These include international health and vehicle insurances, motorcycle, food, fuel, plane ticket, campgrounds' fees, etc. Print subscriptions are based on the principle that I sell prints now and create them after I come back from my trip. This is an opportunity for participants to expand their collection of art in an affordable way, and become not only partners in my new adventures but an active link in the web of human connections that I am creating. 

My friends and supporters will benefit in several ways: they will receive an original art piece (delivery date: October 2017), regular blog update alerts by email, and access to my blog and posts. In short, they will be exposed to a "real life" account of our world: they will hear real stories about real people. 

How do I know I can do this? I have done it before! In my twenties, I traveled around the world for eighteen months using local transportation and hitchhiking (with a few plane rides in-between!). In the past twenty five years, I founded and managed four businesses: my career as an artist which, in addition to Seattle, has taken me to Switzerland, Mexico, Nigeria and China, to exhibit my art and teach printmaking at local universities; the Sev Shoon Arts Center, a professional printmaking studio with 24/7 access, classes, workshops, exhibits, and an international artist-in-residence; BallardWorks, a large artists' studio building with exhibition space and a vibrant community of talented artists; and now 4Art&Adventure to pursue my vision of a better world.

story:
EXPAND MY CREATVE BANNER AND WALLPAPER

I had a lot of fun when i'm Drawing some objets especially Banner and wallpaper objects. I have shared many free wallpaper and banner on many sites. I want to create some of Premium Wallpaper which is i create customized object request by member. I will begin with this Campaign, when people enjoyed my art and appreciate my art, i will continue to expand my site as well.

WE ARE BALI ART COMMUNITY IV

BCAC and Gallery were blessed with a visit from Tanya this month, a psychologist who applies art therapy mainly with children from 10 years old to adolescence. She came to BCAC to increase her knowledge in this field and to extend her own artistic creativity.

Her work with color is some of the best we've seen here from students at BCAC, and we hope to see her again soon to continue her own self improvement and expansion of her artistic knowledge.

If you are interested in joining BCAC & Gallery for a course, please feel free to get in touch where we can talk through your goals and tailor a course specifically for you.


WHERE GOES FUNDS AND CONTRIBUTION WILL GOES...

Bali Center for Artistic Creativity offers classes, courses, workshops, seminars and instruction to individuals and groups interested in discovering, experimenting, developing or extending their artistic creative talents and skills.
People come to BCAC from a wide variety of backgrounds, professions and occupations.  All Funds will distribute to our activities and build more facility to growth our community and present great art to people.
We also work regularly with International School groups and Local Charities.

story:
Bonjour à tous!
Je me présente , Stéphane ,artiste peintre en aérographie ,alias S'Design Aéro!

Je suis ici car après quelques années à me perfectionner dans le domaine de l'aérographie et de la carrosserie moto entre autre ,j'ai décidé de créer une structure plus professionnelle en ouvrant mon atelier pour être en mesure de répondre aux attentes des professionnels qui font appel à moi en plus des particuliers. Le nom de cette entreprise :     "L'Atelier By S'Design"

J'exerce mon "art" sur différents types de supports tel que les camions , casques , véhicules en tout genre ,trompes l'oeil ,murs de chambres ou de commerces etc... mais l'essentiel de mon activité gravite cependant autour du monde de la moto qui est ma passion. Vous pouvez retrouver mes réalisations sur mon site www.sdesignaero.com .



Je peins maintenant depuis une dizaine d'années suite à un accident de la route m'ayant contraint à abandonner mon métier de grutier et me suis fait au fil des années un nom et une réputation dans ce milieu. De ce fait je suis sollicité par de plus en plus de professionnels et je dois m'équiper dans des locaux plus grands que mon petit garage et également investir dans des équipements plus adéquats à une production plus importante que celle que j'avais quand j'exerçais pour mon plaisir en tant qu'artiste. 


J'ai donc trouvé un local assez grand pour pouvoir travailler sur tous ces supports dans de bonnes conditions avec l'installation d'une cabine de peinture et d'aménagements plus adaptés. Ce local est situé sur la commune de Venelles juste à côté d'aix en provence , commune où le potentiel de clientèle est conséquent et où personne ne propose ce que je fais.

J'ai également déjà un bon potentiel clientèle sur avignon , à quelques dizaines de minutes par l'autoroute.


Ce prêt participatif à donc pour but de me servir d'apport conséquent pour le compléter avec un prêt bancaire ,mais si je n'arrive pas à obtenir la totalité de la somme il sera déjà un atout de taille auprès des banques.

J'estime mon besoin de financement global (prêt participatif + prêt bancaire) à 40.000 euros . Somme nécessaire à l'acquisition du local, l'achat d'une cabine de peinture professionnelle, d'un plus gros compresseur, d'un véhicule utilitaire, de quelques mobiliers, ainsi qu'à une trésorerie pour mon besoin en fond de roulement (BFR).

Je vous remercie déjà pour m'avoir lu jusque là car si il est facile de parler de son projet quand il nous passionne il est plus difficile de le poser ici en quelques lignes sans que cela ne soit trop..lourd, et en étant assez explicite. 

Beaucoup de gens pensent à tort qu'il s'agit d'un hobby quand on leur parle d'aérographie mais il s'agit bel et bien d'un métier avec une réelle clientèle et un nombre de possibilités d'applications très vaste. Que ce soit de la simple déco sur un casque ou une moto à un portait sur un camion ,en passant par les véhicules publicitaires ou les aménagement intérieurs d'établissements comme les restaurants, les boites de nuits, les pubs etc. etc..... 

J'ai tenté l'expérience il y a quelques années en m'installant dans un petit village (loyer plus abordable) et avec mes petits moyens techniques... J'ai vite comprit que si nous ne sommes pas proche de la clientèle et que nous n'avons pas l'équipement adéquat nous ne pouvons tenir la distance . Il faut se donner les moyens d'être VISIBLE et PRODUCTIF . Donc j'ai arrêté ... J'ai peaufiné mon art et étoffé mon carnet d'adresse tout en me faisant un nom et aujourd'hui j'ai un site internet ( www.sdesignaero.com ) très complet . Et quand je me présente devant un professionnel ou qu'un particulier me contact il me prend au sérieux et peut constater que je connais particulièrement bien mon sujet et qu'il me passionne .

Donc pour conclure ,si vous décidez de contribuer à la réalisation de mon entreprise , vous me permettrez de vivre de ma passion en concrétisant les rêves de mes clients et en réalisant des oeuvres d'art roulantes (ou pas) qui égaieront les routes que vous empruntez peut-être chaque jour! Quoi de plus sympa quand on roule que de croiser un camion avec une superbe peinture personnalisée pleine de couleurs et de détails !!! Et ce n'est là qu'un exemple bien sûre... 

Voilà ,je crois en mon projet et de nombreux professionnels également et ils me soutiennent en ce sens donc si vous aussi vous y croyez , vous pouvez faire partie de l'aventure ou en parler à vos proches ou à vos collègues, partagez via facebook ou tout autre réseau social!

Et pensez à ceci : En matière d'impôt ,vous pourrez en déduire une partie, je cite :"Si le don se réalise avec une contrepartie (en nature par exemple), la valeur de cette dernière ne doit pas dépasser un quart (25 %) du montant du don". 

Merci encore de m'avoir prêté attention et peut être à très bientôt!

Stéphane.

story:
Chartiers Creek Creative began in early 2018 as an art studio that was born in my one-car garage where family and friends would join me for classes, and quickly expanded to my family room, as friends brought their friends.

My experiences with art led me to understand the value of this most precious activity, and research supports my assumptions. Art can have a profound effect on people’s moods, and it can help with a variety of emotional problems as well as memory and medical issues. Art is as important for seniors and veterans as it is for kids, and the simple truth is, doing art feels good for everyone.

After a violent racist attack at the local high school in late 2018, I realized that tensions are not only simmering across the country, but also right here in my neighborhood. Something needed to be done to help unify our community, and I knew that "something" was art. National research conducted by the Americans for the Arts in 2018 indicates that art lifts us up as individuals, and it also helps us bridge divides. Engaging in art inspires us to work with and help others in meaningful ways, even those who are different from ourselves. With this in mind, the core programming at Chartiers Creek Creative was designed for a wide range demographics and art abilities, and about a year and half after the first class in my garage, we grew into 800 sq. ft. of industrial space to also become an art gallery & community art center. 

The mission of Chartiers Creek Creative is to engage, nurture and showcase creative activities and art as a way to unify our community, while at the same time empowering local artists.

I dedicated Chartiers Creek Creative to the memory of my sister Cherie who passed away in 2011, and and made a splash in Scott Park with a free event in September, 2019. After that, and after months of waiting for our new studio space to be ready, our grand opening was set for April 3, 2020. However, due to COVID, our state closed all non-essential businesses on March 21st.

DURING SHUTDOWN

I offered Kindness Art Kits from my front lawn as free gifts for anyone passing by. The idea was to paint a rock with an uplifting message, then give it to someone else. I also shared the kits with essential workers throughout the area. In all, I gave away about 600 art kits. I like to think of this as "multi-level kindness."

A reopening in June resulted in a new shutdown in July. Like many businesses, the year has been an exhausting roller coaster of frustration from a deadly pandemic that the world has yet to conquer. However, with vaccines coming, we believe the end is in sight. In the meantime, though, we are struggling to stay put in our location with limited (or no) classes, while at the same time recognizing that people are suffering through this pandemic in isolation with depression and loneliness. They need our services now more than ever. To reach out to the community during this last phase of the pandemic will require retooling our classes to an online format, updating our supplies for distribution and advertising the classes throughout the area.

WHY WE NEED YOU RIGHT NOW

While much of the business has already been developed, we need your help to stay put until it is safe to fully open to capacity, to adapt to online classes and to advertise our services. Rent and advertising expenses are estimated to be $4.500 - 5,000.  Our reach goal is $8,000, which would:

  • Finance the next 6 months of rent
  • Pay for marketing and advertising materials and fees to alert the community to our programs
  • Cover the costs of retooling our programs for online adaptation and procuring supplies needed for distribution, including paying staff

Funds raised will allow us to survive the pandemic intact, and help us adapt to online classes when the community needs our services most.

Please join us in supporting the community through the art activities provided by Chartiers Creek Creative.

Thank you SO much for your support and for reading this to the end!  Please get in touch if you have any questions or would like to help make Chartiers Creek Creative a meaningful, sustainable part of our community. For other ways to get involved, visit www.ChartiersCreekCreative.com . 

Be safe!

Sincerely,
Leann Schmidt

References:

  • https://www.chartierscreekcreative.com/art-for-wellness/
  • https://www.wtae.com/article/collier-township-police-file-charges-after-bathroom-fight-at-chartiers-valley-high-school/25658149
  • https://www.americansforthearts.org/news-room/press-releases/americans-speak-out-about-the-arts-in-new-public-opinion-poll 
  • https://www.chartierscreekcreative.com/why-this-community/
story_txt:
Chartiers Creek Creative began in early 2018 as an art studio that was born in my one-car garage where family and friends would join me for classes, and quickly expanded to my family room, as friends brought their friends.My experiences with art led me to understand the value of this most precious activity, and research supports my assumptions. Art can have a profound effect on people’s moods, and it can help with a variety of emotional problems as well as memory and medical issues. Art is as important for seniors and veterans as it is for kids, and the simple truth is, doing art feels good for everyone.After a violent racist attack at the local high school in late 2018, I realized that tensions are not only simmering across the country, but also right here in my neighborhood. Something needed to be done to help unify our community, and I knew that "something" was art. National research conducted by the Americans for the Arts in 2018 indicates that art lifts us up as individuals, and it also helps us bridge divides. Engaging in art inspires us to work with and help others in meaningful ways, even those who are different from ourselves. With this in mind, the core programming at Chartiers Creek Creative was designed for a wide range demographics and art abilities, and about a year and half after the first class in my garage, we grew into 800 sq. ft. of industrial space to also become an art gallery & community art center. The mission of Chartiers Creek Creative is to engage, nurture and showcase creative activities and art as a way to unify our community, while at the same time empowering local artists.I dedicated Chartiers Creek Creative to the memory of my sister Cherie who passed away in 2011, and and made a splash in Scott Park with a free event in September, 2019. story:
Short Summary

Artisan is a collective of  fashion designers,  artists and performers, collaborating to give a platform to local artists and fashion brands.  The first event was held in 2019 in Singapore. 

  • In 2019 each brand & artist came together to create a unique artwork or performance 
  • Artisan 2020 could not go ahead due to the pandemic. All around the world many artists and local brands  and small businesses have suffered 
  • Fast forward to 2021 we've all had time to stop and consider many pressing issues. As a result www.artisansingapore.com seeks to draw attention to sustainability in the fashion industry
  • We are raising funds to commission 6 artists to host a physical exhibition
  • An interactive performance piece will also be commissioned to draw attention to how fashion affects the planet.
  • We are calling on visitors to take action regarding their consumption and reduce fashion's impact on the planet.
  • Visit www.artisansingapore.com to get a taste of the featured artists and their work

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your support to host a physical exhibition

  • To cover the cost of hiring a gallery, printing and hanging the work
  • Commission the performance artists
  • To promote the work through online advertising and PR

The Impact

Your contribution will help :

  • Support and promote Singapore's emerging artists giving them a chance to show their work 
  • Fostering collaboration and creative communities
  • Highlight our responsibility to consider our individual consumption patterns and the effect on the environment
  • Build on the success of Artisan 2019 which was hosted at Design Orchard, with  150 attendees across 2 days
  • Promote creativity in Singapore - the event was supported by  the Textile  & Fashion Federation and sponsored by Blackbird Production (Video)  Ideologi (Printers), TG Wines,  Esclusiva (Bakery).

Risks & Challenges

There are some risks associated with the endeavor and here's how we'll surmount them:

  • The continuing social distancing rules may make a physical event a challenge 
  • All social distancing rules will be adhered to and the relevant government agencies consulted

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out to friends and family who love art and fashion or even have sustainable mindset:

  • Like and follow us on Instagram @ARTISANSINGAPORE
  • Visit our Virtual Exhibition which you can access from our website
  • Share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family

story:
Short Summary

The Berwyn Public Art Initiative (BPAI), a community-driven initiative is seeking to revitalize Berwyn’s Historic Depot District through the public display of large art installations. The initiative seeks to use murals, sculptural objects, pop-up galleries, sidewalk planters, and artist live/work spaces to increase foot traffic, community pride, tourism, and business development in the under-utilized Depot District of Berwyn.

THE BPAI is made up of all volunteer community members, artists and business owners with a passion for BIG art and making BIG things happen in Berwyn. 

We know that we need a whole community behind us to really make an impact and we are always looking for more volunteers and contributors. The work we are doing in Berwyn now is going to last for generations to come and is already helping to spur activity in the Depot District.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Funding goes to pay artist expenses, equipment, insurance, and will contribute to future art installations in 2019. 

Contributors who make a donation have the opportunity to brag about their love of the arts with a BPAI lawn sign, t-shirt, button or mug. Because this campaign is spurred by a specific work, monstrous swag for contributors is coming soon. 

We certainly hope to reach our goal, but all funds will contribute to arts projects in the Berwyn community.

The Impact

We know that public art is going to impact the Berwyn community for years to come.

  • Spurs economic development
  • Encourages community pride
  • Creates opportunities for local artists

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Our efforts are fueled by our community through a desire to help spur the economic vitality of the Berwyn Depot District and larger Berwyn community. 

Join us! Visit our website to volunteer and help fund big art in Berwyn.  Share the great things happening in Berwyn - please share this campaign.

story:
WHAT IS IT?

We've designed the How to Draw: FIGURES sketchbook using an easy to follow along "phase-out" system that begins with lots of guidelines and as you progress through the sketchbook, the guidelines are simplified, reducing your dependency on those guidelines. We have also included some commonly used industry reference material along with 100+ sketch templates into the most popular and common Moleskine sketchbook form.

DETAILS AND SPECS

  • Compact and easy to carry with you wherever you go.
  • Dimensions: 9 x 11 x 0.75 inches
  • 100g white paper
  • use a pen, pencil, graphite, crayon, marker or whatever. Its a sketchbook!
  • fits on standard scanner bed so you can scan your sketches.

ITS WHATS INSIDE THAT MAKES US UNIQUE!

How to Draw: FIGURES will appeal to a wide range of artists, as the human form is something everyone can relate to.  Although its a complex mechanism, its something that we can easily break down into bite-sized parts.  By doing this, we feel anyone, at any age or any skill level can enjoy this sketchbook. 

THE TEMPLATES

The intrigue of this Sketchbook is that it gives you the ability to sketch alongside what you are learning. The guidelines help improve your understanding of proportion and perspective, but as the guides phase-out, your mind begins to learn whats missing, so you will eventually be able to draw without the need of any guidelines.  

Why are the guidelines Blue? 

By using non-photo blue lines, you can scan your sketch into Adobe Photoshop® and with minimal tweaking, the guidelines disappear leaving only your sketches behind.

Use the templates at the back of the book to make as many additional copies for your personal use.  That way, you can keep sketching and drawing till your hearts desire.

MEET THE TEAM

Mark Kokavec  graduated from the College for Creative Studies in 1997 and has been working in the athletic footwear industry ever since. He's worked for top major brands like New Balance, Converse/Nike and Under Armour.  He founded Render Demo which creates instructional design video tutorials along with sketchbooks.  

Joshua Fraser  graduated from Rhode Island School of Design in 1997. Has been in footwear design for over 20 years. Worked for Reebok US and Japan, Puma and had his own consultancy in Hong Kong. Currently works at Saucony Originals. First true love is illustration, and has been drawing and painting the human form since he was a kid.

Steve Sherrick has been working in the Film and Broadcast Television industry for 20 years. He is the owner of Sherrick Creative, LLC. which offers a wide palette of services for projects ranging from corporate video to feature films.  

Joe Napurano is an Industrial Designer and Educator with over 20 years of experience in the consumer product market.  Joe teaches Design at Rhode Island School of Design (RISD) and Wentworth Institute of Technology.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Manufacturing a product is a monumental feat. Every element is made by a different group of specialists; then we have to arrange for each of these elements to arrive at a manufacturer who then puts all the pieces together. Essentially, it's a task that involves a lot of scheduling, preparation, and care.

Our greatest challenge is to organize these elements for mass production. The different elements include (but are not limited to): artwork, cover material, end papers, quality paper stock, printing on the end papers, printing quality control, packaging, polywrap and shipping packaging.

Once the books are created then we have them delivered to us in Boston, MA where we will ship them to our customers all over the world.

story:
Overview       

My name is Angelo David Russo. I am a mixed media artist from Montreal and my objective is to develop an approach to modern portraiture that is collaborative and goes beyond traditional ideas of the portrait.

       The Four Question Project is an artistic exploration of breaking down the barriers that separate us, to open our minds to the perspectives of others, and find common ground on which we can connect in meaningful ways. It challenges the preconceptions that people often hold, and the quick judgments they make when meeting strangers.I am fascinated by the way the minds of others work and believe that this experience and process will be crucial to my evolution as an artist.  In engaging with ideas outside of art, into other fields, I’ve had the chance to think of my process more holistically.  With this particular project, I’m required to be vulnerable as my own answers to the Four Questions integrate myself into my art, and become public.

   Over the course of 12 Months (as of April 1st, 2020),  I will create a series of 15-20 portraits (each 24’’X 36’’), based on interviews that result from inviting strangers to share their stories with me by answering a series of Four Questions.

 

What is needed to launch this project

        Your support will not only help fund the materials to execute The Four Question Project to the fullest of its potential, but also it will provide me with the conviction to expand and develop future art projects of this nature.         

In order to execute a complete series of 15 to 20 thematic portraits, I am asking for $2500 CAD which will help me to purchase the materials required.

       If the goal is not met, the funds will still go towards the materials. The series itself will be smaller than anticipated, but the project will still be honored with the existing funding.   

      

The Impact    

      Social media connects us in the virtual world, yet in the real world, people are more disconnected than ever before. The Four Question project aims to highlight the stories of strangers, offering a different lens from which to view them. It is meant to reshape the way we perceive strangers and the way strangers perceive us in turn.  

     The base of my paintings is a collage, using newspapers, representing an amalgamation of stories, none of which are complete. Fragments of the phrases and words are visible, but much are obscured with paint, thus illegible. The figures in my artwork are fragmented, distorted and cracked. This represents the emotional and physical fragility of humans, in contrast with their resilience to overcome the hardships of life. 

      The use of masking tape/tape-resist technique, is my way of creating layers which give the illusion of the newsprint text being pushed further back, much like suppressed memories. The tape, when removed, rips parts of the newspaper, scarring the surface. Art is a way of bringing together pieces into a new whole.  My artwork has various components which reflects this idea, and the process of discovery of self and identity. 

Risks & Challenges

       I am attempting to develop a new language and approach to modern portraiture, integrating what I consider impactful from masterpieces in the past, within our modern framework.  This challenges me to think outside the box in a way that I have not done before. I want to develop new ways of working while finding a balance between experimental and guided approaches to creating. 

 

Thank you all for considering making a pledge to my campaign.

Please share with anyone who you feel will connect with this project!

Follow me on Instagram or Facebook for updates and time lapse videos

@angelorussoart 

My Facebook page

 

Angelo David Russo

story:
Everybody is born with a talent

But - Not everyone has the opportunity to Develop,  Demonstrate  and

Visualise their talent.

We are a pair of creative men, our story began when we opened a page on Facebook to share our creative abilities and thinking.

Our work initially focused on messages designed for self and society development. 

But - very quickly the page became very popular and attracted other creative people who approached us wanting to share their work and ideas on our pages.

We swiftly realized the need and hunger in Arab Society to express their talents on a worldwide stage and to find a platform to share creative work through expressing themselves openly and honestly. We observed their need for support and encouragement with this and decided to dedicate our page to be open for everybody with a talent.

As a result of this understanding and with the technical ability to satisfy the latent demand for creative outlet, we achieved success from the very first day.

Today, two years after the initial launch, and without any external investment, we are already by far the largest online stage in the Arab World with more than 580,000 followers and around 20,000 creative contributions in various fields such as painting, photography, design, writing, handwork, music and many more.

Our ability to offer exposure, provide encouragement, appreciation and development of their talents - gives them great hope. By providing a platform for Arab talent that is open to all, simple to access and completely free of charge we have unlocked tremendous potential across this vast audience.

Building hope for so many talented people has become a deeply moving experience and commitment for us – to be honest our work in this enterprise has  developed into a life purpose.

We hope that you too will become  a partner in building this unique, innovative and constructive online social platform for talented Arab people.

We encourage YOUR participation and hope you join us in sharing the rewards  to be gained from providing the moral, financial and material support and encouragement necessary to grow this exceptionally innovative enterprise to reach its full potential.

In short we ask you to join us on this amazing platform where the wide Arab audience can explore and share their fields of interest and consume the art they most love.

Your support will provide a unique chance to more people in developing and demonstrating their talents.

With you help we will build an innovative social network, mobile app, online store and open it to a worldwide audience.

By investing in building this unique "bridge of art"  you will help to connect art from east to west and vise versa.

We swiftly realized the need and hunger in Arab Society to express their talents on a worldwide stage and to find a platform to share creative work through expressing themselves openly and honestly. We observed their need for support and encouragement with this and decided to dedicate our page to be open for everybody with a talent.
As a result of this understanding and with the technical ability to satisfy the latent demand for creative outlet, we achieved success from the very first day.
Today, two years after the initial launch, and without any external investment, we are already by far the largest online stage in the Arab World with more than 580,000 followers and around 20,000 creative contributions in various fields such as painting, photography, design, writing, handwork, music and many more.
Our ability to offer exposure, provide encouragement, appreciation and development of their talents - gives them great hope. By providing a platform for Arab talent that is open to all, simple to access and completely free of charge we have unlocked tremendous potential across this vast audience.
Building hope for so many talented people has become a deeply moving experience and commitment for us – to be honest our work in this enterprise has  developed into a life purpose.
We hope that you too will become  a partner in building this unique, innovative and constructive online social platform for talented Arab people.

We encourage YOUR participation and hope you join us in sharing the rewards  to be gained from providing the moral, financial and material support and encouragement necessary to grow this exceptionally innovative enterprise to reach its full potential.
In short we ask you to join us on this amazing platform where the wide Arab audience can explore and share their fields of interest and consume the art they most love.Your support will provide a unique chance to more people in developing and demonstrating their talents.With you help we will build an innovative social network, mobile app, online store and open it to a worldwide audience.By investing in building this unique "bridge of art"  you will help to connect art from east to west and vise versa.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Colorful Idea

Hi, i’m Queen Hephzibah. On most days, I’m a Kenyan Creative Entrepreneur, specializing in Arts and Cultural Management. I believe that we must share in our dreams in order to realize them; and so, I invite you into mine. Her name is Switcharoo, and her aim is to use art as a tool to connect and empower emerging creatives.

Switcharoo is a two-part, Franco-Kenyan, Artist Exchange Program uniquely designed to enable the intercultural and interdisciplinary sharing of skills, experiences, interests and knowledge between young French and Kenyan artists in fun, creatively productive ways, that will expand their capacity for mutual, personal and professional benefits. Our unique two-part model gives all our artists-in-residency the opportunity to share in and consume both the Kenyan and French air, TOGETHER.

OUR COLORFUL IMPACT

Part A of our two-part exchange was hosted  for a month in Kenya this past December (2018). It marked the successful launch of our two-way exchange, when 12 musicians and visual artists from both France and Kenya came together in ways that undoubtedly gave life to new, meaningful and colorful connections. These 12 artists learned French and Kiswahili (as well as our official Switcharoo language; Frenglish), along with the dynamics and impact of painting forgotten walls in Nairobi, and the art of Kenyan  jamming. Their collective vibration and artistic collaboration quite literally broke the news:

 

Together, they’ve witnessed and borrowed inspiration from Kenya’s vast landscapes and built networks that are still impacting their career development. Most of all, they have made a difference.

 

This being a first-time thing, we had a little; a little time, space, money, equipment, energy and even patience (sometimes). On our own, all this would be impossible in so many ways, but sometimes the big change lies in something as simple as bringing unlikely communities together because by connecting, we have all made Impact through art, that would have been limited if done alone.

But this is just  half of the story. And we need your help to complete the narrative.

 

The Colorful Mission

Part B of Switcharoo is set to take place in France for the whole month August of 2019. Our destination is Nantes/St Nazaire; a region bursting with international creativity, and tons of green spaces. A region that I personally came to fall in love with as a Kenyan living there, and one that I know for sure will give our Kenyan artists unparalleled exposure to the French cultural waves and artistic vibrations as they reconnect with their new international peers.

 

We are working with various partners to ensure a successful programme, but to complete our colorful narrative, we’re going to need to raise a further €26,000. And we need YOUR help because everything on this budget is essential; every cent you can gift us counts!

Your gifts will go towards providing a month of shelter, transport, food, art and production supplies for our artists, and facilitation for our hardworking team; some of the basic essentials we need to continue this revolutionary exchange of Franco-Kenya artistic collaboration!

How To Contribute:

We’ve made it easy for you to extend your support; both locally in Kenya (through Mchanga) and internationally (through Indiegogo), where we’ve got a variety of pledge options for you to choose from.

For every amount donated, you will receive  handmade gifts of gratitude personally designed by our resident artists, such as notepads, t-shirts and tote bags.

FAQ's:

    'I've got access to stuff on your budget, but not the funds. How can i still help?'

     

     

    Funding aside, sharing our campaign within your networks is a way of using your voice to say “Hey world, I believe in our colorful connection”! Your support will not only be making a difference in the lives of our 12 resident artists, but also in all the people that their collaborative creativity, and their passion is meant to reach!! You will be claiming your space in the creation of #AColorfulConnection.

    And, If we go over our capaign target, we'll use the overflow to develop our secure online hub for artists in Kenya and France to collaborate digitaly!

    As we say here in Switcharoo, Cheers Baba, for claiming your space in the creation of #Acolorfulconnection !!

     

    OUR COLORFUL TEAM

    Our Colorful Dreamer

     

    Our Colorful Ambassadors

story:
The Initiative

It is perfectly clear that Donald Trump is attacking the postal system as a means to keep people from voting.

Our campaign is simple. We print postcards with George Floyd's image on it and mail them to the White House. Then we mail one to you too, pre-stamped, in a separate envelope.  That's it. 3 stamps total, $1.50 in  postage for the USPS.  If Donald Trump wins this November, he'll get a reminder that we are still here, we're still standing, and history will hold him accountable. If he loses (OH HAPPY DAY!) he'll get a glorious reminder that you can't dismantle democracy and disavow an entire group of people in your sad quest for power.  Also,  you've sent him a passive aggressive F*You (hopefully thousands of them) and made a political statement.  Either way, apart from all the divisiveness, a lot of beauty has come from everything that's happened and a lot of that can be seen in the myriad of art pieces that have been created and the warmth and solidarity of all kinds of people coming together. Everyone should see some of the beautiful work that was created, and this is one way to help make that happen.

 

Frequently-asked questions:

Won't sending a bunch of postcards right now just add to the burden that the post office has to deal with?

Yes. And for that specific reason we will not be sending ANY postcards out prior to November 3rd because we do not want to interfere with the post office's ability to process ballots. We will most likely wait until at least the 15th of November before we send any postcards out. We will be buying the postage prior to the election however. Most likely as we've passed our funding goal should we get there. Updates will be made as that happens.

What will the postcards look like? Here, let me show you.

The messages sent will change depending on the outcome of the election.

 

Risks & Challenges

The piece or art that is George Floyd's portrait has already been completed. At minimum we can produce and fulfill the orders for our initial campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help...share. We appreciate you both ways.

story:
Something was missing

Usually emerging artists are at the mercy of galleries and gallery owners, these people decide wether something is chic enough to be added for sale - while taking a hefty fee out of it (this can be up to 70%!).

This doesn't allow great artists to showcase their work and they are sometimes lost in the void due the lack of platforms & opportunity to show their work.

There wasn't a transparent environment which allowed Artists to showcase their work purchases to happen safely.

This is where we came in.

Launched during pandemic

We launched the platform in April this year (2020) and it took off immediately, I mean immediately! This was partly because people were stuck at home and were open for new innovations.

We support transparent pricing, low fees and curate the pieces added to our platform - meaning that a level of artistry is maintained on our platform.

We got our 1st sale within the first week - which was insane. And since then we continue to growth at a rate of 100% a month having attracted users from all around the world.

You can find our site at www.himassa.com

 

 

Our future & why are we raising funds?

We want to bring more transparency and freedom to the art market - let's ditch the elitists telling you what you ought or ought not like. Our mantra is: "if you like it, buy it."

 

And if you are mad enough to call yourself an artist, we want you to have a place to monetize your creativity.

Our goal is to put more freedom and opportunity to the hands of the creatives, this means arranging pop up galleries for our users in Berlin, Helsinki, Japan, UK and United States. And to provide more options to our users in terms of selling their work.

 

Where are the funds going?

- Adding the option for users to sell prints of their original artwork

- More freedom for purchasing (instalments)

- More tools for artists

- More transactions for our artists (see our perks)

- Arrange a pop a gallery to showcase some of the trending works & artists

- Add more sleek design to the site

 

Basically everything is going to the community.

 

 

Follow us on Insta!

story:
Short Story...

My name is Griffin Ess. I have been a professional illustrator for almost 10 years. Before that I was a professional tarot reader. I have instructed over 2 dozen tarot readers, nine of which are professional readers to this day.

I've been developing this deck for just about a year. The art is entirely composed and I'm in the final designing and fine tuning stages to turn them into ready-to-print files. The toughest hurdle though is printing the decks in bulk and then trying to find people and shops interested. Doing that in chunks is not an ideal way to start, hence this campaign. This is essentially a pre-order pool to see if there is enough interest for a large enough bulk order to make it worth my while.

I need your interest and support to entwine with my work to bring it from art into use! Without you... this may just be another faded light.

Long Story...

Objective:

The objective of this campaign is to raise money to place a minimum print order for a large bulk order of tarot decks. The larger the order I can place, the less it costs me per deck, the higher the likelihood I can get it marketed around, and the more energy I can put into support aspects like video reading instructionals.

Your Support:

The easiest way to support this project is to pre-order your deck via one of the many nifty reward options. These decks would also make lovely gifts for anyone you know who is a fan of tarot, a reader of tarot, interested in art artifacts, or can make 78 neat little individual gifts for friends or party favors.

About the deck:

The Dreamscape Deck takes the best traits of tarot while removing some of the inherent confusions of it and modernizing certain sensibilities of the card meanings. It lives between it's surreal imagery, coherent compositions, and unmistakable symbolism.

Griffin's history and perspectives on tarot:

I've been reading for others since I was a teen and spent 5 years doing it professionally before switching strictly into teaching. My instructions have been directed almost exclusively towards those who intend to read professionally. I've never been a fan of "Reading by the Book" though I understand the casual reader's need for reference. As such have created this deck to be read simply by looking at the narratives of the images with titles that should make the contexts of those narratives as obvious as possible.

The creation process:

This deck has taken a lot of preparation. Each card has gone through multiple revisions and edits adding more depth to some or striping down the clutter of others until each has the proper weight and balance. Five of my favorite decks, ranging from classic to modern, were consulted card by card looking for the common threads and messages between them while noting the variations on themes and accents each creator wove into the images to inform the meanings of each of the cards of the Dreamscape Tarot deck. The deck is meaningful without being judgemental. The images are informative without being overwhelming.

Variations from traditional tarot decks:

First, commonly confused classical characters have had their visual messages clarified and their labels changed (The Hierophant becomes Puppeteer and The Star becomes Wanderer). Normally tedious numerical cards of suits have been given personalities of their own (Three of Wands becomes Thief of Wands and Five of Coins becomes Collector of Coins) without losing the numerical symbolism within in the images (meaning, Thief of Wands will still incorporate 3 wands).

Lastly, the gender identities of various types have been stripped away (Kings, Queens, Pages, & Knights become Crafters, Reapers, Spirits, & Guardians) to remove the common problems with reading where the character's gender is confused as being representative of the gender of a real person involved in the reading instead of representative of certain gender associated traits.

These changes have all been carefully curated to improve the readability of these cards and minimize stumbling blocks or disconnections between viewer and card.

So... is this an artistic deck or a readable deck?

Both. I've done everything within my skill sets to make it creative, beautiful, practical, and readable. Having dedicated my life to my artwork and so much of my time to teaching readers, I'd never dream of offering a deck that was either unattractive or unusable.

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge this project currently faces is raising the funds to affordably print a large enough stock of physical decks. The success of this campaign would solve that immediately however. Unlike a lot of crowdfunding projects, most of the work is already completed. Now it's just down to some minor formatting and the ordering. There are maybe 30 hours of work left (out of around 700 hours) at the posting of this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has the disposable income to contribute to this kind of project. Some just might not be interested in tarot nor the artwork at all. You can still help though!

Get the word out! Tell your artistic or tarot minded friends. Sharing this project with your friends, family, or anyone you think might be interested is very easy, just click one of the sharing buttons to repost this campaign for others to consider.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read all my nonsense. Thanks even more for your support of this project and for sharing it with your friends!

And always remember... you're awesome!

story:
about nøthing mag

A collective comprised of local creatives, Nothing Mag is an independent media outlet based out of Orange County, CA. We’re firm believers that nothing comes from nothing and it’s this exact thought that inspired us to create something— Nothing Mag, an online hub and tangible magazine whose objective is to release timeless, and original content geared toward, but not limited to music, art, culture and more.

 

why we started...

Our team came together because we saw a need to push more visibility on local artists that don’t get the recognition they deserve. We also saw there was a need for the community to be able to find these artists in one place... Not only that, our belief is that Orange County is at times overshadowed by major cities and misrepresented on TV. We started Nothing Mag as a passion project to showcase the best of what Orange County has to offer.

 

issue 01

Our team started in mid-2017 and established in Nothing Mag in April 2018. After about a year and a half, we’re finally excited to launch a full magazine featuring our best pieces that highlight your favorite artists. Our first issue is a dual cover featuring The Garden, our very first show that we covered. 

 

Nøthing Fest

In celebration of the launch of our magazine, on July 6th, 2019 we are having a music and art festival at the Garden Amp in Garden Grove, CA. It will featuring 3 stages and 28 bands. Photos from this festival will be added to the final print of the magazine.

Will
story_txt: about nøthing magA collective comprised of local creatives, Nothing Mag is an independent media outlet based out of Orange County, CA. We’re firm believers that nothing comes from nothing and it’s this exact thought that inspired us to create something— Nothing Mag, an online hub and tangible magazine whose objective is to release timeless, and original content geared toward, but not limited to music, art, culture and more. why we started...Our team came together because we saw a need to push more visibility on local artists that don’t get the recognition they deserve. We also saw there was a need for the community to be able to find these artists in one place... Not only that, our belief is that Orange County is at times overshadowed by major cities and misrepresented on TV. We started Nothing Mag as a passion project to showcase the best of what Orange County has to offer. issue 01Our team started in mid-2017 and established in Nothing Mag in April 2018. After about a year and a half, we’re finally excited to launch a full magazine featuring our best pieces that highlight your favorite artists. Our first issue is a dual cover featuring The Garden, our very first show that we covered.  Nøthing FestIn celebration of the launch of our magazine, on July 6th, 2019 we are having a music and art festival at the Garden Amp in Garden Grove, CA. It will featuring 3 stages and 28 bands. Photos from this festival will be added to the final print of the magazine.Will

story:
Wajda Art is an exceptional art project about Polish cinematography master – Andrzej Wajda. We are a foundation from Poland called MultiArt and our purpose is to promote art, young artists and to organize inspiring events. Wajda Art  is our newest project – a great enterprise that started over 10 years ago in cooperation with Andrzej Wajda. Wajda Art Project is about releasing a box which includes 2 unique publications and a movie about Wajda’s artwork, drawings, inspirations and creative process.

The Wajda Art project includes two books – “Drawings” and “Inspirations”, and a movie “Andrzej Wajda. My inspirations”.

  • "Drawings" is an unique publication showing Andrzej Wajda from his less known artistic site: a drawer. The album consists of a few hundred of selected works of the artist that show his travels (e. g. to Japan), biographical portraits of known artists and projects made by Wajda to support his work on movies and theatrical spectacles. This publication gives an inimitable opportunity to admire artistic talent for drawing that he had and see the world through his eyes.

  • "Inspirations" – in this album Wajda explains selection of art pieces which affected his art the most and inspired many of his movie scenes, which have later became a part of Polish culture history and have taken Polish film on the international arena. He talks about his favorite paintings from old and modern periods – starting from baroque coffin portraits and finishing on modern young artists' works. Each from over hundred art pieces Andrzej Wajda comments in an unique way.

  • "Andrzej Wajda. My Inspirations" - a documentary movie (60 min.) in several language versions, in which Andrzej Wajda talks about his fascination with Polish painting and the influence of Polish art on his film and theater work. In this documentary we show some of the works presented in the albums and fragments of films including frames that are quotes from paintings.

See more details on our website:

www.multiartprojects.com

See the excerpt from the movie:

 

Wajda Art is probably one of the most important cultural projects of 2018 that will tell about Poland and Polish art in different way than it is described in official media. We want to reach a wide audience from all around the world,  tell a story about one of the most prominent Polish movie director and keep a memory about Andrzej Wajda alive.

Andrzej Wajda, who passed away in 2016, has left an incredible legacy that deserves to be shared and recognized around the world. We believe that Wajda Art will be one of the most relevant art and cultural project of the year and one of the most significant ones of all times considering Polish culture. We need your support to make it happen and to keep the memory of the Polish cinematography master alive.

To enable the world to these unique materials we need your help. Funds raised thanks to crowdfunding will allow us not only to just release these materials in a form of special box. We want to share these amazing stuff - that will show the creative process of the outstanding director and Polish art from a different angle – with the possibly largest number of people around the world. To do this, thanks to the fundraising we will translate and release albums and film in many language versions. We will also allocate some of the funds to the distribution and promotion.

Crowdfunding makes it possible to offer funders an affordable price for items prepared specially for them. We want to emphasize that our project can only be realized thanks to donors. In order to allow anyone willing to participate in the collection, we have prepared various packages:

  • mini digital set: screensaver, graphic for desktop, graphic for phone – 5$
  • postcards: 15 postcards with artworks of Andrzej Wajda (10x15 cm) packed in an envelope + mini digital set – 15$
  • standard version box: 2 books (Drawings and Inspirations) and access code to the movie + mini digital set – 84$
  • your name in the book: standard version box + your name placed on a honorary list of funders + mini digital set – 99$
  • collector’s box: standard box extended by 16 drawings + publishers‘ thank you note + your name on the honorary list of the associate publishers + mini digital package 1 – 199$
  • platinum box - limited edition of 200: standard box extended by 16 drawings (box contains artificial leather-bound books with press lettering) + publishers‘ personalized thank you note + your name placed on a honorary list of funders + mini digital set – 1000$
  • Andrzej Wajda trip: 7-days trip: Cracov - Warsaw - Gdańsk. The history of Wajda – 3000$

Andrzej Wajda was definitely one of the most talented, genius directors in Polish cinematography. His masterpieces are appreciated all around the world, by the cinema and art enthusiasts as well as famous artists from the industry. He has been rewarded with the most prestigious awards in the movie industry - Honorary Oscar, the Palme d'Or, Honorary Golden Lion and Golden Bear Awards. He passed away in 2016, at the age of 90. He left an outstanding artwork collections and incredible legacy that deserves to be shared and acknowledged amongst cinematography and art supporters.

What is the purpose of Wajda Art Project? First and foremost, our biggest goal is to promote Polish cinematography and art around the world - we believe that it deserves to be recognized and appreciated. We also would like to show the less know side of Andrzej Wajda as a comprehensive artist – not only director, but also drawer and painter. This project will also introduce the audience to a creative process of a master and will for sure help us to keep the memory of Andrzej Wajda and his artwork alive. Taking into consideration how commercialized modern cinematography is, we also desire to show an artistic site of the cinema and to prove that it can be a very complex artistic process.

Wajda Art Project is aimed primarily at lovers of cinematography who value real film art and great artists in the industry. Share information about our project with your friends - they can take part in its implementation and appear on the list of honorary donors! Even if you are not able to help financially, your sharing or just a mention about our project is extremely important and valuable – it will help us in its development!

Martin Scorsese
 

 

Agnieszka Holland, Allan Starski

story:
Hi!

I have been selected to represent Nepal at Miss Teen Tourism Globe 2019 which is an absolute honour! Sticking to the motto of the pageant "Yes we can" and "Education is the key to success", as Miss Teen Tourism Nepal 2018, I feel that it is time to give back to the community. The area I have decided to try to bring the change (even if it's the tiniest) is my birthplace: Chitwan.

I believe that if I take few girls who cannot afford going to school by paying their school fees and providing them stationery items and uniforms, I am not just changing their lives and their family's lives, I am changing their communities. Secondly, girls are known to miss many days of school due to their monthly menstruation cycle which has negative impact on their studies. In order to keep their attendance going up, I am planning to distribute good sanitary pads to the girls.

From my research, I have came to a conclusion that parents might have some role in stopping girls for getting higher education. Since, most of the family of Chitwan rely on agriculture, they are sending their girls to the fields instead of sending them to school. In some extreme cases, girls are forced to get married before completing their high school. In order to stop this, I feel there is a need to make parents aware about importance of education and encourage them to send their girls to school.

I believe my purpose on this earth is to live out my identity . I deeply desire to be able to remind girls of their true identity, equip them with the tools they need to be successful, and empower them to live a purpose driven life. I am hoping that this pageant will give me the opportunity to love on, and pour into, my competitors and each and every person that I come in contact with. I am hoping that this competition will also help me as I build a platform to start speaking into the lives of girls around the world.

Despite being rich in natural resources and beauty there is not much tourist flow in Nepal . I will try my best to promote tourism in Nepal.

I would really appreciate if you could help me in this journey because it's not about how much you donate; it's about making a huge difference in someone's life".

"You are not just helping a girl with big dreams but you are helping a girl to help thousands of girls to dream even bigger".- Priyana Acharya

Thank you,
Priyana

story:
Collector's Edition Vinyl

I am celebrating the 1-month anniversary of the hottest radio album of the year! Own a piece of history with a special anniversary edition vinyl copy of "Kevin Getz - On Air"

$40.00 covers the cost of having the vinyl made and packaged. I'm looking for roughly 30 backers to reach the goal. All copies of the album will come with digital download code.

Shipping within Canada but if you are international let me know and I'll see what I can make happen.

Listen to the Album Free at KevinGetz.ca

What I Need & What You Get

Having vinyl made can be expensive which is why I'm looking to place a minimum order of 30. Anything less than that and the cost becomes too much per unit. All copies will come with a digital download code.

  • I'm offering black vinyl and clear vinyl options.
  • Both options come with the choice of authentic autograph across the front or no autograph for a bit more.
  • You can also choose to reserve a place in my acceptance speeches for any and all awards this album wins in the future.

The Plan

I've found a place that will make a small number of vinyl copies. I'll be placing this one and only order. Super limited edition. Pass them on to your grand kids and tell the story of possibly Canada's first radio album on vinyl. In order to keep costs down, most savings will be made in slower shipping. It will take a while but you will get a special limited edition 1-month anniversary collector's edition vinyl.

story:
Mini Castle™ - Buildable DIY Mini Castles & Organizer

Mini Castles are great for organizing your pens and pencils on your desk.  It can even fit larger items such as scissors, tool drivers, and small accessories too.  If you love to build things and stay organized in the process, you will grow to love Mini Castle!

Mini Castle is for kids aged 5 and up.  Each model kit comes step by step directions to assemble your own castle.  Glue is provided to keep each piece intact.  Once fully built, kids are free to paint / color / design it any way that they want.  It's a great way for kids to learn how to build structures and unleash their creativity.  

Mini Castle™ comes in three different sizes:
Robin Hood Castle - After assembly


Merlin's Castle - After assembly


Royal Castle - After assembly

 

Creators

Hi, my name is Mike Bang. I am a professional model maker and industrial designer and an avid 3D creator. I am very excited about this campaign.  I've always wanted to design a product for kids so that they can learn how to build structures and grow their own imagination.  With your support, this project can come to life and hopefully bring fond memories for everyone.

Hi my name is Randy Lee.  I am a global business developer and marketing specialist.  I enjoy photography, filmmaking, and web development in my leisure time. I'm a fan of Game of Thrones and the book / show may or may not be one of my inspirations for contributing to the project.

 

    Share Our Love for Castles

    If you love castles as much as I do, here's what we are guaranteeing you:

    • Anyone who supports this campaign will receive a Mini Castle regardless of whether we reach our goal or not. 
    • We will invite you to a special VIP group for other innovative products that we will release in the future.
    • Not only will we help people stay organized but we'll also have fun along the way!

       

    Overcoming Risks and Challenges

    Our risk and challenges are quite low for this product. We have financially invested in the equipment to help manufacture these goods and we feel comfortable with the timeline that we have provided to our supporters. Should any changes occur in our timeline, we will be updating this page to keep you informed of all new updates.

story:
Beautiful America Project

 

For the last 10 years I have been creating all types of Fantasy Art. Such as calendars ,art books, print work and clothing, using both models and non models, with many people asking how can I do that, I would love to have artwork like that done?. Well now we have it.

The previous problem being many of the people who have wanted to work with me are several states away or in another country. Normally I shoot my own photos then create the edits. This time you will be able to upload your photos from anywhere to have a piece created as a sponsor.

In a world that has become unhappy and anti so many things, art helps bring a smile to many people. To watch the transformation from a normal picture into something beautiful. Art is meant as a creation, take a photo , piece of paper or other medium and create something different , appealing and exciting to the eye.

For some it is beauty on land, sea or air, for others it is to become a creature of nightmares. Riding into battle as a warrior or becoming a superhero to allow your imagination to be free, you can be whatever you want in fantasy art.

 

So for the first time ever, (our most unique perk) I will be doing a 1st edition art book/magazine of everyday people all over the world being turned into fantasy art called Beautiful America. There will be a limited number of pages, if we exceed this a second edition will be added.

So not only will you get a stunning digital art edit creation from your own photo but you will also be in our first Beautiful America Art Book!.

 

Who we can edit:

Pretty much anybody, as long as it is legal and not deliberately offensive

1 person per photo, or sponsor a couples edit with maximum of two people in the same photo

photos with pets in them are not extra,we like critters and yes we can edit them as well.

 

 

General idea of what you like: Choose from the below

This will make it easier to decide how to edit your photos,

 

Mermaids/Sirens

Fairy's

Warriors/Vikings

Creatures

Gothic Horror

Vampires/Werewolves

Elves

Superhero- which one

Surprise me

A Few guidelines :

Once you become a sponsor you will be contacted with a email address to send the photos to.

We ask you send 3 different photos with 300 dpi , one of which will be used in large format to create your image.

We will accept cellphone pics for this ,however they have to be at least large format and 300 dpi

all photos must be clear and in focus.

 

The biggest challenge is to make this a art positive project , without art the world would be just black,white and blah, time to colorize and create. This is a way to give everyone the opportunity to show their true self , done in a very creative form as well as be published in the book.

 

This project will take about 1-2 months to complete as edits can take anywhere from 2 hours to 12 hours to finish depending on the type chosen and if freehand drawing will be added in after as well.

Pictures sent in early enough will be posted as updates as we work on them so sponsors can see actual progress.

 

Legals:

 

If you are not the photographer, or have used a professional photographer you must have permission to have them edited. We will not be liable for any unauthorized use. By sending us the photos you are verifying you have permission to use /have photos edited.

If you are having pictures done for your child you must be the parent /legal guardian, by sending photos you are agreeing that you are.

No offensive photos we have the right to refuse any image we deem that way.

story:
Pre-order the dragon of your choice!

All 11 different designs have unlocked on Kickstarter, so I've kept the pre-orders going here on Indiegogo! For $15 you get one pin including Domestic Shipping. I'll contact you to find out which design you would like. 

I've been sketching out RPG (Roll playing game) or D&D type dragons for years. I've always been a big RPGer ever since RPG games were paper and pencil and included games like Dungeons and Dragons. My favorite thing was creating a character and coming up with all the stats. I would also always draw my character in dragon form and would normally picked a druid or ranger as my class. Later when MMORPGs (Massive Multiplayer Online Role Playing Games) became a thing, I was hooked. From EverQuest to Guild Wars 2, I played just about all of them. 

Being a huge fan of RPGs, I thought it would be cool to take some of my dragon designs and make them into a set of enamel pins. 

Each pin will be done in soft enamel and be about 2" across or tall at the widest area. 

Why soft enamel? I've done both hard enamel and soft enamel in the past. Unfortunately, the hard enamel process of polishing the pin flat losses some of critical details. I may add hard enamel as a stretch goal later.  Check out the link to my video showing the difference between hard enamel and soft enamel. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2JH05JgI6Mk

All designs are unlocked!! 11 Different Dragon Designs
story_txt: Pre-order the dragon of your choice!All 11 different designs have unlocked on Kickstarter, so I've kept the pre-orders going here on Indiegogo! For $15 you get one pin including Domestic Shipping. I'll contact you to find out which design you would like. I've been sketching out RPG (Roll playing game) or D&D type dragons for years.
