story:
Short Summary

Hi there!  My name is Diane of Diane Ludwig Designs.  I am here to introduce our fun and creative “Dolly” and seek funding for our company.  My background includes over 20 years in the corporate world and working and living abroad.  I combine my lifelong passion for art and textiles with a keen eye for aesthetics in the creation of “Dolly." 

             

Dolly's unique branding is created from my own artwork, mostly watercolors, printed on oilcloth, that is 100% cotton with PVC coating.  We chose this material for its durability, waterproofing and originality for both the interior AND exterior. 

The entire Dolly, inside and out, is double strength and can be easily cleaned with a sponge and mild soap.  Our products are aimed to last many many years and comes with a three year warranty. 

       

Dolly is a creative, trendy, functional and reliable substitute for the cheaper, unsustainable bags and trolleys with a lack of personality.  Dolly is vibrant and its color shines brightly amid other designs.  Dolly is crafted with attention to detail.  We have chosen oilcloth to give Dolly its elegance.

It has a high gloss finish for aesthetics and weatherproofing and its fun designs will never fail to generate a happy reaction.  Dolly is also a brilliant eco-substitute for plastic and paper bags.  We have chosen fun and colorful images for our designs with our initial designs offering of fruits, vegetables, mixed groceries, lemons and fish.

                  

I am seeking a minimum investment of $65,000, which will cover manufacturing of the trolleys and totes and other company associated costs.  I have selected a fixed campaign as we require the projected amount to fulfill the demand. This campaign will enable me to clarify my marketability of our products, designs, pricing and demographics.  Any funding beyond the $65,000 will be reinvested into the business development, building a robust website, IT, marketing related activities and project based consultants.  To date, Dolly has been funded by myself, friends and family and made possible by generous encouragement and help of my talented resources.

                          

            

For our first campaign we have discounted our Dolly products 20% from their MSRP; $115 for the Trolley and $48 for our colorful Totes.   

We have offer a 'Bulk' purchase Perk here and via our website, for commercial or individual resale.  We will correspond with you via email and organize shipping costs.  This perk consists of 25 mixed units (5 of each) at a 40% discount; $2160 for the Trolley and $900 for the Totes.  The MSRP for the Trolleys is $144 and $60 for the Totes leaving a gross profit of $1,440 for the Trolleys and $600 for the Totes.  This does not include shipping and relevant taxes and duties, if applicable.

Our primary objective is to deliver a product that gives people joy with its vibrant colors and fun designs as well as being ultra reliable and practical companion for everyday needs.  We plan to begin selling Dolly via Indiegogo, our website (www.dianeludwigdesigns.com), Amazon, Etsy and eventually niche boutiques and selective retail stores internationally.  Our aim is to add a Social Enterprise element to the company in due course. 

Dolly is a brand new start-up.  We have many ideas for the future of Dolly and its product line that we can incorporate our creative designs.  We aim to bring fun and artistic motifs to many everyday products and make people happy.

                             

Kindly share our campaign with friends, family and colleagues and let us know if they are interested in finding out more about Dolly and our future products.  

Please view our website and Facebook page and thank you again for your time.  We look forward to hearing from you!


SHIPPING RATES

                                                        For Trolley                          For Tote

USA, Puerto Rico & Guam:                $35                                     $20

Canada & Mexico:                                $65                                     $50

EU:                                                            $70                                     $55

Rest of the World:                                 $85                                     $60


Please Note:

·  Shipments may be subject to import duties and other local taxes.

·  If estimated shipping prices are less than calculated, there will be a possible reimbursement on shipping.

Again, thank you for your interest in Dolly!

story:
Some things are meant to be shared.

My name is Faye Hall, and I am a painter. I started painting as a child, but switched to advertising design in order to make a living and raise my beautiful children. In my later years, I've returned to my original passion of canvas & brush.

I think that art needs to mean something - to resonate with people's souls and encourage others. How best to do that? Share it! 

I am painting today because others have encouraged me, inspired me and mentored me throughout the years. I’d like to show you the results with my book.

I am an administrative assistant by day to Canadian singer/songwriter Steve Bell in Winnipeg, Canada. I am painting today, because he took an interest in my art, allowed me to paint his travel photography and even commissioned some personal projects.

The last few years, I’ve experienced a prolific out-pouring of art and stories that I believe need to be shared in this book.

ART begets ART will explain the sources of my inspiration, which include music, the poetry of Malcolm Guite in the U.K., my faith and life stories of my own and others. The cover shows an emotional painting representing my 20 year journey with my mother through her experiences with dementia.

Steve Bell shared his stories, music and photography with me. Malcolm Guite shared his poetry and charismatic face for five portraits (so far) and Dr. Charles Mulli has allowed me to share the faces of a few of his 10,000 Kenyan orphans whom he has helped over a period of 25 years.

The least I can do is share these paintings with you. In a book. Looking at photos on the web is fine, but it’s not until you have a hard copy in your hands, that you see and feel the value of the work that has been done. 

You can partner with me through several financial levels. Each one comes with it's own rewards! (see side) If you've ever considered purchasing one of my prints or originals, this is the time to do it - and gain the bonus rewards! Shipping is included with each reward, and everything will be sent to you in the fall, once the book is released. (Painting perks will be available sooner. Some paintings available are featured in the art book.)

PERK EXAMPLES: 

"The Biggest Family in the World" Children's Book. Written by Paul H. Boge and illustrated by Faye Hall. Released Dec./14 by Castle Quay Books.


ART PRINTS: Choose from one of these unframed prints, signed by the artist. Also includes a painting story of the painting, signed by the artist.

(Bethlehem Doors, Daddy's Mandolin, Faith, Bliss in the Woods, Bihar Family and Mud Buddies)

FRAMED PRINTS: Some examples of prints in metal frames with glass. A full list of available framed prints is available by contacting faye@fayehall.com. Also includes a separate story of the painting, signed by the artist.


ORIGINAL PAINTINGS: An original painting will be shipped to you with it's own painting story and certificate of authenticity. The offer includes paintings from the book: "The Biggest Family in the World" written by Paul H. Boge and illustrated by Faye Hall.

GIFT/DONATION IDEA: Purchase a painting as a gift or as a donation for your favourite school or church. (EG: An original 18" x 24" painting from "The Biggest Family in the World" in the hallway of a school or church will inspire children.)

See this link for a list of available paintings. (Click on Available Paintings)

(Excluded paintings: Faye's personal collection and the cover for the MCF book.)

Page 15 of "The Biggest Family in the World"
See more of my paintings at fayehall.com

In the GALLERY tab above, you may want to view a few short videos showing my work.
VIEW all of the paintings from "The Biggest Family in the World" at this link.

What this project costs

I have carefully estimated the cost to be about $3,500, including art photography, editing, layout design, distribution and printing hardcopies. I am planning to have the book self-printed. The paintings will be professionally photographed for the highest quality of reproduction.


The Impact

My book will not make a huge impact in the world, but it will encourage myself and other artists to work toward that which inspires, resonates and creates beauty. 

Crowd-funding is essentially pre-ordering a copy of this book, and will help me to know if there is an interest in the project, enabling me to predict how many hardcopies to order.


Risks & Challenges

There isn't a huge cost to this project, so if my goal is not reached, the world will not end.  If the goal is exceeded - all the better, and I will be forever grateful and encouraged. It will certainly help with buying more canvases and plan for future projects!

NOTE: Your credit card will not be charged until the project is successfully funded at the end of 60 days.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the project, I'd be honoured if you'd share this campaign with friends and associates. You can share:

  • The link to this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.

  • Link to "The Biggest Family in the World" Facebook page.

  • My Facebook page, The Art of Faye Hall and website at fayehall.com.

Thank you so much for your interest and support!

story:
Jet Packs and Cable Cars... on Mars!

Earlier this year I ran an Indiegogo campaign to pre-fund an order of the NASA Exoplanet travel bureau posters so that we could all get our hands on high quality prints of these awesome public domain pieces of art for a reasonable price compared to printing them one off. 

I am going to print these posters at full resolution on 24"x36"  high quality uncoated cover stock. The source images are from SpaceX's Flickr account 300 dpi jpg files.

Here are the details for each poster:

  • Valles Marineris
  • Phobos & Deimos
  • Olympus Mons

What We Need & What You Get

I need: enough capital (and expressed interest to do a run of at least 100 of each poster to make it economical.

The Perks

I'm simplifying this round, $65* gets you one of each 24" x 36" poster, printed on high quality, uncoated cover stock and shipped in a 3x30" Kraft Mailing tube, anywhere in the USA.** Poster does not include frame.

* Slight price increase due to shipping this batch of posters USPS Priority instead of Parcel Select (a.k.a. the tube mangler)

** Select the "Canadian Shipping" perk if you are shipping to Canada, select the "All Other International Shipping" perk if you are literally anywhere else.

Actual Posters

Risks & Challenges

This is super low risk. I am only doing a print run if I meet the funding goal. If I don't, this is an all or nothing campaign so you never get charged!

Plus, I have done this exact thing before!

Printing these commercially is legal due to SpaceX GRACIOUSLY putting these images in the public domain.

story:
Short Summary

My outrageously large wardobe collection which I use to make my YouTube and Patreon channel has gotten wildly out of hand.

So it's time to move to Sophie Island. A remote European location where I can work from, film all my videos (in privacy) and not be hounded by the press.

What We Need & What You Get

We havce all the facilities we need when we move in, we just need to raise the money to buy the location.

You however will recieve a large amount of exclusive content shot on the island and a chance to come and visit me there for a long exciting weekend away1

The Impact

Making YouTube videos has become a real passion and I adore doing it. However, I am limited int he time and rescources I can commit to it, so the plan is to set up my own location.

Not only a place to work from but also an exciting lifestyle destination I can share with my fans.

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge is raising the finance to purchase the location.

The natural beauty needs to be protected so I will be spending a lot of my down time looking after this glorious and historic location.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you can't spare money then please do share the campaign and encourage others to help us make this a reality.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Kövess minket a facebookon: https://www.facebook.com/roseverabell/

Szerelem, élet, halál és egy jó erős fekete – ez a címe a készülő könyvnek, amit Bojtor Verabellával közösen tervezünk megjelentetni, ennek beharangozó eseménye ez a kiállítás. A képeken egy elképzelt társasház lakói láthatók, Hajnalka néni, Hidegorrú Björn meg a Kékhajú Csaj és a többiek. Verabella elkezdte megrajzolni-megfesteni ezt a sorozatot, és amikor pár kép készen volt, akkor keresett meg azzal, hogy írjak rövid történeteket a képekhez. Azonnal ráálltam a dologra, hiszen számos közös van bennünk.

Először is mindketten szabadúszók vagyunk. A szabadúszót elsősorban nem arról lehet megismerni, hogy ott ugrik be a vízbe, ahol akar, hanem arról, hogy ül a teraszon, kávézik, és gondolkodik erősen. Komolyabbra fordítva a szót, Bojtor Verabella egy olyan illusztrátor, festő, grafikus, képzőművész, aki egy olvasó-festőember aki nagyon szeretne könyvet illusztrálni, de most először alakult úgy, hogy az ő képei mellé alakulnak a szövegek. Amikor a könyvet elkezdtük tervezgetni, elmesélte, hogy azért szeretné megcsinálni, mert rohadt sok kávét elfogasztott, elfogyaszt és még fog is elfogyasztani. Ha esik, ha fúj, a kávé, az gurul. És természetesen nem titkolt szándéka az is, hogy minél többen ismerjék meg a képein keresztül, hogy mit gondol a világról. Az a koncepciónk, hogy a Szerelem, élet, halál és egy jó erős fekete legyen egy felnőtteknek szóló mesekönyv, persze, a képeket a gyerekek is nézegethetik. Legyen ez egy játszós könyv, ami teljesen mentes minden kötöttségtől. Lehet a közepén kezdeni, vagy a legvégén, lehet csak egy oldalt elolvasni, vagy csak egyszerűen elmerülni a képek apró részleteiben. Visszatérve a szabadúszáshoz, mindkettőnk életét, kommunikációját meghatározó és nagyban megkönyítő terep a facebook – egymást is itt ismertük meg.

A Mokka köz 4-6. lakóiról szóló könyv megjelentetése érdekében indul ez a kampány a szponzorok felkutatására illetve közösségi finanszírozásra. Ez a könyv könyvesboltokban nem lesz fellelhető, itt lehet rendelni,támogatni a létrejöttét. A nyár elején rendezett kiállítás volt az első lépés afelé, hogy mind szélesebb körben terjedjen a hír a kávéskönyvünkről.

Magamról csak annyira utálok beszélni, amennyire egy átlagos introvertált, röviden azt mondanám el, hogy Budapesten szombathelyi vagyok, Szombathelyen budapesti. Független lény, aki ír, szervez, lát és tanul. Ennek egy része munka, de a másik része a nagyobb munka.

(Rózsa Melinda)

Kövess minket a facebookon: https://www.facebook.com/roseverabell/Szerelem, élet, halál és egy jó erős fekete – ez a címe a készülő könyvnek, amit Bojtor Verabellával közösen tervezünk megjelentetni, ennek beharangozó eseménye ez a kiállítás. A képeken egy elképzelt társasház lakói láthatók, Hajnalka néni, Hidegorrú Björn meg a Kékhajú Csaj és a többiek. Verabella elkezdte megrajzolni-megfesteni ezt a sorozatot, és amikor pár kép készen volt, akkor keresett meg azzal, hogy írjak rövid történeteket a képekhez. Azonnal ráálltam a dologra, hiszen számos közös van bennünk.
Először is mindketten szabadúszók vagyunk. A szabadúszót elsősorban nem arról lehet megismerni, hogy ott ugrik be a vízbe, ahol akar, hanem arról, hogy ül a teraszon, kávézik, és gondolkodik erősen. Komolyabbra fordítva a szót, Bojtor Verabella egy olyan illusztrátor, festő, grafikus, képzőművész, aki egy olvasó-festőember aki nagyon szeretne könyvet illusztrálni, de most először alakult úgy, hogy az ő képei mellé alakulnak a szövegek. Amikor a könyvet elkezdtük tervezgetni, elmesélte, hogy azért szeretné megcsinálni, mert rohadt sok kávét elfogasztott, elfogyaszt és még fog is elfogyasztani. Ha esik, ha fúj, a kávé, az gurul. És természetesen nem titkolt szándéka az is, hogy minél többen ismerjék meg a képein keresztül, hogy mit gondol a világról. Az a koncepciónk, hogy a Szerelem, élet, halál és egy jó erős fekete legyen egy felnőtteknek szóló mesekönyv, persze, a képeket a gyerekek is nézegethetik. Legyen ez egy játszós könyv, ami teljesen mentes minden kötöttségtől. A Mokka köz 4-6. lakóiról szóló könyv megjelentetése érdekében indul ez a kampány a szponzorok felkutatására illetve közösségi finanszírozásra. Ez a könyv könyvesboltokban nem lesz fellelhető, itt lehet rendelni,támogatni a létrejöttét. A nyár elején rendezett kiállítás volt az első lépés afelé, hogy mind szélesebb körben terjedjen a hír a kávéskönyvünkről.
Magamról csak annyira utálok beszélni, amennyire egy átlagos introvertált, röviden azt mondanám el, hogy Budapesten szombathelyi vagyok, Szombathelyen budapesti. Független lény, aki ír, szervez, lát és tanul. Ennek egy része munka, de a másik része a nagyobb munka.
